name: Garlic Ginger Stir-Fry
author: System
method: Heat 30 mL sesame oil in a wok. Add 5 g minced garlic and 5 g grated ginger, sauté for 1 minute.
Add 200 g sliced beef, cook until browned. Add 300 g mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots) and stir-fry for 5 minutes.
Mix in 30 mL soy sauce and 15 mL oyster sauce, cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve hot over steamed rice.
description: Quick and easy stir-fry with bold flavors of garlic and ginger, combined with tender beef and crisp vegetables.

name: Gnocchi with Pesto Sauce
author: System
method: Boil 500 g gnocchi according to package instructions, drain.
In a pan, heat 200 g prepared pesto and toss with the cooked gnocchi until coated.
Serve garnished with grated Parmesan and fresh basil leaves.
description: Soft gnocchi tossed in a rich basil pesto sauce, a simple yet satisfying Italian dish.

name: Green Bean Almondine
author: System
method: Steam 400 g green beans until tender-crisp.
In a skillet, melt 15 g butter and add 50 g sliced almonds, toast until golden.
Add the green beans and sauté for 2 minutes.
Season with salt and a squeeze of lemon juice.
Serve immediately.
description: Classic French side dish of green beans tossed with toasted almonds and butter, enhanced with a touch of lemon.

name: Grilled Goat Cheese and Fig Sandwich
author: System
method: Spread 100 g soft goat cheese on 4 slices of whole grain bread.
Top two slices with 6 sliced fresh figs and a sprinkle of fresh thyme.
Cover with the remaining bread slices and butter the outside of each sandwich.
Grill in a pan over medium heat until golden brown on both sides and the cheese is melted.
Serve hot.
description: Savory grilled sandwiches filled with creamy goat cheese and sweet figs, perfect for a gourmet lunch.

name: Garlic Butter Shrimp
author: System
method: Melt 50 g butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add 5 cloves minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add 400 g peeled and deveined shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until pink and cooked through.
Stir in 15 mL lemon juice and 5 g chopped parsley.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.
description: Quick and delicious shrimp cooked in a rich garlic butter sauce, finished with a splash of lemon juice.

name: Greek Yogurt Pancakes
author: System
method: In a bowl, mix 200 g Greek yogurt with 2 beaten eggs and 30 mL milk.
Add 150 g flour, 10 g sugar, 5 g baking powder, and a pinch of salt. Stir until just combined.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and pour 60 mL batter for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook until golden brown.
Serve with honey and fresh berries.
description: Fluffy and light pancakes made with Greek yogurt, offering a protein-rich breakfast option.

name: Garlic Parmesan Risotto
author: System
method: In a saucepan, heat 30 mL olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 finely chopped onion and 3 cloves minced garlic, cook until translucent.
Add 250 g Arborio rice, stir to coat with oil. Gradually add 1 L chicken broth, stirring constantly, until the liquid is absorbed and rice is creamy.
Stir in 50 g grated Parmesan, 15 g butter, and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
description: Creamy risotto enriched with garlic and Parmesan cheese, a luxurious and comforting meal.

name: Grilled Gouda Sandwich
author: System
method: Butter one side of 4 slices of sourdough bread. On the unbuttered side, layer 100 g sliced Gouda cheese and 50 g sliced ham.
Top with the remaining bread slices, buttered side up.
Grill in a skillet over medium heat until the bread is golden and the cheese is melted, about 3 minutes per side.
Serve hot.
description: A simple yet satisfying grilled cheese sandwich featuring smoky Gouda and ham on sourdough bread.

name: Ginger Honey Chicken
author: System
method: Marinate 4 chicken thighs in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 20 g grated ginger, 30 mL honey, and 2 cloves minced garlic for at least 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 200°C.
Place chicken in a baking dish and pour over the marinade.
Bake for 35 minutes, basting occasionally, until chicken is cooked through.
Serve with steamed rice and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
description: Sweet and spicy chicken thighs baked with a ginger honey glaze, perfect for an easy dinner.

name: Goat Cheese Stuffed Peppers
author: System
method: Halve 4 bell peppers and remove seeds. Place in a baking dish.
In a bowl, mix 200 g soft goat cheese, 50 g chopped walnuts, 5 g chopped thyme, and salt and pepper.
Stuff the peppers with the cheese mixture.
Drizzle with 15 mL olive oil and bake at 180°C for 20 minutes.
Serve warm, garnished with additional thyme.
description: Colorful bell peppers stuffed with a rich filling of goat cheese and walnuts, baked until tender.

name: Gazpacho Andaluz
author: System
method: In a blender, combine 1 kg chopped ripe tomatoes, 1 chopped cucumber, 1 chopped bell pepper, 1 small onion, and 2 cloves garlic until smooth.
Add 30 mL sherry vinegar, 60 mL olive oil, salt, and pepper. Blend until creamy.
Chill for at least 2 hours. Serve cold, garnished with diced cucumber, bell pepper, and croutons.
description: A refreshing cold soup from Andalusia, blending fresh vegetables with vinegar and olive oil, perfect for hot days.

name: Gingered Carrot Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic in 30 mL olive oil until soft.
Add 500 g chopped carrots, 15 g grated fresh ginger, and 1 L vegetable broth. Bring to a boil and then simmer for 30 minutes.
Puree the mixture in a blender until smooth.
Return to the pot, reheat gently, stir in 100 mL cream, and season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with a dollop of sour cream and chopped chives.
description: A smooth and flavorful soup made with fresh carrots and zesty ginger, enriched with a touch of cream.

name: Grilled Garlic Artichokes
author: System
method: Trim and halve 4 artichokes, and remove the chokes. Boil in water for 15 minutes until tender.
Drain and pat dry.
Mix 60 mL olive oil with 3 cloves minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Brush this mixture over the artichokes.
Grill on medium heat for 5 minutes per side until charred.
Serve with a lemon butter sauce for dipping.
description: Tender artichokes brushed with a garlic-infused olive oil, grilled to perfection.

name: Goat Cheese Crostini
author: System
method: Slice a baguette into 12 pieces and toast until golden.
Spread each slice with soft goat cheese.
Top with a mixture of chopped sun-dried tomatoes and basil.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze before serving.
description: Crisp toasted bread topped with creamy goat cheese and a tangy sun-dried tomato topping, drizzled with balsamic.

name: Green Goddess Chicken Skewers
author: System
method: Blend 100 g fresh herbs (parsley, tarragon, chives), 2 cloves garlic, 60 mL yogurt, juice of 1 lemon, salt, and pepper to make a marinade.
Cube 500 g chicken breasts and marinate for at least 1 hour.
Thread chicken onto skewers and grill on medium heat for 10 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through.
Serve with extra yogurt sauce for dipping.
description: Juicy chicken skewers marinated in a vibrant green goddess sauce, grilled to perfection.

name: Gnocchi with Sage Butter
author: System
method: Cook 500 g potato gnocchi in boiling water until they float to the top, then drain.
In a skillet, melt 50 g butter and add 10 fresh sage leaves. Cook until the butter is foamy and sage is crisp.
Toss gnocchi in the sage butter.
Serve sprinkled with grated Parmesan and cracked black pepper.
description: Soft potato gnocchi tossed in a nutty sage-infused butter sauce, topped with Parmesan.

name: Ginger Peach Chutney
author: System
method: Peel and chop 500 g ripe peaches. In a saucepan, combine peaches with 100 g sugar, 50 mL apple cider vinegar, 20 g grated ginger, and a pinch of cinnamon.
Simmer over low heat for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
Cool and store in jars. Serve as a condiment with grilled meats or cheese.
description: A sweet and spicy chutney made with fresh peaches and ginger, perfect for enhancing savory dishes.

name: Grilled Gorgonzola Polenta
author: System
method: Cook 200 g polenta in 1 L water with 5 g salt until thick. Stir in 50 g grated Gorgonzola until melted.
Spread polenta in a greased dish and chill until firm.
Cut into squares and grill over medium heat until char marks appear, about 4 minutes per side.
Serve hot, drizzled with olive oil and sprinkled with fresh rosemary.
description: Creamy polenta enriched with Gorgonzola cheese, grilled for a smoky finish.

name: Garlic Thyme Roasted Mushrooms
author: System
method: Preheat the oven to 200°C.
In a bowl, toss 500 g button mushrooms with 30 mL olive oil, 5 cloves minced garlic, 5 g fresh thyme leaves, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes until golden and tender.
Serve warm garnished with additional thyme.
description: Juicy mushrooms roasted with garlic and thyme, offering a burst of flavor perfect for a side dish.

name: Ginger Lime Chicken
author: System
method: In a bowl, combine the juice of 2 limes, 30 mL soy sauce, 20 g grated ginger, and 2 cloves minced garlic.
Add 4 chicken breasts and marinate for at least 2 hours.
Grill over medium heat for 6-7 minutes per side until fully cooked.
Serve with steamed broccoli and garnish with lime wedges.
description: Tender chicken breasts marinated in a zesty ginger-lime sauce, grilled to perfection.

name: Golden Beet Salad with Goat Cheese
author: System
method: Roast 4 peeled and cubed golden beets at 200°C for 30 minutes or until tender.
Let cool, then mix with 100 g mixed salad greens.
Top with 100 g crumbled goat cheese and 50 g toasted walnuts.
Drizzle with a vinaigrette made from 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Serve chilled.
description: A vibrant and healthy salad featuring roasted golden beets, creamy goat cheese, and crunchy walnuts.

name: Grilled Grouper with Cilantro Lime Butter
author: System
method: Mix 50 g softened butter with chopped cilantro, zest of 1 lime, and salt.
Grill 4 grouper fillets seasoned with salt and pepper over medium heat for 5 minutes each side.
Top each fillet with a dollop of cilantro lime butter before serving.
Serve with a side of grilled asparagus.
description: Fresh grouper fillets grilled to perfection, topped with a flavorful cilantro and lime butter.

name: Greek Chicken Gyros
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g sliced chicken breast in 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL lemon juice, 2 cloves minced garlic, 5 g oregano for 1 hour.
Grill chicken until cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve wrapped in pita bread with tzatziki sauce, sliced tomatoes, and onions.
description: Authentic Greek gyros filled with marinated chicken, fresh vegetables, and creamy tzatziki, wrapped in soft pita.

name: Garlic Herb Roasted Potatoes
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Cut 500 g potatoes into wedges. Toss with 30 mL olive oil, 5 cloves minced garlic, 5 g chopped rosemary, and 5 g chopped thyme. Season with salt and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 35 minutes, turning halfway through, until golden and crisp.
Serve hot, garnished with additional fresh herbs.
description: Crispy potato wedges seasoned with fresh garlic and herbs, roasted to perfection.

name: Grilled Gouda and Apple Sandwich
author: System
method: Butter two slices of whole grain bread. On one slice, layer thin slices of Gouda cheese and apple.
Top with the other slice, buttered side out.
Grill on a skillet over medium heat until the bread is golden and the cheese has melted, about 3 minutes per side.
Serve immediately, cut into halves.
description: A delightful combination of melty Gouda cheese and crisp apples sandwiched between toasted whole grain bread.

name: Green Gazpacho
author: System
method: Combine in a blender 200 g peeled cucumber, 100 g green bell pepper, 100 g celery, 1 small chopped onion, and 2 cloves garlic until smooth.
Add 500 mL vegetable broth, juice of 1 lime, 30 mL olive oil, salt, and pepper. Blend until combined.
Chill for at least 4 hours. Serve cold garnished with diced cucumber and fresh dill.
description: A refreshing and light soup made with a blend of green vegetables, perfect for hot weather.

name: Gumbo with Andouille Sausage
author: System
method: In a large pot, cook 200 g sliced Andouille sausage until browned. Remove and set aside.
Make a roux with 50 g flour and 50 g oil, cooking until dark brown.
Add 1 chopped bell pepper, 1 chopped onion, and 2 stalks chopped celery. Cook until soft.
Return sausage to the pot along with 500 g okra, 400 g diced tomatoes, and 1.5 L chicken broth. Simmer for 1 hour.
Season with cayenne pepper, salt, and serve over cooked rice.
description: A hearty, spicy stew from Louisiana, featuring Andouille sausage, okra, and a rich roux-based sauce.

name: Garlic Spinach in Cream Sauce
author: System
method: In a skillet, melt 30 g butter over medium heat. Add 3 cloves minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add 400 g fresh spinach and cook until wilted.
Stir in 100 mL heavy cream and simmer for 3 minutes. Season with salt and nutmeg.
Serve warm as a side dish.
description: Creamy and flavorful spinach cooked with garlic and enriched with a lush cream sauce.

name: Grilled Ginger Scallops
author: System
method: Marinate 400 g scallops in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 20 g grated ginger, and 15 mL sesame oil for 1 hour.
Thread scallops onto skewers.
Grill over high heat for 2 minutes per side or until opaque and slightly charred.
Serve with a sprinkle of chopped spring onions and sesame seeds.
description: Tender scallops infused with ginger and soy, grilled to perfection.

name: Garlic Lemon Cod
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Place 4 cod fillets in a baking dish. Drizzle with 30 mL olive oil and juice of 1 lemon. Sprinkle with 5 cloves minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with steamed asparagus.
description: Delicately flavored cod fillets baked with lemon and garlic, creating a light and healthy dish.

name: Ginger Beef Stir-Fry
author: System
method: Slice 500 g beef flank steak into thin strips.
In a wok, heat 30 mL vegetable oil over high heat. Stir-fry beef until browned, about 3 minutes.
Add 20 g grated ginger, 3 cloves minced garlic, and 300 g mixed bell peppers sliced. Cook for another 3 minutes.
Stir in 30 mL soy sauce and 15 mL oyster sauce. Serve over cooked rice, garnished with sesame seeds.
description: Savory and spicy beef stir-fried with ginger, garlic, and colorful bell peppers.

name: Grilled Guava Chicken
author: System
method: Marinate 4 chicken breasts in a blend of 120 mL guava juice, 30 mL honey, 2 cloves minced garlic, and 10 mL lime juice for at least 2 hours.
Grill over medium heat for 6-7 minutes per side or until fully cooked.
Serve with a fresh mango salsa and lime wedges.
description: Tropical-flavored chicken marinated in guava and honey, grilled to a perfect char.

name: Goat Cheese and Beet Tart
author: System
method: Roll out 300 g puff pastry and fit into a 22 cm tart pan. Prick the base with a fork.
Spread 200 g roasted and sliced beets over the pastry. Crumble 150 g goat cheese on top.
Whisk together 2 eggs, 100 mL cream, salt, and pepper. Pour over the beets and cheese.
Bake at 190°C for 25 minutes until set and golden. Garnish with arugula before serving.
description: A savory tart with a base of puff pastry, topped with earthy beets and creamy goat cheese, baked until golden.

name: Green Chili Cornbread
author: System
method: Mix 200 g cornmeal, 100 g all-purpose flour, 10 g sugar, 5 g baking powder, and a pinch of salt.
Add 1 beaten egg, 240 mL milk, and 60 mL melted butter. Stir until just combined.
Fold in 100 g chopped green chilies.
Pour into a greased 20x20 cm baking dish. Bake at 200°C for 20 minutes or until golden.
Serve warm with butter.
description: Moist and fluffy cornbread with a spicy kick from green chilies, perfect as a side for soups and stews.

name: Greek Lemon Chicken Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, combine 1 L chicken broth, 200 g diced chicken breast, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until chicken is cooked.
Stir in 100 g rice and cook until tender.
Whisk together the juice of 2 lemons and 2 beaten eggs. Temper with a little hot soup, then slowly stir back into the pot.
Heat gently, without boiling, until slightly thickened. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped dill.
description: A comforting Greek soup with a creamy egg-lemon broth, tender chicken, and rice, enhanced with fresh dill.

name: Garlic Grilled Lobster Tails
author: System
method: Preheat grill to high heat.
Cut 2 lobster tails in half lengthwise. Brush with a mixture of 30 mL melted butter and 3 cloves minced garlic.
Grill cut-side down for about 5 minutes. Flip, and grill for another 4 minutes until the meat is opaque and cooked through.
Serve with lemon wedges and a sprinkle of chopped parsley.
description: Luxurious lobster tails grilled with garlic butter, offering a perfect char and succulent flavor.

name: Gorgonzola Pear Pizza
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 220°C.
Roll out 300 g pizza dough and place on a baking sheet.
Spread 100 g crumbled Gorgonzola and thinly sliced pears over the dough.
Bake for 15 minutes or until the crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and sprinkle with arugula before serving.
description: A unique pizza combining the sharp taste of Gorgonzola cheese with sweet pears, finished with a balsamic reduction.

name: Ginger Pork Stir-Fry
author: System
method: In a wok, heat 30 mL vegetable oil over high heat. Add 500 g thinly sliced pork loin and stir-fry until browned.
Add 20 g grated ginger and 2 cloves minced garlic, cook for 1 minute.
Add 200 g sliced bell peppers and 100 g snow peas, stir-fry for another 3 minutes.
Stir in 30 mL soy sauce and 15 mL hoisin sauce, cook until heated through.
Serve over cooked noodles or rice.
description: Quick and flavorful stir-fry featuring tender pork, crisp vegetables, and a rich ginger-infused sauce.

name: Green Tea Ice Cream
author: System
method: Heat 500 mL heavy cream and 500 mL whole milk in a saucepan until just simmering.
Whisk 5 egg yolks with 150 g sugar until light. Gradually add the hot milk mixture, whisking constantly.
Return to the saucepan and cook over low heat, stirring until the mixture thickens and coats the back of a spoon.
Stir in 10 g matcha green tea powder until smooth.
Chill thoroughly, then churn in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Freeze until firm.
description: Creamy and subtly sweet ice cream infused with the distinct, earthy flavor of green tea.

name: Garlic Rosemary Lamb Chops
author: System
method: Marinate 8 lamb chops with 30 mL olive oil, 5 cloves minced garlic, 10 g chopped rosemary, salt, and pepper for at least 2 hours.
Grill over medium-high heat for 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Rest for 5 minutes before serving with a side of mashed potatoes and steamed green beans.
description: Juicy lamb chops marinated with garlic and rosemary, grilled to perfection.

name: Golden Cauliflower Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic in 30 mL olive oil until translucent.
Add 1 head of cauliflower, chopped, and 1 L vegetable broth. Simmer until cauliflower is tender, about 20 minutes.
Puree the soup with an immersion blender until smooth.
Stir in 100 mL heavy cream, season with salt and turmeric. Heat through.
Serve garnished with chopped chives and black pepper.
description: A creamy, comforting soup made with golden cauliflower, enriched with cream and turmeric.

name: Grilled Ginger Tuna Steaks
author: System
method: Marinate 4 tuna steaks in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 20 g grated ginger, 2 cloves minced garlic, and 15 mL sesame oil for 1 hour.
Grill on high heat for 2 minutes per side for medium rare.
Serve with a side of sautéed spinach and steamed rice.
description: Bold and flavorful tuna steaks marinated with ginger and soy sauce, grilled to a perfect sear.

name: Garlic Parmesan Asparagus
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Arrange 400 g asparagus on a baking sheet. Drizzle with 15 mL olive oil and toss with 3 cloves minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Roast for 12-15 minutes until tender.
Sprinkle with 30 g grated Parmesan cheese and return to the oven for another 2 minutes.
Serve immediately.
description: Tender asparagus roasted with garlic and topped with melted Parmesan cheese.

name: Gnocchi Pomodoro
author: System
method: Cook 500 g potato gnocchi according to package instructions, drain.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil and sauté 3 cloves minced garlic until fragrant.
Add 400 g diced tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in 10 g fresh basil, season with salt and pepper.
Toss gnocchi with the sauce, serve topped with grated Parmesan.
description: Classic Italian dish featuring soft potato gnocchi in a fresh tomato and basil sauce.

name: Ginger Peach Smoothie
author: System
method: In a blender, combine 2 peeled and sliced peaches, 200 mL Greek yogurt, 10 g grated ginger, and ice.
Blend until smooth.
Serve immediately, garnished with a slice of peach.
description: A refreshing and spicy smoothie with ripe peaches and a zesty ginger kick.

name: Garlic Green Bean Almondine
author: System
method: Blanch 400 g green beans in boiling water for 3 minutes, then shock in ice water and drain.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 3 cloves minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add green beans and 30 g sliced almonds, and sauté until beans are heated through and almonds are toasted.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.
description: Crisp green beans tossed with toasted almonds and fresh garlic, a delicious and elegant side dish.

name: Grilled Grapefruit with Honey
author: System
method: Cut 2 grapefruits in half and sprinkle with a little sugar.
Place cut side down on a heated grill and cook for 5 minutes until char marks appear.
Drizzle with honey and serve warm with a sprinkle of cinnamon.
description: Warm and caramelized grapefruit enhanced with a touch of honey and cinnamon, a simple yet delightful dessert.

name: Ginger Mango Chutney
author: System
method: Peel and chop 3 ripe mangoes. In a saucepan, combine mangoes, 100 g sugar, 50 mL vinegar, 20 g grated ginger, 1 minced garlic clove, and a pinch of salt.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
Cool completely and store in jars. Serve as an accompaniment to grilled meats or curry dishes.
description: A sweet and spicy chutney made from fresh mangoes and ginger, perfect for enhancing any meal with a burst of flavor.

name: Goat Cheese Log with Herbs
author: System
method: Mix 200 g soft goat cheese with 5 g each of chopped parsley, chives, and thyme.
Form the mixture into a log and wrap tightly in plastic wrap.
Chill for 2 hours to set. Slice and serve on crackers or with sliced baguette.
description: A creamy goat cheese log rolled in fresh herbs, perfect for spreading on crackers or bread as an appetizer.

name: Gnocchi with Mushroom Sauce
author: System
method: Cook 500 g potato gnocchi according to package instructions and drain.
In a skillet, sauté 200 g sliced mushrooms and 2 cloves minced garlic in 30 mL olive oil until mushrooms are browned.
Deglaze the pan with 100 mL white wine, then stir in 100 mL cream and simmer until thickened.
Toss gnocchi with the mushroom sauce. Garnish with grated Parmesan and serve.
description: Soft potato gnocchi smothered in a creamy mushroom sauce, a satisfying and elegant main course.

name: Garlic-Herb Grilled Salmon
author: System
method: Combine 30 mL olive oil, 5 g chopped basil, 5 g chopped parsley, 3 minced garlic cloves, salt, and pepper. Marinate 4 salmon fillets in the mixture for 1 hour.
Grill over medium heat for 5 minutes per side or until cooked through.
Serve with lemon wedges and a side of steamed asparagus.
description: Delicious salmon fillets marinated in a garlic and herb mixture, then grilled to perfection.

name: Gorgonzola Polenta Bites
author: System
method: Cook 200 g polenta with 750 mL water and a pinch of salt until thickened. Stir in 50 g crumbled Gorgonzola until melted.
Spread polenta on a tray and chill until set. Cut into bite-sized pieces.
Sear polenta bites in a hot skillet with 15 mL olive oil until crisp on both sides.
Serve topped with a small dollop of fig jam and a sprinkle of fresh thyme.
description: Savory and creamy polenta bites with Gorgonzola cheese, crisped up and topped with sweet fig jam.

name: Greek Spinach Pie
author: System
method: Sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves in 15 mL olive oil until soft. Add 500 g chopped spinach; cook until wilted.
Mix spinach with 200 g feta cheese, 2 beaten eggs, salt, and pepper.
Layer phyllo dough in a baking dish, brushing each layer with melted butter. Spread spinach mixture on top, then cover with more phyllo layers, brushing with butter.
Bake at 180°C for 40 minutes or until golden and crisp.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
description: A traditional Greek dish made with layers of crispy phyllo dough filled with a savory spinach and feta mixture.

name: Ginger Carrot Cake
author: System
method: Mix 250 g grated carrots, 200 g flour, 150 g sugar, 10 g baking powder, 10 g ground ginger, and a pinch of salt.
In another bowl, combine 100 mL vegetable oil, 2 eggs, and 30 mL milk.
Combine wet and dry ingredients, pour into a greased cake tin.
Bake at 180°C for 45 minutes. Cool and top with cream cheese frosting.
description: Moist carrot cake with a hint of ginger, topped with rich cream cheese frosting.

name: Grilled Guacamole
author: System
method: Halve 3 avocados and remove pits. Grill cut-side down for 5 minutes.
Scoop out the avocado flesh and mash with the juice of 1 lime, 1 diced tomato, 1 minced onion, and 1 chopped jalapeño. Season with salt.
Serve with tortilla chips or as a topping for tacos.
description: A smoky twist on traditional guacamole, featuring grilled avocados for an enhanced flavor.

name: Garlicky Grilled Shrimp Skewers
author: System
method: In a bowl, combine 30 mL olive oil, 5 cloves minced garlic, 5 g paprika, and juice of 1 lemon. Add 400 g shrimp and marinate for 30 minutes.
Thread shrimp onto skewers.
Grill over medium heat for 2-3 minutes per side until pink and cooked through.
Serve with fresh parsley and lemon wedges.
description: Juicy shrimp marinated in a garlicky mixture, grilled to perfection and served with a squeeze of fresh lemon.

name: Golden Potato Soup
author: System
method: In a pot, melt 30 g butter. Add 1 diced onion and 2 minced garlic cloves, cook until soft.
Add 500 g peeled and diced potatoes, cook for 5 minutes. Pour in 1 L chicken broth and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Puree the soup until smooth. Stir in 100 mL cream, season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped chives and a dollop of sour cream.
description: Creamy and comforting potato soup, enriched with cream and flavored with a hint of garlic.

name: Grilled Greek Chicken
author: System
method: Marinate 4 chicken breasts in 30 mL olive oil, juice of 1 lemon, 10 g oregano, 3 cloves minced garlic, salt, and pepper for 3 hours.
Grill over medium heat for 6-7 minutes per side or until cooked through.
Serve with a side of tzatziki sauce and cucumber salad.
description: Flavorful chicken marinated in Greek herbs and grilled, served with cool tzatziki sauce.

name: Ginger Honey Glazed Carrots
author: System
method: In a skillet, combine 400 g sliced carrots, 20 mL honey, 10 g grated ginger, and 30 mL water.
Cook over medium heat until carrots are tender and glazed, about 15 minutes.
Season with salt and garnish with parsley before serving.
description: Sweet and spicy carrots glazed with honey and ginger, a delightful side dish to any meal.

name: Gourmet Mushroom Risotto
author: System
method: In a saucepan, heat 30 mL olive oil. Add 200 g sliced mushrooms and sauté until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, add 1 chopped onion, sauté until translucent. Add 250 g Arborio rice, toast for 2 minutes.
Gradually add 1 L vegetable broth, stirring constantly, until the rice is creamy and al dente.
Stir in the cooked mushrooms, 50 g grated Parmesan, and 10 g chopped thyme. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve garnished with more Parmesan and a drizzle of truffle oil.
description: Luxurious risotto with earthy mushrooms, Parmesan cheese, and a hint of truffle oil for an extra touch of indulgence.

name: Garlic Butter Scallops
author: System
method: Heat 30 mL olive oil and 30 g butter in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 12 scallops and 3 cloves minced garlic. Cook for about 2 minutes per side until golden and cooked through.
Squeeze the juice of one lemon over the scallops, sprinkle with chopped parsley, and serve immediately.
description: Succulent scallops cooked in a rich garlic butter sauce, finished with a splash of lemon for a bright flavor.

name: Grapefruit Avocado Salad
author: System
method: Segment 2 grapefruits and slice 2 avocados.
Arrange on a platter with 100 g mixed salad greens.
Drizzle with a dressing made from 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL white wine vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Garnish with a sprinkle of crushed walnuts.
description: A refreshing and vibrant salad featuring grapefruit and avocado, dressed lightly with a citrus vinaigrette.

name: Garlic Spinach Quiche
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Prepare a pie crust in a 9-inch pan.
Sauté 200 g spinach and 3 cloves minced garlic in 15 mL olive oil until spinach is wilted.
In a bowl, whisk together 4 eggs, 200 mL cream, salt, and pepper.
Stir in the spinach mixture and pour into the crust.
Bake for 35 minutes until set and golden. Serve warm.
description: A savory quiche with a garlic spinach filling, nestled in a buttery pie crust.

name: Ginger Pear Crisp
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C.
Toss 6 sliced pears with 10 g grated ginger, 100 g sugar, and the juice of half a lemon.
Pour into a baking dish. Top with a crumble made from 100 g flour, 50 g sugar, 50 g rolled oats, and 50 g melted butter.
Bake for 45 minutes until topping is golden and filling is bubbly.
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.
description: A warm, comforting pear crisp infused with ginger, topped with a crispy oat crust.

name: Gouda and Apple Grilled Cheese
author: System
method: Butter two slices of whole grain bread. On one slice, layer thin slices of Gouda cheese and thinly sliced apple.
Top with the other slice, buttered side out.
Grill in a skillet over medium heat until the bread is golden and the cheese has melted, about 3 minutes per side.
Serve immediately.
description: A delightful twist on traditional grilled cheese, combining the sharpness of Gouda with the sweetness of apple.

name: Ginger Soy Glazed Edamame
author: System
method: Heat 500 g frozen edamame according to package instructions.
In a small saucepan, combine 30 mL soy sauce, 20 g grated ginger, 10 mL honey, and 10 mL sesame oil. Bring to a simmer.
Toss the edamame in the glaze and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve warm.
description: Edamame beans tossed in a sweet and spicy ginger soy glaze, perfect for a healthy snack or appetizer.

name: Garlic Basil Chicken
author: System
method: Marinate 4 chicken breasts in a mixture of 30 mL olive oil, 3 cloves minced garlic, 10 g fresh basil, juice of 1 lemon, salt, and pepper for at least 2 hours.
Grill over medium heat for 6-7 minutes per side or until fully cooked.
Serve with a side of roasted vegetables.
description: Juicy chicken breasts marinated with fresh basil and garlic, grilled to perfection.

name: Goat Cheese Stuffed Dates
author: System
method: Slice 18 dates along one side and remove pits.
Stuff each date with 10 g soft goat cheese and a small sprig of rosemary.
Wrap each stuffed date with a half slice of prosciutto.
Bake at 175°C for 10 minutes or until prosciutto is crisp.
Serve warm.
description: Sweet dates stuffed with creamy goat cheese and wrapped in savory prosciutto, baked to crispy perfection.

name: Ginger Plum Sauce
author: System
method: In a saucepan, combine 400 g chopped plums, 50 g sugar, 20 g grated ginger, and 30 mL soy sauce.
Simmer over low heat for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
Puree the sauce until smooth. Serve as a condiment with grilled meats or as a dip.
description: A sweet and tangy sauce made from fresh plums and ginger, ideal for enhancing grilled dishes.

name: Grilled Garlic Naan
author: System
method: Combine 250 g flour, 5 g sugar, 5 g yeast, and 5 g salt in a bowl. Add 120 mL warm water and 30 mL yogurt. Knead to form a soft dough.
Let rise for 1 hour. Divide into 4 balls and roll out each piece.
Brush each naan with garlic-infused olive oil and grill over high heat for 2 minutes per side.
Serve warm with curry or as an appetizer with dips.
description: Soft and fluffy naan bread grilled with a garlic oil topping, perfect for pairing with rich curries or dips.

name: Green Chili Chicken Enchiladas
author: System
method: Cook 500 g diced chicken breast in a skillet until browned. Add 200 mL green chili sauce and simmer for 10 minutes.
Fill 6 flour tortillas with the chicken mixture and roll up. Place seam side down in a baking dish.
Top with 100 g shredded Monterey Jack cheese and bake at 180°C for 20 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped cilantro.
description: Hearty enchiladas filled with spicy green chili chicken, smothered in cheese and baked to golden perfection.

name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
author: System
method: In two serving glasses, layer 200 g Greek yogurt with 50 g granola and 100 g mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries).
Repeat the layers until all ingredients are used.
Drizzle with 20 mL honey and garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon before serving.
description: A healthy and delicious parfait with layers of creamy Greek yogurt, crunchy granola, and fresh berries, sweetened with a touch of honey.

name: Garlic Herb Roast Beef
author: System
method: Rub a 1 kg beef roast with a mixture of 5 cloves minced garlic, 10 g chopped rosemary, 10 g thyme, salt, and pepper.
Sear the roast in a hot skillet with 15 mL olive oil until browned on all sides.
Roast in a preheated 175°C oven for 60-70 minutes or until the desired doneness is reached.
Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with roasted potatoes and carrots.
description: Tender and flavorful roast beef seasoned with garlic and fresh herbs, perfect for a hearty family dinner.

name: Gazpacho with Melon
author: System
method: In a blender, combine 200 g chopped cucumber, 200 g chopped cantaloupe, 100 g chopped red bell pepper, 1 small chopped onion, 2 cloves garlic, and 15 mL sherry vinegar.
Blend until smooth. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
Before serving, adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, and stir in 30 mL olive oil.
Serve cold, garnished with diced melon and fresh mint.
description: A refreshing summer soup made from a blend of melon and vegetables, served chilled with a hint of mint.

name: Hearty Beef Stew
author: System
method: Brown 1 kg of cubed beef in 30 mL of olive oil in a large pot.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and cook until the onion is translucent.
Pour in 1 L of beef broth and add 300 g of chopped carrots, 300 g of diced potatoes, and 5 g of thyme.
Simmer covered for 2 hours, until the beef is tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve hot.
description: A traditional and comforting beef stew with tender chunks of beef, hearty vegetables, and a rich broth, perfect for a cold evening.

name: Honey Garlic Chicken
author: System
method: Mix 30 mL of honey, 15 mL of soy sauce, and 3 cloves of minced garlic in a bowl.
Marinate 500 g of chicken thighs in the mixture for 1 hour.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (356°F) for 30 minutes or until fully cooked.
Serve garnished with chopped scallions.
description: Sweet and savory chicken thighs coated in a sticky honey garlic sauce, baked to perfection.

name: Herbed Pork Tenderloin
author: System
method: Rub 1 kg of pork tenderloin with a mix of 5 g salt, 5 g black pepper, and 10 g mixed dried herbs.
Sear all sides in a skillet with 15 mL of olive oil.
Roast in a preheated oven at 190°C (374°F) for 25 minutes.
Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with a side of roasted vegetables.
description: A juicy and flavorful pork tenderloin, seasoned with a blend of herbs and roasted to perfection.

name: Hot and Spicy Tofu
author: System
method: Cube 400 g of firm tofu and marinate in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL sriracha, and 5 g grated ginger for 30 minutes.
Sauté the tofu in 30 mL of vegetable oil over high heat until crispy, about 5 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds and chopped green onions.
description: Fiery tofu cubes sautéed until crispy, infused with a hot and tangy sauce, perfect for spice lovers.

name: Hazelnut Crusted Salmon
author: System
method: Coat 4 salmon fillets with a crust of 100 g ground hazelnuts mixed with 50 g breadcrumbs.
Pan-sear in 15 mL of butter over medium heat, about 4 minutes per side.
Serve with a drizzle of lemon butter sauce.
description: Delicious salmon fillets encrusted with a nutty hazelnut layer, pan-seared to perfection.

name: Honey Mustard Chicken Skewers
author: System
method: Mix 30 mL of honey with 30 mL of Dijon mustard and 5 mL of apple cider vinegar to make a marinade.
Thread 500 g of cubed chicken breast onto skewers and marinate for 1 hour.
Grill over medium heat, turning occasionally, until cooked through, about 15 minutes.
Serve garnished with fresh parsley.
description: Grilled chicken skewers marinated in a sweet and tangy honey mustard sauce, perfect for outdoor cooking.

name: Herb Roasted Potatoes
author: System
method: Toss 800 g of cubed potatoes with 30 mL of olive oil, 5 g of rosemary, 5 g of thyme, and salt and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 40 minutes, turning halfway through.
Serve hot, sprinkled with additional herbs if desired.
description: Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, these potatoes are roasted with fragrant herbs for a perfect side dish.

name: Hot Chocolate Fondue
author: System
method: Heat 200 mL of heavy cream in a saucepan until it simmers.
Remove from heat and add 200 g of chopped dark chocolate, stirring until melted.
Transfer to a fondue pot and keep warm.
Serve with assorted fruits and marshmallows for dipping.
description: Rich and velvety dark chocolate fondue, served warm with fresh fruits and marshmallows for a delightful dessert experience.

name: Homemade Hash Browns
author: System
method: Grate 500 g of potatoes and squeeze out excess moisture.
Mix with 5 g of salt and 5 g of pepper.
Form into patties and fry in 50 mL of vegetable oil over medium heat until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side.
Serve hot with ketchup or your favorite dipping sauce.
description: Crispy and golden homemade hash browns, a perfect breakfast side or a snack.

name: Honey Glazed Carrots
author: System
method: Peel and slice 400 g of carrots.
In a skillet, melt 30 g of butter and add the carrots, 15 mL of honey, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Cook over medium heat until the carrots are tender and glazed, about 10 minutes.
Garnish with parsley before serving.
description: Sweet and tender carrots glazed with honey and butter, a simple yet flavorful side dish.

name: Ham and Cheese Croissants
author: System
method: Slice 4 croissants in half and fill each with 50 g of sliced ham and 50 g of Swiss cheese.
Bake in a preheated oven at 175°C (347°F) for 5 minutes or until the cheese melts.
Serve hot, ideal for a quick breakfast or a snack.
description: Warm, buttery croissants stuffed with savory ham and melting Swiss cheese, a delicious and easy meal.

name: Herb-Roasted Turkey Breast
author: System
method: Rub a 1.5 kg turkey breast with a mixture of 10 g salt, 5 g black pepper, 10 g minced garlic, and 15 g mixed fresh herbs (rosemary, thyme, sage).
Roast in a preheated oven at 175°C (347°F) for 90 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 74°C (165°F).
Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
Serve with a side of cranberry sauce and roasted vegetables.
description: Perfectly seasoned and roasted turkey breast, accompanied by aromatic herbs, ideal for a festive meal or a family dinner.

name: Honey Roasted Peanuts
author: System
method: Toss 300 g of raw peanuts with 30 mL of honey and a pinch of salt.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast in a preheated oven at 160°C (320°F) for 20 minutes, stirring halfway through.
Let cool before serving.
description: Sweet and slightly salty, these honey roasted peanuts are a crunchy and addictive snack.

name: Harissa Chicken Thighs
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g of chicken thighs in 50 mL of harissa paste, 30 mL of olive oil, and the juice of 1 lemon for at least 2 hours.
Grill over medium heat until fully cooked, about 6-7 minutes per side.
Serve with a side of couscous and grilled vegetables.
description: Spicy and flavorful chicken thighs marinated in harissa and lemon, perfect for a fiery and delicious meal.

name: Hot Spinach and Artichoke Dip
author: System
method: Mix 200 g of chopped cooked spinach, 200 g of chopped artichoke hearts, 100 g of cream cheese, 50 g of sour cream, and 50 g of grated Parmesan cheese.
Bake in a preheated oven at 190°C (374°F) for 20 minutes or until bubbly and golden on top.
Serve hot with toasted bread or tortilla chips.
description: A creamy and indulgent dip made with spinach, artichokes, and a mix of cheeses, perfect for parties or as an appetizer.

name: Herbed Quinoa Salad
author: System
method: Cook 200 g of quinoa according to package instructions, then let cool.
Mix quinoa with 100 g of diced cucumber, 100 g of cherry tomatoes, 50 g of feta cheese, and 30 g of chopped fresh herbs (parsley, mint).
Dress with 30 mL of olive oil and the juice of 1 lemon.
Season with salt and pepper and chill before serving.
description: A fresh and light salad featuring quinoa tossed with cucumbers, tomatoes, feta, and vibrant herbs, dressed in a simple lemon olive oil dressing.

name: Honey Glazed Duck
author: System
method: Score the skin of 4 duck breasts and season with salt and pepper.
Pan-sear skin side down over low heat until the fat renders and the skin is crispy, about 10 minutes.
Turn over and cook for another 5 minutes for medium rare.
Glaze with a mixture of 30 mL of honey, 15 mL of soy sauce, and 15 mL of orange juice during the last few minutes.
Rest for 5 minutes, then slice and serve.
description: Rich and flavorful duck breasts with a sweet and tangy glaze, perfectly cooked to crispy-skinned perfection.

name: Hearty Minestrone Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 30 mL of olive oil over medium heat.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 2 chopped carrots, sauté until softened.
Stir in 1 L of vegetable broth, 400 g of chopped tomatoes, 200 g of chopped zucchini, and 100 g of canned kidney beans.
Simmer for 30 minutes, then add 100 g of pasta and cook until al dente.
Season with salt and pepper, serve hot garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.
description: A classic Italian soup loaded with vegetables, beans, and pasta, simmered in a rich tomato broth, hearty and nutritious.

name: Hickory Smoked Ribs
author: System
method: Rub 1 kg of pork ribs with a mix of 10 g smoked paprika, 10 g brown sugar, 5 g garlic powder, and salt and pepper.
Smoke over hickory wood at 120°C (248°F) for 4 hours.
Brush with barbecue sauce and grill for an additional 10 minutes to caramelize.
Serve with coleslaw and extra barbecue sauce.
description: Slow-cooked pork ribs with a smoky hickory flavor, glazed with a sweet barbecue sauce, fall-off-the-bone tender.

name: Hot Smoked Salmon
author: System
method: Brine 500 g of salmon fillets in a solution of 1 L water, 100 g salt, and 50 g sugar for 2 hours.
Dry the salmon for 1 hour at room temperature on a wire rack.
Smoke at 120°C (248°F) using applewood chips for 3 hours.
Serve with a dill and yogurt sauce.
description: Delicately flavored hot smoked salmon, perfect for adding a gourmet touch to any meal.

name: Honey Mustard Pretzel Chicken
author: System
method: Crush 200 g of pretzels into coarse crumbs.
Dip 500 g of chicken breast cutlets in a mixture of 30 mL honey and 30 mL Dijon mustard, then coat in pretzel crumbs.
Bake on a greased baking sheet at 200°C (392°F) for 25 minutes or until golden and cooked through.
Serve with a honey mustard dipping sauce.
description: Crispy baked chicken coated in a sweet and tangy honey mustard sauce and crunchy pretzel crumbs, a fun twist on classic chicken fingers.

name: Herb Infused Grilled Shrimp
author: System
method: Marinate 400 g of shrimp in a blend of 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL lemon juice, 10 g chopped fresh basil, and 5 g chopped fresh parsley for 30 minutes.
Grill over medium heat until pink and firm, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Serve with a side of garlic butter pasta.
description: Fresh and flavorful grilled shrimp marinated in herbs and lemon, simple yet elegant for any dining occasion.

name: Hasselback Potatoes with Herb Butter
author: System
method: Slice 4 large potatoes almost all the way through at 3mm intervals.
Melt 50 g of butter and mix with 10 g of chopped parsley, 5 g of chopped thyme, and 2 cloves of minced garlic.
Brush the potatoes with the herb butter, ensuring it gets between the slices.
Bake at 200°C (392°F) for about 1 hour until the potatoes are crispy on the edges and tender inside.
Serve hot, topped with extra herb butter.
description: Crispy on the outside, tender on the inside Hasselback potatoes, lavishly coated with a flavorful herb butter.

name: Honey Lime Grilled Chicken
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g of chicken breasts in a mixture of 30 mL of honey, juice of 2 limes, and 5 g of salt for at least 2 hours.
Grill over medium heat until cooked through, about 6-7 minutes per side.
Serve with a fresh lime wedge and a sprinkle of cilantro.
description: Succulent grilled chicken marinated in a sweet and tangy honey lime sauce, perfect for a light summer meal.

name: Herbed Baked Cod
author: System
method: Lay 500 g of cod fillets in a baking dish.
Mix 30 mL of olive oil with 10 g of chopped dill, 10 g of chopped parsley, and 5 g of lemon zest, then spread over the cod.
Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 15-20 minutes, until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
Serve with steamed asparagus and lemon slices.
description: Delicate cod fillets baked with a medley of fresh herbs and a hint of lemon, offering a light and healthy dish.

name: Hot Spinach Dip
author: System
method: Combine 300 g of chopped spinach, 200 g of cream cheese, 100 g of sour cream, and 50 g of grated Parmesan in a bowl.
Season with 5 g of salt and 5 g of garlic powder, mix thoroughly.
Transfer to a baking dish and cook at 190°C (374°F) for 20 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
Serve with tortilla chips and sliced baguette.
description: A creamy and cheesy hot spinach dip, perfect for sharing and dipping, a crowd-pleaser at any gathering.

name: Honey Glazed Ham
author: System
method: Score a 2 kg ham and place in a roasting pan.
Mix 100 mL of honey, 50 mL of orange juice, and 10 g of ground cloves to make a glaze.
Brush the glaze over the ham and bake at 160°C (320°F) for 1.5 hours, basting every 30 minutes.
Serve sliced with extra glaze and roasted vegetables.
description: Tender ham with a sweet and aromatic honey glaze, perfect for festive occasions and family dinners.

name: Hummus and Roasted Veggie Wrap
author: System
method: Spread 200 g of hummus on 4 large flour tortillas.
Top with 100 g of roasted red peppers, 100 g of roasted zucchini, and 50 g of spinach leaves.
Roll up the tortillas tightly, slice in half, and serve.
description: A healthy and filling wrap filled with creamy hummus and a variety of roasted vegetables, perfect for a quick lunch or light dinner.

name: Hot Garlic Shrimp
author: System
method: Sauté 400 g of shrimp with 30 mL of olive oil and 5 cloves of minced garlic until pink, about 2-3 minutes.
Sprinkle with 5 g of red pepper flakes and a squeeze of lemon juice.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.
description: Spicy and garlicky shrimp cooked quickly for a flavorful seafood dish, garnished with fresh herbs.

name: Honey Mustard Roasted Brussels Sprouts
author: System
method: Toss 500 g of halved Brussels sprouts with 30 mL of olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 20 minutes.
Drizzle with a mixture of 30 mL honey and 30 mL Dijon mustard, return to oven for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve warm, sprinkled with toasted almond slices.
description: Crispy Brussels sprouts with a sweet and tangy honey mustard glaze, enhanced with the crunch of toasted almonds.

name: Herb-Crusted Halibut
author: System
method: Mix 50 g of breadcrumbs with 10 g of chopped fresh basil, 10 g of chopped fresh parsley, and zest of 1 lemon.
Press the mixture onto 4 halibut fillets.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (356°F) for 15 minutes or until the fish flakes easily.
Serve with lemon wedges and a light salad.
description: Flaky halibut fillets encrusted with a fragrant blend of herbs and lemon, baked to golden perfection.

name: Honey Drizzled Pear Galette
author: System
method: Roll out 250 g of pie dough and place on a baking sheet.
Arrange 3 sliced pears in the center, leaving a border.
Fold the edges over the pears, brush with 15 mL of melted butter, and sprinkle with 50 g of sugar.
Bake at 190°C (374°F) for 35 minutes.
Drizzle with 30 mL of honey before serving.
description: A rustic and simple pear galette, sweetened with a honey drizzle, showcasing the natural flavors of the fruit.

name: Hickory Smoked Beef Brisket
author: System
method: Rub a 2 kg beef brisket with a mix of 10 g salt, 10 g black pepper, and 5 g smoked paprika.
Smoke over hickory wood at 110°C (230°F) for 8 hours or until tender.
Rest for 30 minutes before slicing.
Serve with BBQ sauce and coleslaw.
description: Slow-smoked beef brisket with a rich hickory aroma, offering melt-in-your-mouth tenderness and deep flavors.

name: Herb and Garlic Roasted Leg of Lamb
author: System
method: Rub a 2 kg leg of lamb with a paste made from 20 g of chopped rosemary, 20 g of chopped thyme, 10 cloves of minced garlic, 30 mL of olive oil, and 10 g of salt.
Roast in a preheated oven at 190°C (374°F) for about 1.5 hours or until the meat reaches the desired doneness.
Let rest for 20 minutes before carving.
Serve with roasted potatoes and a mint sauce.
description: A succulent leg of lamb coated with a rich blend of herbs and garlic, roasted to perfection.

name: Honey Balsamic Brussel Sprouts
author: System
method: Halve 500 g of Brussels sprouts and toss with 15 mL of olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 20 minutes.
Drizzle with a mixture of 30 mL honey and 15 mL balsamic vinegar, then roast for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with a sprinkle of roasted pine nuts.
description: Caramelized Brussels sprouts with a sweet and tangy honey balsamic glaze, finished with crunchy pine nuts.

name: Habanero and Mango Salsa
author: System
method: Dice 2 ripe mangoes and mix with 1 finely chopped habanero pepper, 50 g diced red onion, and the juice of 2 limes.
Season with salt and let sit for 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Serve with tortilla chips or as a topping for grilled fish.
description: A fiery and sweet salsa made with fresh mangoes and spicy habanero peppers, perfect for dipping or enhancing a dish.

name: Hearty Minestrone Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 30 mL of olive oil over medium heat and sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 100 g chopped carrots until softened.
Add 1.5 liters of vegetable broth, 400 g canned diced tomatoes, 100 g chopped zucchini, and 100 g of chopped celery.
Bring to a boil, then simmer for 30 minutes.
Add 100 g of small pasta shapes and cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in 200 g of canned kidney beans and heat through.
Serve hot, sprinkled with grated Parmesan cheese.
description: A rich and filling soup packed with vegetables, beans, and pasta, simmered in a savory tomato broth.

name: Hot Chocolate Fondue
author: System
method: Heat 250 mL of heavy cream in a fondue pot until it begins to simmer.
Add 200 g of chopped dark chocolate and stir until smooth.
Stir in 30 mL of honey and a pinch of cinnamon.
Keep warm and serve with assorted fruits, marshmallows, and pound cake for dipping.
description: A decadent and smooth hot chocolate fondue, sweetened with honey and a hint of cinnamon, perfect for dipping your favorite fruits and sweets.

name: Honey Mustard Pork Chops
author: System
method: Mix 30 mL of Dijon mustard, 30 mL of honey, and 5 g of minced garlic to create a marinade.
Coat 4 pork chops in the marinade and let sit for 1 hour.
Grill over medium heat for 5-7 minutes per side or until fully cooked.
Serve with a side of steamed green beans and mashed potatoes.
description: Juicy grilled pork chops marinated in a sweet and tangy honey mustard sauce, a simple yet flavorful dish.

name: Hot Smoked Salmon Salad
author: System
method: Smoke 400 g of salmon fillets with applewood until cooked through, about 2 hours at 120°C (248°F).
Flake the salmon and mix with 200 g of mixed salad greens, 100 g of cherry tomatoes, and 50 g of sliced cucumbers.
Dress with a mixture of 30 mL of olive oil, 15 mL of lemon juice, and 5 g of dill.
Serve chilled.
description: A light and refreshing salad featuring hot smoked salmon tossed with crisp greens and a lemon dill dressing.

name: Huevos Rancheros
author: System
method: Fry 4 corn tortillas in a skillet with a little oil until crispy.
Top each tortilla with fried eggs, 200 g of warmed refried beans, and 100 g of salsa.
Garnish with 50 g of sliced avocados, chopped cilantro, and a drizzle of sour cream.
Serve immediately.
description: A traditional Mexican breakfast dish featuring crispy tortillas topped with eggs, beans, salsa, and avocado.

name: Hazelnut Chocolate Mousse
author: System
method: Melt 150 g of dark chocolate with 50 g of crushed hazelnuts over a double boiler.
Whip 250 mL of heavy cream to soft peaks.
Fold the chocolate mixture into the whipped cream until well combined.
Chill for 2 hours before serving, topped with whipped cream and additional hazelnuts.
description: A rich and creamy chocolate mousse infused with the flavor of hazelnuts, a luxurious dessert.

name: Herbed Goat Cheese Stuffed Peppers
author: System
method: Mix 200 g of soft goat cheese with 10 g of chopped basil, 5 g of chopped thyme, and 5 g of minced garlic.
Cut the tops off 4 large bell peppers and remove seeds.
Stuff the peppers with the goat cheese mixture and replace the tops.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (356°F) for 25 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with additional herbs.
description: Colorful bell peppers stuffed with a flavorful herb-infused goat cheese mixture, baked until tender.

name: Honey-Soy Glazed Salmon
author: System
method: Mix 30 mL soy sauce, 30 mL honey, and 15 mL sesame oil in a bowl.
Place 4 salmon fillets in the marinade and let sit for 30 minutes.
Bake the salmon in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 15 minutes or until cooked through.
Garnish with sesame seeds and sliced green onions before serving.
description: Tender salmon fillets with a sweet and savory glaze, baked to perfection.

name: Hearty White Bean Soup
author: System
method: Sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves of minced garlic in 30 mL of olive oil until translucent.
Add 1 liter of chicken broth, 400 g of canned white beans, and 200 g of chopped ham. Bring to a boil and simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with salt, pepper, and 5 g of crushed rosemary.
Serve hot, sprinkled with grated Parmesan.
description: A warming and filling soup with white beans, ham, and aromatic herbs, perfect for a cold day.

name: Honey Mustard Grilled Chicken
author: System
method: Mix 30 mL of honey, 30 mL of Dijon mustard, and 15 mL of apple cider vinegar to make a marinade.
Marinate 4 chicken breasts for at least 2 hours.
Grill over medium heat for 7 minutes per side or until fully cooked.
Serve with steamed broccoli and carrots.
description: Juicy chicken breasts marinated in a sweet and tangy honey mustard sauce, perfect for a summer barbecue.

name: Herb-Crusted Rack of Lamb
author: System
method: Mix 10 g of chopped rosemary, 10 g of chopped thyme, and 5 cloves of minced garlic with 30 mL of olive oil to form a paste.
Rub this paste over a 1 kg rack of lamb and let sit for 1 hour.
Roast in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 25 minutes for medium-rare.
Let rest for 10 minutes, then carve and serve with a mint jelly.
description: A luxurious rack of lamb encrusted with fresh herbs, roasted to tender perfection, served with mint jelly.

name: Hot Lemon Pepper Wings
author: System
method: Toss 1 kg of chicken wings with 30 mL of olive oil and 10 g of lemon pepper seasoning.
Bake at 220°C (428°F) for 40 minutes, turning halfway through.
Serve hot with celery sticks and blue cheese dressing.
description: Crispy chicken wings seasoned with zesty lemon pepper, baked to a golden finish.

name: Hickory Barbecue Ribs
author: System
method: Rub 1 kg of pork ribs with a mixture of 10 g of smoked paprika, 10 g of brown sugar, and 5 g of garlic powder.
Smoke over hickory wood chips at 120°C (248°F) for 6 hours.
Brush with barbecue sauce and grill for 10 minutes to caramelize the sauce.
Serve with coleslaw and cornbread.
description: Tender, slow-smoked pork ribs slathered in a rich barbecue sauce, served with classic sides.

name: Heirloom Tomato Gazpacho
author: System
method: Blend 500 g of chopped heirloom tomatoes, 1 chopped cucumber, 1 chopped bell pepper, and 1 small red onion until smooth.
Season with salt, pepper, and 15 mL of red wine vinegar.
Chill for at least 2 hours.
Serve cold, garnished with chopped basil and a drizzle of olive oil.
description: A refreshing and colorful cold soup made with ripe heirloom tomatoes and fresh vegetables, perfect for hot weather.

name: Honey Lavender Ice Cream
author: System
method: Heat 250 mL of milk, 250 mL of cream, and 15 g of dried lavender until just boiling, then remove from heat and let steep for 30 minutes.
Strain the mixture, return to the pot, and add 100 g of honey. Heat until the honey dissolves.
Chill the mixture thoroughly, then churn in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Freeze until firm.
Serve scoops of ice cream garnished with lavender sprigs.
description: Smooth and creamy ice cream infused with the delicate flavor of lavender and sweetened with honey, a unique dessert treat.

name: Hot Sourdough Bread
author: System
method: Mix 500 g of bread flour, 300 mL of water, 100 g of sourdough starter, and 10 g of salt to form a dough.
Knead for 10 minutes, then let rise for 4 hours.
Shape the dough into a loaf and let proof for another hour.
Bake in a preheated oven at 230°C (446°F) for 30 minutes with steam.
Cool on a wire rack before slicing.
description: Crusty and chewy sourdough bread, freshly baked, with a tangy flavor that's perfect for any meal.

name: Honey Pepper Beef Stir Fry
author: System
method: Slice 500 g of beef into thin strips and marinate in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 30 mL honey, and 5 g black pepper for 30 minutes.
Stir fry the beef in 30 mL of vegetable oil over high heat until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add 200 g of sliced bell peppers and 100 g of sliced onions, stir fry for another 3 minutes.
Serve hot over rice.
description: A quick and easy stir fry featuring tender beef slices in a sweet and peppery sauce, served with crisp vegetables.

name: Herb-Crusted Prime Rib
author: System
method: Create a rub by mixing 10 g of chopped rosemary, 10 g of chopped thyme, 10 g of minced garlic, and 30 mL of olive oil.
Generously apply the rub to a 2 kg prime rib roast.
Roast in a preheated oven at 120°C (250°F) for about 3 hours or until the internal temperature reaches 60°C (140°F) for medium rare.
Rest the meat for 20 minutes before slicing.
Serve with a side of garlic mashed potatoes and steamed green beans.
description: A succulent prime rib roast encrusted with a fragrant herb mix, slow-roasted to perfection.

name: Honey Roasted Root Vegetables
author: System
method: Combine 200 g of chopped carrots, 200 g of chopped parsnips, and 200 g of chopped sweet potatoes in a baking dish.
Drizzle with 30 mL of honey and 30 mL of olive oil, then season with salt and pepper.
Roast in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 35 minutes or until tender and caramelized.
Garnish with fresh thyme before serving.
description: A delightful mix of root vegetables, roasted with honey for a touch of sweetness and a beautiful caramelized finish.

name: Hearty Chicken Pot Pie
author: System
method: Cook 500 g of diced chicken breast in 30 mL of butter until browned.
Add 100 g of diced carrots, 100 g of peas, and 100 g of sliced mushrooms, cook for 5 more minutes.
Stir in 30 g of flour, then gradually add 500 mL of chicken broth and 100 mL of cream, simmer until thick.
Pour the mixture into a pie crust, cover with another crust, seal edges, and make slits in the top.
Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 30 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.
Serve hot.
description: A comforting and filling chicken pot pie with a creamy filling and a flaky crust, perfect for a hearty meal.

name: Homemade Herb Bread
author: System
method: Combine 500 g of flour, 5 g of dry yeast, 5 g of sugar, 10 g of salt, 10 g of mixed dried herbs, and 300 mL of warm water.
Knead until smooth and let rise for 1 hour.
Shape into a loaf, let rise for another 30 minutes, then bake at 220°C (428°F) for 25 minutes.
Serve warm, sliced, with butter.
description: Aromatic homemade bread infused with a blend of herbs, perfect for dipping in soups or as a side to any meal.

name: Hot Spiced Cider
author: System
method: In a large pot, combine 1 liter of apple cider, 5 g of cinnamon sticks, 5 g of whole cloves, and 1 orange (sliced).
Simmer gently for 20 minutes.
Strain and serve hot, garnished with cinnamon sticks and orange slices.
description: A warm and comforting beverage, perfect for chilly evenings, infused with spices and orange for a festive touch.

name: Honey-Dijon Brussels Sprouts
author: System
method: Halve 400 g of Brussels sprouts and toss with 15 mL of olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 20 minutes.
Whisk together 15 mL of honey and 15 mL of Dijon mustard.
Toss the roasted Brussels sprouts in the honey-Dijon mixture and serve immediately.
description: Roasted Brussels sprouts tossed in a sweet and tangy honey-Dijon sauce, a delicious twist on a classic side dish.

name: Herb Marinated Grilled Squid
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g of cleaned squid in a mixture of 30 mL of olive oil, 10 g of chopped parsley, 5 g of minced garlic, and juice of 1 lemon for 1 hour.
Grill over high heat for 2 minutes on each side.
Serve with a wedge of lemon and a fresh arugula salad.
description: Light and flavorful grilled squid, marinated in fresh herbs and lemon, perfect for a quick, healthy meal.

name: Honeyed Pear and Almond Tart
author: System
method: Roll out 300 g of pastry dough and fit into a tart pan.
Arrange 3 sliced pears over the dough and sprinkle with 50 g of sliced almonds.
Drizzle with 30 mL of honey and bake at 180°C (356°F) for 25 minutes.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
description: A delicious tart featuring sweet pears and crunchy almonds, enhanced with a touch of honey.

name: Hibiscus Tea Sangria
author: System
method: Brew 500 mL of strong hibiscus tea and chill.
Mix the chilled tea with 250 mL of red wine, juice of 1 orange, and 30 mL of brandy.
Add sliced lemons, limes, and oranges.
Chill for at least 4 hours before serving over ice.
description: A refreshing and colorful sangria made with floral hibiscus tea, citrus fruits, and a hint of brandy, perfect for summer gatherings.

name: Herbed Lamb Meatballs
author: System
method: Mix 500 g of ground lamb with 10 g of chopped mint, 10 g of chopped cilantro, 1 minced onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, 5 g of cumin, and salt and pepper.
Form into 20 meatballs and fry in 30 mL of olive oil until browned all around and cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Serve with tzatziki sauce and pita bread.
description: Savory lamb meatballs seasoned with fresh herbs and spices, served with cool, creamy tzatziki.

name: Honey Roast Duck
author: System
method: Score the skin of a 1.5 kg whole duck and season inside and out with salt and pepper.
Place in a roasting pan and roast at 180°C (356°F) for 1 hour.
Mix 50 mL of honey and 30 mL of soy sauce, and brush over the duck.
Continue to roast for another 30 minutes, basting frequently, until golden and crispy.
Rest for 10 minutes before carving. Serve with roasted vegetables.
description: Juicy roast duck with a crispy, honey-glazed skin, accompanied by seasoned roasted vegetables.

name: Herb Butter Grilled Corn
author: System
method: Mix 50 g of softened butter with 10 g of chopped parsley, 5 g of chopped dill, and 2 g of salt.
Spread the herb butter over 4 ears of corn.
Wrap each ear in foil and grill over medium heat for 15 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve hot, optionally with a sprinkle of grated Parmesan.
description: Sweet corn on the cob slathered with flavorful herb butter, perfectly grilled for a smoky taste.

name: Hot Smoked Whitefish
author: System
method: Brine 1 kg of whitefish fillets in a solution of 1 L water, 100 g salt, and 50 g sugar for 4 hours.
Rinse and dry the fillets, then smoke over applewood chips at 120°C (248°F) for 2 hours.
Serve with a side of lemon aioli and fresh dill.
description: Delicate whitefish fillets, smoked over applewood for a rich, flavorful finish, accompanied by a tangy lemon aioli.

name: Honey Ginger Stir-Fry
author: System
method: Slice 500 g of chicken breast and marinate in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 30 mL honey, and 10 g grated ginger for 30 minutes.
Heat 30 mL of vegetable oil in a wok, add the chicken and stir-fry until browned.
Add 200 g of mixed bell peppers and 100 g of snap peas, stir-fry for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve over cooked rice.
description: A quick and flavorful stir-fry with chicken, fresh ginger, and honey, vibrant with crisp vegetables.

name: Hazelnut Affogato
author: System
method: Scoop 200 g of hazelnut gelato into 4 serving glasses.
Pour 60 mL of hot espresso over each scoop of gelato.
Sprinkle with crushed hazelnuts and serve immediately.
description: A classic Italian dessert with a twist, featuring hazelnut gelato drowned in rich espresso and topped with crunchy hazelnuts.

name: Herb Marinated Olives
author: System
method: Combine 300 g of mixed olives, 30 mL of olive oil, 5 g of chopped rosemary, and 5 g of chopped thyme in a bowl.
Marinate for at least 2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Serve as part of a charcuterie board or as a standalone snack.
description: Flavorful olives marinated in a blend of herbs and olive oil, a perfect addition to any appetizer spread.

name: Heavenly Blueberry Pancakes
author: System
method: Mix 200 g of all-purpose flour, 10 g of sugar, 5 g of baking powder, and a pinch of salt.
Whisk in 250 mL of milk, 1 beaten egg, and 30 mL of melted butter until smooth.
Fold in 100 g of fresh blueberries.
Cook spoonfuls of the batter in a hot, lightly buttered skillet until bubbles form, then flip and cook until golden.
Serve with maple syrup and extra blueberries.
description: Fluffy pancakes studded with juicy blueberries, perfect for a leisurely breakfast or brunch.

name: Hummus Crusted Chicken
author: System
method: Spread 200 g of hummus evenly over 4 chicken breasts.
Sprinkle with 50 g of chopped red bell peppers and 50 g of crumbled feta cheese.
Bake at 200°C (392°F) for 25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Serve with a quinoa salad.
description: Tender chicken breasts coated with creamy hummus, topped with bell peppers and feta, baked to perfection.

name: Honey Lavender Ice Cream
author: System
method: Heat 250 mL of heavy cream and 250 mL of milk with 15 g of dried lavender until just simmering, then cool for 30 minutes.
Strain the lavender and return the liquid to the heat. Stir in 100 g of honey until dissolved.
Chill the mixture thoroughly, then churn in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Freeze until firm, then serve garnished with additional lavender or honey.
description: Creamy homemade ice cream infused with the subtle floral notes of lavender and sweetened with honey.

name: Herbed Mushroom Toast
author: System
method: Sauté 300 g of sliced mushrooms in 30 mL of olive oil until browned.
Stir in 5 g of minced garlic, 10 g of chopped parsley, and 5 g of thyme, cook for 2 more minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Spoon over toasted slices of sourdough bread and top with shaved Parmesan before serving.
description: Rustic toasted sourdough topped with savory sautéed mushrooms and fresh herbs, a perfect quick meal or appetizer.

name: Honey Garlic Pork Chops
author: System
method: Whisk together 30 mL of honey, 15 mL of soy sauce, 5 cloves of minced garlic, and 5 mL of apple cider vinegar to make a marinade.
Marinate 4 pork chops in the mixture for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and cook the pork chops for 6 minutes on each side, or until fully cooked.
Serve with a side of steamed green beans and mashed potatoes.
description: Juicy pork chops marinated in a sweet and savory honey garlic sauce, perfectly cooked for a delicious dinner.

name: Harvest Vegetable Stew
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 30 mL of olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 diced carrots, and 2 diced potatoes; sauté until the onions are translucent.
Add 1 liter of vegetable broth, 200 g of chopped butternut squash, and 100 g of chopped celery. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Stir in 100 g of chopped kale and simmer for an additional 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
description: A hearty and healthy stew packed with fresh harvest vegetables, simmered to perfection in a savory broth.

name: Hibachi Style Fried Rice
author: System
method: Heat 15 mL of sesame oil in a large skillet or wok. Add 2 beaten eggs and scramble until fully cooked. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add another 15 mL of sesame oil, then add 400 g of cooked rice, 100 g of peas, and 50 g of diced carrots. Stir-fry for 5 minutes.
Add scrambled eggs back to the skillet, along with 30 mL of soy sauce and 5 g of chopped green onions, and stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with additional green onions and sesame seeds.
description: Classic hibachi-style fried rice with vegetables and eggs, seasoned with soy sauce and sesame oil for an authentic flavor.

name: Hot and Sour Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, combine 1 liter of chicken broth, 50 mL of soy sauce, 30 mL of rice vinegar, and 10 g of ground white pepper. Bring to a simmer.
Add 200 g of thinly sliced mushrooms, 100 g of bamboo shoots, and 100 g of tofu, cut into strips. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in 15 mL of sesame oil and 5 g of chopped green onions before serving.
Beat 1 egg and slowly pour into the soup while stirring to create egg ribbons.
Serve hot, garnished with cilantro.
description: A tangy and spicy traditional Chinese soup with mushrooms, bamboo shoots, and tofu, enriched with a silky egg ribbon.

name: Italian Herb Chicken
author: System
method: Marinate 4 chicken breasts in a mixture of 30 mL olive oil, 5 g Italian seasoning, 3 cloves minced garlic, juice of 1 lemon, salt, and pepper for at least 2 hours.
Grill over medium heat for 6-7 minutes per side or until fully cooked.
Serve with a side of Caesar salad.
description: Tender chicken breasts marinated with classic Italian herbs and grilled to perfection.

name: Irish Beef Stew
author: System
method: In a large pot, brown 1 kg cubed beef in 15 mL olive oil. Remove and set aside.
Add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic to the pot, cook until soft.
Return beef to the pot. Add 500 mL beef broth, 200 g sliced carrots, 300 g potatoes, and simmer for 2 hours until the beef is tender.
Stir in 100 mL stout beer and cook for another 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with fresh parsley.
description: A hearty traditional Irish stew with tender beef, root vegetables, and a rich stout-infused broth.

name: Indian Spiced Lentil Soup
author: System
method: In a pot, heat 15 mL vegetable oil. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, 10 g grated ginger, and 10 g curry powder. Cook until fragrant.
Add 200 g red lentils, 1 L vegetable broth, and simmer for 30 minutes until lentils are tender.
Stir in 100 mL coconut milk and heat through. Season with salt and cayenne pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped cilantro.
description: A warm and comforting lentil soup seasoned with traditional Indian spices and enriched with coconut milk.

name: Italian Sausage and Peppers
author: System
method: In a skillet, cook 500 g sliced Italian sausage until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add 200 g sliced bell peppers and 1 sliced onion. Cook until softened.
Return sausage to the skillet, add 200 mL marinara sauce, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve on hoagie rolls or with a side of pasta.
description: Flavorful Italian sausages cooked with bell peppers and onions in a rich marinara sauce.

name: Irish Soda Bread
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Mix 400 g flour, 5 g baking soda, 5 g salt, and 50 g sugar in a large bowl.
Stir in 300 mL buttermilk to form a dough.
Shape into a round loaf and place on a baking sheet. Cut an 'X' into the top.
Bake for 45 minutes until the bread is golden and sounds hollow when tapped.
Cool on a wire rack before slicing.
description: Traditional Irish soda bread with a crunchy crust and soft interior, perfect for slathering with butter.

name: Italian Meatball Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil. Cook 20 small meatballs until browned.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 200 g chopped carrots, sauté until vegetables are soft.
Pour in 1.5 L beef broth and bring to a boil. Add 100 g chopped kale and simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve with grated Parmesan cheese.
description: Hearty soup filled with savory meatballs and vegetables, simmered in a rich beef broth.

name: Indonesian Fried Rice
author: System
method: In a wok, heat 30 mL vegetable oil. Add 2 beaten eggs and scramble. Remove and set aside.
Add 200 g diced chicken and cook until browned.
Add 300 g cooked rice, 100 g diced carrots, 50 g peas, and 30 mL soy sauce. Stir-fry for 5 minutes.
Mix in scrambled eggs, 5 g crushed red pepper, and serve with cucumber slices and fried shallots.
description: Spicy and flavorful Indonesian-style fried rice with chicken, vegetables, and a hint of heat from red pepper.

name: Indian Butter Chicken
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g cubed chicken breasts in 100 mL yogurt, 10 g garam masala, 5 g turmeric, 5 g cumin, and 3 cloves minced garlic for 2 hours.
In a skillet, melt 30 g butter. Add marinated chicken and cook until browned.
Add 200 mL tomato sauce and 100 mL cream. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve with basmati rice and naan bread, garnished with fresh cilantro.
description: Creamy and rich butter chicken, a popular Indian dish known for its silky tomato-based sauce spiced with garam masala.

name: Italian Stuffed Peppers
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C.
Cut the tops off 4 bell peppers and remove the seeds. Blanch in boiling water for 5 minutes, then drain.
In a skillet, cook 200 g ground beef, 1 chopped onion, and 2 cloves minced garlic until beef is browned.
Stir in 100 g cooked rice, 200 mL tomato sauce, 5 g Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Fill peppers with this mixture.
Place peppers in a baking dish, cover with foil, and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover, top with 100 g shredded mozzarella, and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh basil.
description: Bell peppers stuffed with a savory mixture of beef, rice, and herbs, topped with melty mozzarella cheese.

name: Irish Lamb Stew
author: System
method: In a large pot, brown 1 kg cubed lamb shoulder in 15 mL vegetable oil.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, and cook until onion is soft.
Pour in 1.5 L beef broth, add 300 g diced potatoes, 200 g sliced carrots, and simmer for 2 hours or until lamb is tender.
Stir in 100 g chopped leeks and simmer for another 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.
description: Traditional Irish stew made with tender lamb, hearty vegetables, and a rich broth.

name: Indian Palak Paneer
author: System
method: Blanch 500 g spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes. Drain and puree.
In a pan, heat 15 mL vegetable oil, sauté 1 chopped onion, 1 chopped green chili, and 2 cloves minced garlic until soft.
Add pureed spinach, 5 g garam masala, 5 g cumin, and cook for 10 minutes.
Add 200 g cubed paneer and cook for another 5 minutes. Stir in 50 mL cream, heat through.
Serve hot with naan or rice.
description: A rich and flavorful North Indian dish featuring creamy spinach and fresh paneer.

name: Indonesian Chicken Satay
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g chicken breast strips in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 20 g grated ginger, 15 mL honey, and 15 mL sesame oil for 3 hours.
Thread chicken onto skewers.
Grill over medium heat for 6-7 minutes per side until cooked through.
Serve with peanut sauce and cucumber salad.
description: Grilled chicken skewers marinated in an Indonesian-style sauce, served with a sweet and spicy peanut sauce.

name: Israeli Couscous Salad
author: System
method: Cook 200 g Israeli couscous according to package instructions; drain and cool.
In a large bowl, combine couscous with 100 g diced cucumber, 100 g cherry tomatoes halved, 50 g crumbled feta cheese, and 20 g chopped parsley.
Dress with 30 mL olive oil and 15 mL lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper.
Chill for 1 hour before serving.
description: A refreshing salad featuring pearl couscous with fresh vegetables and feta, dressed in a simple lemon olive oil dressing.

name: Italian Bean Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and cook until softened.
Add 1 chopped carrot, 1 chopped celery stalk, and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in 400 g canned diced tomatoes, 500 mL vegetable broth, and 400 g canned cannellini beans. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with 5 g Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Serve hot with grated Parmesan and crusty bread.
description: A hearty and healthy Italian soup with beans, vegetables, and tomatoes, seasoned with traditional herbs.

name: Irish Cream Liqueur
author: System
method: In a blender, combine 300 mL heavy cream, 350 mL Irish whiskey, 200 mL sweetened condensed milk, 15 mL chocolate syrup, 10 mL vanilla extract, and 5 mL instant coffee.
Blend until smooth. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
Serve chilled or over ice.
description: A rich, creamy homemade liqueur infused with Irish whiskey, chocolate, and a hint of coffee.

name: Indian Spiced Roast Chicken
author: System
