Season with salt to taste and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve with rice.
description: A vibrant and spicy fish curry from Kerala, flavored with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and coconut milk.

name: Kielbasa and Cabbage Skillet
author: System
method: Slice 500 g kielbasa sausage and sauté in a skillet with 15 mL vegetable oil until browned.
Add 1 sliced onion and 2 minced garlic cloves, cook until onion is translucent.
Stir in 500 g shredded cabbage and 100 mL chicken broth, cover and simmer for 20 minutes until cabbage is tender.
Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of paprika before serving.
description: A hearty and flavorful one-pan dish featuring kielbasa sausage and tender cabbage, seasoned and simmered to perfection.

name: Kale Chips
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Tear 300 g kale leaves into bite-sized pieces, discarding the stems. Wash and thoroughly dry.
Toss with 15 mL olive oil and spread on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Bake for 10-15 minutes until edges are brown but not burnt.
Sprinkle with sea salt immediately after removing from oven.
description: Crispy and light kale chips, a healthy snack option baked to perfection with just a touch of olive oil and sea salt.

name: Korean Bibimbap
author: System
method: Cook 200 g rice according to package instructions.
In separate pans, sauté 100 g sliced mushrooms, 100 g julienned carrots, 100 g spinach, and 200 g ground beef, each seasoned lightly with soy sauce and sesame oil.
In a serving bowl, place cooked rice and arrange the cooked ingredients on top.
Top with a fried egg and a dollop of gochujang (Korean chili paste).
Serve with a side of kimchi and mix everything together before eating.
description: A colorful and customizable Korean rice dish with assorted vegetables, beef, a fried egg, and spicy gochujang.

name: Katsu Curry
author: System
method: Pound 4 chicken breasts to an even thickness, then dredge in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat in panko breadcrumbs.
Fry in 60 mL vegetable oil over medium heat until golden and cooked through.
For the curry, sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 grated apple in a pot until soft. Add 15 g curry powder, 500 mL chicken broth, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Blend the sauce until smooth, then return to the pot and thicken with 10 g cornstarch mixed with 15 mL water.
Slice the chicken and serve over rice with curry sauce and pickled radishes.
description: Crispy breaded chicken served with a rich and flavorful homemade Japanese curry sauce, a popular comfort meal.

name: Korean Japchae
author: System
method: Cook 200 g sweet potato noodles according to package instructions, drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat 15 mL sesame oil. Sauté 100 g sliced onions, 100 g julienned carrots, and 100 g sliced bell peppers until tender.
Add 200 g sliced beef and cook until browned. Mix in cooked noodles with 30 mL soy sauce and 15 mL sugar.
Stir fry until everything is heated through. Garnish with 10 g toasted sesame seeds and serve.
description: A traditional Korean dish featuring sweet potato noodles stir-fried with vegetables and beef, seasoned with soy sauce and sesame.

name: Kurdish Biryani
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 30 mL vegetable oil. Add 1 kg diced lamb, brown all over and set aside.
In the same pot, add 300 g rice, 1 diced onion, 3 cloves minced garlic, 100 g raisins, and 100 g chopped almonds; sauté until onions are translucent.
Return the lamb to the pot with 1.5 L chicken stock, bring to a boil then simmer until rice is cooked, about 20 minutes.
Season with 5 g cinnamon, 5 g cumin, and salt. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.
description: A rich and aromatic Kurdish-style biryani with lamb, rice, nuts, and raisins, spiced with cinnamon and cumin.

name: Kale and Potato Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 diced onion and 2 cloves minced garlic, cook until soft.
Add 500 g diced potatoes, 1 L vegetable broth, and bring to a simmer. Cook until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes.
Add 200 g chopped kale and cook until wilted, about 5 minutes.
Puree soup until smooth, season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
description: A comforting and hearty soup made with tender potatoes and nutrient-rich kale, blended into a smooth and creamy consistency.

name: Kielbasa and Pepper Skillet
author: System
method: Slice 500 g kielbasa sausage and cook in a skillet with 15 mL vegetable oil until browned.
Add 1 each sliced red and yellow bell pepper and 1 sliced onion; cook until vegetables are soft.
Season with 5 mL paprika and salt to taste. Serve hot, optionally over rice or wrapped in a warm tortilla.
description: A simple and flavorful skillet meal with smoky kielbasa and colorful bell peppers, quick and easy for weeknight dinners.

name: Korean Spicy Cucumber Salad
author: System
method: Slice 300 g cucumbers thinly. Sprinkle with 5 g salt and let sit for 10 minutes. Squeeze out excess water.
Mix cucumbers with 15 mL rice vinegar, 5 g sugar, 10 mL sesame oil, 15 g gochugaru (Korean chili powder), and 20 g chopped green onions.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with sesame seeds.
description: A refreshing yet spicy side dish featuring thinly sliced cucumbers seasoned with Korean spices and sesame.

name: King Prawn Linguine
author: System
method: Cook 400 g linguine pasta according to package instructions.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium heat. Add 2 cloves minced garlic and 300 g king prawns; cook until prawns are pink.
Add 200 mL cream, zest of 1 lemon, and 30 mL chopped parsley. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Toss with drained pasta, season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
description: Luxurious linguine pasta tossed with succulent king prawns in a creamy lemon and garlic sauce.

name: Kale Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C.
Remove stems from 4 large Portobello mushrooms and brush with 15 mL olive oil. Bake for 10 minutes.
Sauté 200 g chopped kale, 1 diced onion, and 2 cloves minced garlic in 15 mL olive oil until soft.
Mix sautéed vegetables with 100 g breadcrumbs and 50 g grated Parmesan. Stuff into mushroom caps.
Bake for an additional 20 minutes. Serve warm.
description: Savory Portobello mushrooms filled with a delicious mix of kale, onions, garlic, and Parmesan.

name: Kedgeree
author: System
method: Boil 300 g smoked haddock in 500 mL milk until cooked through, about 10 minutes. Flake the fish and set aside.
Cook 200 g rice in the same milk until tender.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL oil, sauté 1 chopped onion and 1 tsp curry powder until soft.
Combine flaked fish, rice, sautéed onion, and 100 g cooked peas. Heat through.
Season with salt and pepper, garnish with chopped hard-boiled eggs and parsley before serving.
description: A traditional British dish with Indian influences, featuring smoked haddock, rice, and curry flavors, garnished with hard-boiled eggs.

name: Kielbasa Potato Skillet
author: System
method: Slice 500 g kielbasa sausage and cook in a skillet with 15 mL vegetable oil until browned.
Add 500 g cubed potatoes, 1 sliced onion, and 2 cloves minced garlic. Cook until potatoes are golden and tender.
Season with salt, pepper, and 5 g smoked paprika. Serve hot.
description: A simple yet hearty skillet meal featuring kielbasa sausage, potatoes, and onions, spiced with smoked paprika.

name: Kale Quiche
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Prepare a pie crust in a 9-inch pan. Blind bake for 10 minutes.
Sauté 200 g chopped kale, 1 diced onion, and 1 diced bell pepper in 15 mL olive oil until soft.
Whisk together 4 eggs, 200 mL cream, salt, and pepper. Stir in the sautéed vegetables.
Pour the mixture into the pie crust. Bake for 35 minutes, or until set.
Serve warm.
description: A nutritious and flavorful quiche packed with kale and vegetables, nestled in a flaky pastry crust.

name: Kumquat Marmalade
author: System
method: Wash and thinly slice 500 g kumquats, removing seeds. Place in a pot with 500 mL water and 400 g sugar.
Simmer over low heat for 2 hours, stirring occasionally, until the marmalade thickens and becomes glossy.
Cool and transfer to sterilized jars. Seal and store in a cool, dark place.
description: A sweet and tangy marmalade made from fresh kumquats, perfect for spreading on toast or as a filling for pastries.

name: Korean Kimbap
author: System
method: Cook 300 g sushi rice according to package instructions. Season with a mix of 15 mL rice vinegar, 5 g sugar, and 2 g salt.
Lay out a sheet of nori on a bamboo mat. Spread rice evenly, leaving a small margin at the top.
Arrange strips of 100 g cooked spinach, 50 g pickled radish, 50 g cucumber, and 100 g cooked beef along the bottom of the rice.
Roll the nori tightly using the mat, then slice into rounds.
Serve with soy sauce for dipping.
description: Traditional Korean seaweed rice rolls filled with vegetables, pickled radish, and beef, sliced into bite-sized pieces.

name: Kerala Style Prawn Curry
author: System
method: Heat 15 mL coconut oil in a pan. Add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 10 curry leaves, and 2 chopped green chilies. Sauté until mustard seeds start to pop.
Add 200 g chopped onions, cook until golden. Stir in 20 g grated ginger, 3 cloves minced garlic, and 1 tsp turmeric. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add 500 g prawns and 200 mL coconut milk. Simmer for 10 minutes or until prawns are cooked through.
Season with salt and garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve with rice.
description: A flavorful South Indian curry with prawns, infused with coconut milk and tempered with mustard seeds and curry leaves.

name: Karnataka Bisi Bele Bath
author: System
method: In a pressure cooker, cook 200 g rice and 100 g toor dal with 800 mL water until soft.
Heat 15 mL ghee in a pan, add 1 tsp mustard seeds, a pinch of asafoetida, 2 dried red chilies, and a few curry leaves.
Add 150 g tamarind extract, 50 g Bisi Bele Bath masala, 100 g chopped vegetables (carrot, beans, potato), and simmer for 20 minutes.
Mix cooked dal and rice with the masala. Adjust seasoning and consistency with salt and water.
Serve hot garnished with fried cashews and chopped coriander.
description: A traditional Karnataka dish that is a spicy melange of rice, lentils, vegetables, and a special blend of spices.

name: Kale and Blueberry Smoothie
author: System
method: In a blender, combine 100 g kale leaves, 150 g blueberries, 1 banana, 200 mL almond milk, and a tablespoon of honey.
Blend until smooth. If the smoothie is too thick, adjust the consistency with more almond milk.
Serve immediately, garnished with a few whole blueberries.
description: A nutrient-packed smoothie blending the sweetness of blueberries with the health benefits of kale, made creamy with almond milk.

name: Korean Cold Noodle Salad
author: System
method: Cook 200 g buckwheat noodles according to package instructions, rinse under cold water and drain.
In a large bowl, mix noodles with 100 g thinly sliced cucumber, 50 g shredded carrots, and 50 g thinly sliced red bell pepper.
Prepare a dressing with 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL sesame oil, 15 mL rice vinegar, 10 g sugar, and 5 g minced garlic. Pour over the noodles and vegetables.
Toss everything together and chill for at least 30 minutes.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve cold.
description: A refreshing and light noodle salad with a tangy sesame-soy dressing, perfect for a summer meal.

name: Kashmiri Saag
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL mustard oil. Add 2 minced garlic cloves, 1 chopped onion, and cook until golden.
Add 500 g chopped spinach and 200 g chopped mustard greens, cook until wilted.
Stir in 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp turmeric, and salt to taste. Cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Blend the mixture until smooth. Reheat gently and serve with butter on top.
description: A traditional Kashmiri dish made from greens, seasoned with aromatic spices, and served with a dollop of butter for richness.

name: Kiwi Pavlova
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 120°C. Whip 4 egg whites with 250 g caster sugar until stiff peaks form.
Fold in 1 tsp vinegar and 1 tsp cornstarch. Spoon onto a lined baking sheet in a circular shape.
Bake for 1.5 hours, then turn off oven and let cool inside.
Top with whipped cream and sliced kiwis before serving.
description: A light and airy meringue dessert topped with fresh kiwi slices and whipped cream, perfect for a festive occasion.

name: Kung Pao Shrimp
author: System
method: In a skillet, heat 15 mL vegetable oil over medium heat. Add 500 g shrimp, sauté until pink and opaque.
Add 100 g diced bell peppers, 50 g peanuts, and 10 dried chilies. Stir-fry for 3 minutes.
Mix in a sauce made from 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL hoisin sauce, 10 mL vinegar, and 5 mL sesame oil; cook for 5 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped green onions.
description: A spicy and savory dish featuring shrimp and peanuts in a bold Kung Pao sauce, a popular Chinese takeout favorite.

name: Kentucky Bourbon Chicken
author: System
method: In a bowl, combine 30 mL soy sauce, 30 mL bourbon, 15 mL brown sugar, 5 g garlic powder, and 5 g ginger powder to make a marinade.
Marinate 500 g diced chicken breast in the mixture for at least 2 hours.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL vegetable oil and cook the chicken until golden and cooked through.
Serve with steamed broccoli and rice.
description: Succulent chicken marinated in a rich bourbon sauce with a hint of soy, garlic, and ginger, paired perfectly with rice and broccoli.

name: Kohlrabi Slaw
author: System
method: Peel and julienne 500 g kohlrabi. In a large bowl, toss with 100 g shredded carrot and 50 g thinly sliced red onion.
Whisk together 30 mL apple cider vinegar, 15 mL honey, 30 mL olive oil, and salt and pepper to taste. Pour over the slaw and toss to coat.
Chill for 1 hour before serving. Garnish with chopped parsley.
description: A crisp and refreshing slaw made from kohlrabi, carrots, and red onion, dressed with a sweet and tangy vinaigrette.

name: Korean Banchan: Spicy Pickled Radishes
author: System
method: Slice 300 g radishes thinly. Sprinkle with 5 g salt and let sit for 30 minutes. Rinse and drain.
Mix radishes with 30 g gochugaru, 15 mL rice vinegar, 10 g sugar, and 5 g minced garlic.
Let the mixture sit for at least 3 hours or overnight to pickle.
Serve as a side dish with Korean meals.
description: A traditional Korean side dish featuring tangy and spicy pickled radishes, perfect as an accompaniment to any meal.

name: Kipper Pâté
author: System
method: Flake 200 g smoked kippers, removing any bones.
Blend kippers in a food processor with 100 g cream cheese, 15 mL lemon juice, and 5 g chopped dill until smooth.
Season with black pepper to taste. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving on toast or crackers.
description: A smooth and flavorful pâté made from smoked kippers, cream cheese, and dill, perfect for spreading on crisp toast.

name: Korean Bean Sprout Salad
author: System
method: Blanch 300 g bean sprouts in boiling water for 30 seconds, then quickly rinse under cold water and drain.
Mix with 10 g finely chopped green onions, 5 mL sesame oil, 5 mL soy sauce, and a sprinkle of sesame seeds.
Chill for 1 hour and serve as a refreshing side dish.
description: A light and crunchy salad, perfect as a side dish for Korean meals, featuring blanched bean sprouts seasoned with soy sauce and sesame.

name: Kedgeree with Smoked Haddock
author: System
method: Poach 300 g smoked haddock in milk until cooked through. Flake the fish, discarding any bones.
Cook 200 g basmati rice. In another pan, heat 15 mL oil and sauté 1 diced onion until soft. Add 1 tsp curry powder and the rice, mixing well.
Combine rice with haddock, 100 g peas, and chopped hard-boiled eggs.
Season with salt, pepper, and garnish with chopped parsley. Serve with lemon wedges.
description: A flavorful British-Indian dish of curried rice, smoked haddock, and boiled eggs, garnished with fresh herbs and served with a wedge of lemon.

name: Key Lime Cheesecake
author: System
method: Mix 200 g graham cracker crumbs with 50 g melted butter and press into the bottom of a springform pan.
Beat 400 g cream cheese with 150 g sugar until smooth. Add 100 mL key lime juice and 3 eggs, one at a time, beating until creamy.
Pour mixture over crust and bake at 160°C for 50 minutes. Cool and refrigerate for 4 hours.
Top with whipped cream and lime zest before serving.
description: A decadent cheesecake with a tangy key lime filling atop a buttery graham cracker crust, crowned with whipped cream and lime zest.

name: Kielbasa Bean Stew
author: System
method: Slice 500 g kielbasa sausage and brown in a large pot. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic; sauté until translucent.
Add 400 g canned white beans, 500 mL chicken broth, 200 g chopped tomatoes, and return kielbasa to the pot.
Simmer for 30 minutes. Season with salt, pepper, and 5 g smoked paprika. Serve hot with crusty bread.
description: A hearty and warming stew made with kielbasa sausage, white beans, and tomatoes, seasoned with smoked paprika.

name: Kale and Bean Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and cook until translucent.
Add 400 g chopped kale and sauté until wilted. Pour in 1 L vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
Stir in 400 g canned white beans (drained and rinsed) and simmer for 15 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot, garnished with grated Parmesan.
description: A hearty and healthy soup featuring tender kale and creamy white beans in a savory broth.

name: Korean Spicy Pork Ribs
author: System
method: Marinate 1 kg pork ribs in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 30 g gochujang, 15 mL honey, 15 g minced garlic, and 10 mL sesame oil for at least 3 hours.
Preheat oven to 180°C. Place ribs on a baking sheet and cover with foil.
Bake for 1.5 hours, then remove foil and increase heat to 220°C. Cook for an additional 30 minutes until caramelized.
Serve garnished with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
description: Tender pork ribs coated in a sweet and spicy Korean sauce, slow-baked to achieve a deep, rich flavor.

name: Kofta Curry
author: System
method: Mix 500 g ground lamb with 10 g minced garlic, 10 g minced ginger, 5 g garam masala, 5 g cumin, salt, and pepper. Form into balls.
Fry kofta balls in 30 mL vegetable oil until browned all over. Set aside.
In the same pan, add 1 chopped onion, cook until soft. Stir in 200 g crushed tomatoes, 100 mL coconut milk, and return koftas to the pan.
Simmer for 20 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with naan.
description: Spicy and savory kofta meatballs simmered in a rich tomato and coconut milk sauce, served with warm naan.

name: Key West Chicken Skewers
author: System
method: Whisk together 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL honey, 10 mL lime juice, and 5 g minced garlic. Marinate 500 g chicken breast cubes in this mixture for 2 hours.
Thread chicken onto skewers, alternating with pieces of bell pepper and onion.
Grill over medium heat, turning occasionally, until chicken is cooked through, about 10-15 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with lime wedges.
description: Grilled chicken skewers marinated in a tangy and sweet sauce, perfect for a summer barbecue.

name: Kale Caesar Salad with Crispy Chickpeas
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C. Toss 200 g chickpeas with 15 mL olive oil and salt. Roast for 20 minutes until crispy.
In a large bowl, massage 300 g chopped kale with 10 mL olive oil and a pinch of salt until slightly wilted.
Add crispy chickpeas, 50 g shaved Parmesan, and 100 mL Caesar dressing. Toss to combine.
Serve topped with additional Parmesan and black pepper.
description: A fresh twist on the classic Caesar salad, featuring nutrient-rich kale, crispy chickpeas, and a creamy Caesar dressing.

name: Kumquat Chutney
author: System
method: Chop 250 g kumquats and remove seeds. Simmer in a pot with 200 mL apple cider vinegar, 200 g sugar, 50 g raisins, 10 g grated ginger, and a pinch of salt for 1 hour until thickened.
Cool and transfer to jars. Store in the refrigerator.
Serve as an accompaniment to meats or cheeses.
description: A tangy and sweet kumquat chutney, perfect for enhancing the flavors of a variety of dishes.

name: Kielbasa and Red Cabbage Stew
author: System
method: Slice 400 g kielbasa sausage and brown in a pot with 15 mL vegetable oil.
Add 500 g shredded red cabbage, 1 sliced apple, 200 mL chicken broth, and 30 mL red wine vinegar. Simmer for 30 minutes until cabbage is tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.
description: A hearty stew featuring smoky kielbasa sausage and sweet-tart red cabbage, simmered to perfection.

name: Kale Pesto Pasta
author: System
method: Blend 200 g kale, 50 g almonds, 50 g grated Parmesan, 2 cloves garlic, and 100 mL olive oil until smooth.
Cook 400 g pasta according to package directions, drain, reserving some cooking water.
Toss pasta with kale pesto, adding reserved water as needed to achieve desired consistency.
Serve garnished with additional Parmesan and red pepper flakes.
description: A vibrant and healthy twist on traditional pesto, made with kale and almonds, served over al dente pasta.

name: Kedgeree with Smoked Cod
author: System
method: Cook 200 g rice in 400 mL water with a pinch of turmeric until fluffy.
Flake 300 g smoked cod. In a skillet, heat 15 mL butter and lightly fry 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic.
Mix the flaked cod, cooked rice, 100 g peas, and 30 mL cream. Heat through.
Garnish with chopped parsley and quartered hard-boiled eggs before serving.
description: A flavorful British-Indian dish with smoky cod and aromatic spices mixed with rice, peas, and eggs.

name: Kale and Roasted Sweet Potato Salad
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C. Cube 400 g sweet potatoes and toss with 15 mL olive oil and a pinch of salt. Roast for 25 minutes until tender.
In a large bowl, combine roasted sweet potatoes with 200 g chopped kale, 50 g dried cranberries, and 50 g feta cheese crumbles.
Whisk together 30 mL balsamic vinegar, 10 mL honey, and 30 mL olive oil for dressing. Pour over the salad and toss.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
description: A hearty and colorful salad with roasted sweet potatoes, kale, sweet cranberries, and tangy feta, dressed in a sweet balsamic vinaigrette.

name: Kashmiri Paneer Masala
author: System
method: Heat 15 mL vegetable oil in a pan. Fry 200 g cubed paneer until golden and set aside.
In the same pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds, 2 crushed cardamom pods, and sauté for 1 minute. Add 200 g pureed tomatoes, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp chili powder, and cook until oil separates.
Add 100 mL cream and the fried paneer. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice or naan.
description: A rich and aromatic North Indian curry featuring soft paneer cubes in a creamy tomato-based sauce with traditional spices.

name: Kielbasa Pepper Skillet
author: System
method: Slice 500 g kielbasa sausage and sauté in a skillet with 15 mL olive oil until browned.
Add 1 each sliced red and green bell pepper and 1 sliced onion, sauté until vegetables are soft.
Season with 5 mL smoked paprika and salt to taste. Serve hot with crusty bread.
description: A quick and flavorful skillet dish featuring smoky kielbasa sausage with colorful bell peppers and onions.

name: Kung Pao Cauliflower
author: System
method: Cut 500 g cauliflower into florets. Toss with 15 mL soy sauce, 15 mL cornstarch, and fry in hot oil until crispy. Set aside.
In the same pan, add 5 dried chilies, 50 g peanuts, and sauté for 1 minute.
Add 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL vinegar, 10 g sugar, and 100 mL water. Bring to a simmer.
Add the cauliflower back to the pan, toss to coat. Garnish with green onions and serve.
description: A vegetarian take on the classic Chinese dish, featuring crispy cauliflower in a spicy and savory sauce with peanuts.

name: Korean Bulgogi Burger
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g thinly sliced beef in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL sesame oil, 10 g sugar, and 5 g garlic for 2 hours.
Grill the beef until caramelized. Assemble burgers with the beef, kimchi, and a spicy mayo on toasted buns.
Serve immediately.
description: A fusion dish that combines the sweet and savory flavors of traditional Korean bulgogi with the American classic burger, enhanced with kimchi.

name: Kale and Apple Salad with Maple Vinaigrette
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 200 g chopped kale, 1 diced apple, and 50 g crumbled goat cheese.
Make the vinaigrette by whisking together 30 mL maple syrup, 15 mL apple cider vinegar, 30 mL olive oil, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. Top with 30 g toasted walnuts before serving.
description: A fresh and crisp salad combining sweet apples and kale, topped with goat cheese and walnuts, dressed in a sweet maple vinaigrette.

name: Korean BBQ Tacos
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g thinly sliced beef in a mixture of 30 mL soy sauce, 20 g brown sugar, 10 mL sesame oil, and 5 g minced garlic for at least 2 hours.
Grill the beef until caramelized. Slice into bite-sized pieces.
Serve on warmed corn tortillas with kimchi, sliced green onions, and a drizzle of sriracha mayo.
description: A fusion dish featuring tender Korean BBQ beef served in soft tacos, topped with spicy kimchi and a creamy sriracha mayo.

name: Kiwi Coconut Smoothie
author: System
method: In a blender, combine 4 peeled kiwis, 200 mL coconut milk, 1 frozen banana, and 15 mL honey.
Blend until smooth. Pour into glasses and garnish with kiwi slices.
Serve immediately for a refreshing treat.
description: A tropical and refreshing smoothie blending sweet kiwis with creamy coconut milk and a touch of honey.

name: Kashmiri Lamb Chops
author: System
method: Marinate 8 lamb chops in a mix of 30 mL yogurt, 5 g garam masala, 5 g paprika, 5 g garlic paste, and 5 g ginger paste for 4 hours.
Grill over medium heat until charred and cooked to desired doneness, about 4 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Serve with mint chutney and naan.
description: Richly spiced lamb chops marinated in a traditional Kashmiri mixture, grilled to perfection.

name: Kielbasa and Sauerkraut Skillet
author: System
method: In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium heat. Slice 400 g kielbasa and fry until browned.
Add 500 g sauerkraut, 1 sliced onion, and 5 mL caraway seeds. Cook for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with crusty bread.
description: A hearty Eastern European dish featuring smoky kielbasa and tangy sauerkraut, seasoned with caraway for an authentic flavor.

name: Kung Pao Brussels Sprouts
author: System
method: Halve 500 g Brussels sprouts and toss with 15 mL vegetable oil. Roast at 200°C for 20 minutes until crispy.
In a saucepan, combine 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL hoisin sauce, 10 mL vinegar, 10 g sugar, and 5 mL sesame oil. Bring to a simmer.
Add roasted Brussels sprouts to the sauce, toss with 30 g peanuts and 5 g dried chilies.
Serve hot, garnished with sliced green onions.
description: A delicious twist on a classic Chinese dish, featuring crispy roasted Brussels sprouts with a spicy and savory Kung Pao sauce.

name: Kerala Chicken Stew
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL coconut oil. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, 20 g grated ginger, and 1 chopped green chili. Sauté until onion is translucent.
Add 500 g chicken pieces and brown lightly. Pour in 400 mL coconut milk and 200 mL chicken stock. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 30 minutes.
Stir in 100 g diced potatoes and 100 g carrots. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh curry leaves. Serve with appam or rice.
description: A fragrant and creamy stew from Kerala featuring chicken, coconut milk, and vegetables, seasoned with ginger and curry leaves.

name: Key Lime Yogurt Parfait
author: System
method: Mix 400 g Greek yogurt with 30 mL key lime juice and 30 g honey until smooth.
In glasses, layer the yogurt mixture with 100 g crushed graham crackers and 50 g lime zest.
Chill for 1 hour before serving, topped with whipped cream and additional lime zest.
description: A refreshing and light parfait featuring tangy key lime yogurt layered with sweet graham crackers, perfect for a quick dessert or snack.

name: Kashmiri Rajma
author: System
method: Soak 300 g kidney beans overnight. Drain and cook in a pressure cooker with 1 L water until tender.
In a pan, heat 15 mL vegetable oil, add 1 tsp cumin seeds, 2 bay leaves, and 1 finely chopped onion. Sauté until onions are golden.
Add 2 minced garlic cloves, 10 g grated ginger, 1 chopped tomato, 1 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp coriander powder, and 1 tsp garam masala. Cook until oil separates.
Add cooked kidney beans with some cooking liquid, simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and garnish with coriander.
Serve with rice or roti.
description: A rich and hearty bean curry from Kashmir, flavored with traditional spices and simmered to perfection.

name: Kofta Kebab Wrap
author: System
method: Mix 500 g ground lamb with 10 g minced garlic, 10 g minced onion, 5 g paprika, 5 g cumin, and salt. Form into elongated kebabs around skewers.
Grill over medium heat until cooked through, about 10 minutes.
Wrap kebabs in pita bread with lettuce, tomatoes, and tzatziki sauce.
Serve immediately.
description: Savory grilled lamb koftas wrapped in soft pita with fresh vegetables and a cooling tzatziki sauce.

name: Kale and Gouda Cheese Frittata
author: System
method: Whisk together 6 eggs, 50 mL milk, salt, and pepper.
In a skillet, sauté 150 g chopped kale until wilted. Add 100 g diced Gouda cheese.
Pour the egg mixture over the kale and cheese. Cook over low heat until eggs are set but still moist.
Finish under the broiler until golden. Slice and serve.
description: A delicious frittata combining earthy kale and creamy Gouda cheese, perfect for breakfast or a light dinner.

name: Korean Style Pan-Fried Snapper
author: System
method: Season 4 snapper fillets with salt and pepper. Dust with flour.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL sesame oil over medium heat. Cook fillets until golden and cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.
Serve with a sauce made from 30 mL soy sauce, 10 mL honey, and juice of 1 lime.
Garnish with sliced scallions and sesame seeds.
description: Tender snapper fillets pan-fried to perfection, served with a sweet and tangy Korean-inspired sauce.

name: Key West Shrimp Ceviche
author: System
method: Mix 500 g cooked and cooled shrimp with juice of 2 limes, 1 chopped red onion, 1 diced avocado, and 100 g diced tomatoes.
Season with salt, pepper, and 5 mL hot sauce. Refrigerate for 1 hour to allow flavors to meld.
Serve chilled, garnished with fresh cilantro and additional lime wedges.
description: A refreshing ceviche with juicy shrimp, citrusy lime juice, and fresh vegetables, perfect for a light meal or appetizer.

name: Kabocha Squash Soup
author: System
method: Peel and cube 1 kg kabocha squash. In a large pot, sauté squash with 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves garlic in 15 mL olive oil until onion is translucent.
Add 1 L vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until squash is tender, about 25 minutes.
Puree the soup with an immersion blender. Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of nutmeg.
Serve hot, garnished with a dollop of cream and roasted pumpkin seeds.
description: A smooth and creamy soup made from kabocha squash, subtly spiced and enriched with a touch of cream.

name: Kiwi and Strawberry Tart
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C. Roll out 300 g pastry dough and line a tart pan. Prick with a fork and bake for 15 minutes.
Mix 200 mL cream cheese with 50 g sugar and 5 mL vanilla extract. Spread over the cooled crust.
Top with sliced kiwis and strawberries in a decorative pattern.
Chill for 2 hours before serving.
description: A delightful dessert tart featuring a creamy filling and topped with fresh kiwis and strawberries on a buttery crust.

name: Kung Pao Calamari
author: System
method: Slice 500 g calamari into rings. In a bowl, toss with 10 mL soy sauce and 15 g cornstarch.
Heat 15 mL vegetable oil in a wok over high heat. Add calamari and stir-fry until crisp, about 2 minutes. Remove and set aside.
In the same wok, add 5 dried chilies and 50 g peanuts, stir-fry for 1 minute.
Mix in a sauce made from 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL vinegar, 10 g sugar, 5 mL sesame oil, and 100 mL water. Bring to a simmer.
Return calamari to the wok, toss to coat with the sauce. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve immediately.
description: A spicy and savory dish featuring crispy calamari in the classic Kung Pao style, accented with peanuts and chilies.

name: Lemon Lavender Chicken
author: System
method: Marinate 4 chicken breasts in a mixture of 30 mL lemon juice, 15 mL olive oil, 5 g dried lavender, and 5 g salt for 2 hours.
Bake in a preheated oven at 190°C (375°F) for 25 minutes or until cooked through.
Serve with a side of steamed asparagus and drizzled with extra lemon juice.
description: Aromatic chicken marinated in lemon and lavender, offering a refreshing and floral twist to a classic dish.

name: Linguine with Clam Sauce
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of linguine al dente, drain and set aside.
In a skillet, heat 30 mL of olive oil, sauté 4 minced garlic cloves, then add 200 g of canned clams with their juice.
Simmer for 10 minutes, then toss with the pasta and 15 mL of chopped parsley.
Serve hot, sprinkled with grated Parmesan cheese.
description: A simple yet elegant pasta dish featuring linguine tossed in a savory clam sauce with garlic and parsley.

name: Lamb Tagine with Apricots
author: System
method: Brown 1 kg of lamb shoulder, cut into chunks, in 30 mL of oil.
Add 1 chopped onion, 3 cloves of minced garlic, and 5 g each of cumin, cinnamon, and ginger. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add 500 mL of chicken stock and 200 g of dried apricots. Simmer covered for 1 hour.
Serve with couscous and garnish with toasted almonds.
description: Rich and flavorful Moroccan-inspired tagine, with tender lamb and sweet apricots, spiced perfectly with traditional seasonings.

name: Lobster Bisque
author: System
method: Cook 2 whole lobsters in boiling water, remove meat, and reserve shells.
Sauté shells in 30 mL of oil, add 1 chopped carrot, 1 stalk of celery, and 1 onion. Cook until vegetables are soft.
Add 500 mL of fish stock and 250 mL of cream. Simmer for 30 minutes, then strain.
Add lobster meat back to the strained soup, heat through, and serve garnished with fresh chives.
description: A creamy and luxurious soup made from fresh lobsters, enriched with a deep seafood flavor and smooth texture.

name: Lemon Poppy Seed Cake
author: System
method: Cream 200 g of butter with 200 g of sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in 3 eggs one at a time.
Mix in 250 g of flour, 10 g of baking powder, 5 g of poppy seeds, and zest of 2 lemons.
Pour into a greased loaf pan and bake at 180°C (356°F) for 50 minutes.
Glaze with a mix of lemon juice and powdered sugar before serving.
description: A moist and fluffy cake infused with lemon zest and dotted with poppy seeds, topped with a sweet lemon glaze.

name: Lemon Herb Roasted Turkey
author: System
method: Rub a 5 kg turkey with a mix of 30 g of salt, 30 g of pepper, 15 g of rosemary, and the zest of 2 lemons.
Stuff the cavity with halved lemons and a bunch of thyme.
Roast in a preheated oven at 175°C (347°F) for 3.5 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 74°C (165°F).
Rest the turkey for 20 minutes before carving. Serve with a side of roasted vegetables.
description: Flavorful and moist turkey seasoned with lemon and fresh herbs, perfect for holiday feasts or special occasions.

name: Lobster Roll
author: System
method: Cook 500 g of lobster meat in boiling water, then chop.
Mix lobster with 30 mL of mayonnaise, 5 mL of lemon juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Spoon the mixture into 4 split-top buns, lightly toasted with butter.
Serve immediately, garnished with a sprinkle of chives.
description: A New England classic, featuring succulent lobster mixed with a light dressing and served in a buttery, toasted bun.

name: Lime Coconut Curry Chicken
author: System
method: In a skillet, brown 500 g of diced chicken breast in 15 mL of coconut oil.
Add 200 mL of coconut milk, 30 mL of lime juice, 5 g of curry powder, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in 50 g of diced tomatoes and 50 g of chopped cilantro. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve over steamed jasmine rice.
description: A tropical curry with bold flavors of lime and coconut, complemented by tender chicken and aromatic spices.

name: Linguine with Lemon Cream Sauce
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of linguine until al dente. Drain, reserving some pasta water.
In the same pot, melt 30 g of butter and add 200 mL of cream and zest of 1 lemon. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Toss the linguine with the cream sauce, adding pasta water as needed to loosen the sauce.
Serve garnished with Parmesan cheese and black pepper.
description: Delicate linguine tossed in a smooth and tangy lemon cream sauce, a quick yet elegant pasta dish.

name: Layered Vegetable Lasagna
author: System
method: Layer sheets of lasagna with 300 g of spinach, 200 g of ricotta cheese, 200 g of sliced zucchini, and 300 g of marinara sauce in a baking dish.
Repeat the layers twice, topping the final layer with 100 g of shredded mozzarella cheese.
Bake at 190°C (375°F) for 45 minutes or until bubbly and golden on top.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
description: A hearty and healthy lasagna packed with layers of fresh vegetables, ricotta, and marinara sauce, topped with melty mozzarella.

name: Lamb Loin Chops with Mint Pesto
author: System
method: For the pesto, blend 50 g of fresh mint leaves, 30 g of almonds, 1 clove of garlic, 60 mL of olive oil, and salt and pepper to taste until smooth.
Season 8 lamb loin chops with salt and pepper, and grill over high heat for 4 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Serve the chops drizzled with the mint pesto.
description: Tender grilled lamb loin chops enhanced with a vibrant and fresh mint pesto, a perfect combination of flavors.

name: Lemon Dill Salmon Fillets
author: System
method: Mix 30 mL of lemon juice, 30 mL of olive oil, 5 g of chopped fresh dill, and salt and pepper to taste.
Marinate 4 salmon fillets in the mixture for 30 minutes.
Bake at 200°C (392°F) for 15 minutes, or until the salmon flakes easily with a fork.
Serve with a side of steamed green beans.
description: Oven-baked salmon fillets marinated in lemon and dill, offering a light and refreshing flavor ideal for a healthy meal.

name: Linguine with Lobster Sauce
author: System
method: Sauté 1 minced onion and 2 cloves of garlic in 30 mL of butter until translucent.
Add 500 g of chopped cooked lobster meat and 100 mL of brandy, simmer until the brandy is reduced by half.
Stir in 500 mL of heavy cream, bring to a boil, and simmer for 10 minutes until thickened.
Toss with 400 g of cooked linguine and serve garnished with chopped parsley and lemon wedges.
description: Luxurious linguine enveloped in a creamy lobster sauce, enriched with brandy for an extra layer of flavor.

name: Lamb and Lentil Stew
author: System
method: Brown 500 g of diced lamb shoulder in 30 mL of olive oil in a large pot.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 chopped carrots, and 2 cloves of minced garlic, cook until the onion is soft.
Stir in 200 g of rinsed lentils, 1 liter of beef broth, and 5 g of thyme. Simmer covered for 1 hour or until the lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper and serve with crusty bread.
description: A hearty stew with tender lamb and earthy lentils, infused with aromatic herbs, perfect for a comforting meal.

name: Leek and Potato Soup
author: System
method: Sauté 3 sliced leeks and 2 diced potatoes in 30 mL of butter until the leeks are soft.
Add 1 liter of vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Simmer for 20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender.
Blend the soup until smooth, season with salt and pepper, and stir in 100 mL of cream.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped chives.
description: A creamy and comforting soup featuring soft leeks and tender potatoes, blended into a smooth and flavorful dish.

name: Lobster Thermidor
author: System
method: Boil 2 whole lobsters for 15 minutes, then extract the meat and chop. Reserve shells.
Sauté 30 g of minced shallots in 30 mL of butter until translucent. Add 15 mL of brandy and flambé.
Stir in 250 mL of heavy cream, reduce by half, then mix in the lobster meat with 5 g of mustard and 5 g of chopped tarragon.
Fill the lobster shells with the mixture, top with 50 g of grated Parmesan, and broil until golden.
Serve immediately.
description: A luxurious French dish featuring succulent lobster in a creamy, cognac-flavored sauce, baked in its shell with Parmesan.

name: Lime-Marinated Grilled Shrimp
author: System
method: Marinate 400 g of shrimp in a mixture of 30 mL of lime juice, 15 mL of olive oil, 5 g of minced garlic, and 5 g of chili flakes for 1 hour.
Skewer the shrimp and grill over medium heat for 3 minutes per side.
Serve with a fresh mango salsa made from 200 g of diced mango, 50 g of diced red pepper, and 15 mL of lime juice.
description: Zesty and slightly spicy shrimp grilled to perfection, paired with a sweet and tangy mango salsa.

name: Lemon-Pepper Roasted Chicken
author: System
method: Rub a whole chicken with a mixture of 30 mL of olive oil, the zest of 1 lemon, 10 g of cracked black pepper, and 5 g of salt.
Place lemon slices inside the chicken cavity and truss the legs.
Roast in a preheated oven at 190°C (375°F) for 1 hour and 20 minutes, or until the juices run clear.
Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.
description: Crispy-skinned chicken roasted with a fragrant lemon-pepper seasoning, perfect for a flavorful Sunday dinner.

name: Lamb Koftas with Tzatziki
author: System
method: Mix 500 g of ground lamb with 10 g of minced garlic, 10 g of chopped mint, 5 g of cumin, and salt and pepper to taste.
Form into 12 koftas and grill over medium heat for 6 minutes per side.
Serve with tzatziki made from 250 g of Greek yogurt, 50 g of grated cucumber, 5 mL of lemon juice, and 5 g of minced garlic.
description: Spicy and aromatic lamb koftas paired with a cool and creamy tzatziki sauce, perfect for a Mediterranean-inspired meal.

name: Layered Ratatouille
author: System
method: Thinly slice 1 zucchini, 1 yellow squash, 1 eggplant, and 2 tomatoes.
Arrange in an overlapping pattern in a baking dish.
Drizzle with a mix of 30 mL olive oil, 5 g minced garlic, and herbs.
Cover and bake at 175°C (350°F) for 45 minutes, then uncover and bake for an additional 15 minutes.
Serve warm, sprinkled with fresh basil.
description: A visually stunning and delicious dish with layers of summer vegetables, all beautifully seasoned and baked.

name: Lemon Basil Pasta
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of fettuccine until al dente. Drain, reserving some pasta water.
In a skillet, heat 30 mL of olive oil, add the zest and juice of 1 lemon, and 30 g of fresh chopped basil.
Toss the pasta with the lemon basil sauce, adding pasta water as needed to achieve the desired consistency.
Season with salt and pepper, serve topped with grated Parmesan cheese.
description: A light and refreshing pasta dish featuring a simple lemon basil sauce, perfect for a quick summer meal.

name: Lamb Shank Osso Buco
author: System
method: Season 4 lamb shanks with salt and pepper. Brown in a hot pan with 30 mL of olive oil.
Remove the shanks and sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 diced carrots, and 2 diced celery stalks in the same pan.
Add 200 mL of white wine and reduce by half. Return the shanks to the pan, add 500 mL of chicken broth, and simmer for 2 hours until the meat is tender.
Serve with gremolata made from lemon zest, garlic, and parsley.
description: A hearty and luxurious dish where lamb shanks are slowly braised with vegetables and white wine, topped with a fresh gremolata.

name: Loaded Baked Potato Soup
author: System
method: Bake 4 large potatoes until tender. Scoop out the flesh and mash lightly.
In a pot, cook 5 slices of chopped bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté 1 diced onion in the bacon fat. Add the potato flesh, 500 mL of chicken broth, and 250 mL of cream. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve topped with crisp bacon, shredded cheddar cheese, and chopped green onions.
description: Creamy and comforting potato soup loaded with all the fixings of a baked potato, perfect for a chilly day.

name: Linguine Carbonara
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of linguine al dente. Reserve 120 mL of pasta water.
In a pan, cook 100 g of pancetta until crisp. Remove and set aside.
Beat 3 eggs with 100 g of grated Parmesan cheese and black pepper.
Toss the hot pasta with the egg mixture, adding reserved pasta water to create a creamy sauce.
Mix in the pancetta and serve immediately.
description: A classic Italian pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and pepper, creating a rich and creamy sauce.

name: Lemon Garlic Tilapia
author: System
method: Marinate 4 tilapia fillets in a mixture of 30 mL lemon juice, 15 mL olive oil, 5 g minced garlic, and salt and pepper for 30 minutes.
Bake the fillets at 200°C (392°F) for 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Serve with steamed broccoli and garnish with additional lemon slices.
description: Light and flaky tilapia fillets marinated in lemon and garlic, baked to perfection for a healthy and delicious meal.

name: Lobster Newburg
author: System
method: Steam 2 whole lobsters, extract the meat and chop. Set aside.
In a saucepan, melt 30 g of butter, stir in 30 g of flour to create a roux, then gradually add 250 mL of cream.
Cook until the sauce thickens, then stir in the lobster meat, 15 mL of brandy, and 5 g of paprika.
Heat gently without boiling. Serve over buttered toast points.
description: A rich and creamy seafood dish featuring tender lobster in a velvety sauce made with cream and a touch of brandy.

name: Lamb Ragu with Pappardelle
author: System
method: Brown 500 g of ground lamb in a skillet. Drain excess fat.
Add 1 finely chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves, cook until onion is soft.
Pour in 500 mL of tomato sauce and 100 mL of red wine. Simmer for 45 minutes.
Serve over cooked pappardelle pasta, garnished with grated Parmesan and fresh basil.
description: A hearty Italian sauce made with ground lamb and simmered in a rich tomato and wine sauce, served over broad, flat pasta noodles.

name: Lemon Caper Chicken
author: System
method: Season 4 chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Pan-fry in 30 mL of olive oil until golden.
Add 30 g of capers and the juice of 1 lemon to the pan, scraping up any browned bits.
Simmer for 5 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
Serve with a garnish of parsley and slices of lemon.
description: Simple yet flavorful chicken breasts cooked with tangy lemon and briny capers, creating a delightful sauce.

name: Linguine with White Clam Sauce
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of linguine until al dente, drain, reserving some pasta water.
In a pan, heat 30 mL of olive oil, sauté 4 minced garlic cloves, then add 200 g of canned clams with their juice.
Add 50 mL of white wine, simmer until the wine is reduced by half.
Toss the linguine with the clam sauce, adding reserved pasta water as needed.
Finish with chopped parsley and serve with lemon wedges.
description: Classic Italian pasta dish featuring linguine tossed in a garlicky white clam sauce, refined with white wine and fresh herbs.

name: Lavender Honey Ice Cream
author: System
method: Heat 500 mL of cream with 250 mL of milk and 10 g of dried lavender until just boiling, then remove from heat.
Whisk 4 egg yolks with 100 g of honey. Gradually add the lavender cream, whisking constantly.
Return mixture to heat and cook until it thickens enough to coat the back of a spoon.
Strain, chill thoroughly, then churn in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer's instructions.
description: Creamy homemade ice cream infused with the delicate flavors of lavender and sweet honey, a unique and refreshing treat.

name: Lamb Biryani
author: System
method: Marinate 1 kg of lamb cubes in a mixture of 30 mL of yogurt, 10 g of garam masala, 5 g of turmeric, and 5 g of salt for 4 hours.
In a large pot, sauté 2 chopped onions in 30 mL of ghee until golden. Add the marinated lamb and brown well.
Add 500 g of washed basmati rice and 1 liter of water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and cover. Simmer until rice and lamb are tender, about 30 minutes.
Stir in 50 g of chopped mint before serving. Garnish with fried onions.
description: Aromatic and flavorful Indian biryani with tender lamb and spices, cooked with fluffy basmati rice and mint.

name: Lemon Pepper Cod
author: System
method: Season 4 cod fillets with a mixture of 5 g of lemon zest, 10 g of cracked black pepper, and 5 g of salt.
Heat 15 mL of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add cod and cook for 4 minutes per side, or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
Serve with a side of sautéed spinach and lemon wedges.
description: Simple yet elegant cod fillets seasoned with lemon and pepper, pan-fried to perfection.

name: Linguine with Clam Sauce
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of linguine until al dente; drain, reserving 120 mL of pasta water.
In a skillet, heat 30 mL of olive oil and sauté 4 minced garlic cloves. Add 200 g of drained canned clams and 100 mL of white wine; simmer until wine is reduced by half.
Toss linguine with clam sauce, adding reserved pasta water as needed. Stir in 15 mL of chopped parsley.
Serve immediately, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.
description: A classic Italian dish, linguine tossed with a white wine clam sauce, garlic, and parsley.

name: Lobster Mac and Cheese
author: System
method: Cook 300 g of macaroni according to package instructions; drain.
In a saucepan, melt 30 g of butter and stir in 30 g of flour to make a roux. Gradually whisk in 500 mL of milk, bringing to a boil until thickened.
Remove from heat and mix in 200 g of grated sharp cheddar and 100 g of chopped cooked lobster meat.
Combine macaroni with cheese sauce, transfer to a baking dish, top with 50 g of breadcrumbs, and bake at 180°C (356°F) for 20 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped chives.
description: Decadent and creamy macaroni cheese enhanced with luxurious lobster meat, topped with a crispy breadcrumb layer.

name: Lentil Soup with Smoked Sausage
author: System
method: In a large pot, sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves in 30 mL of olive oil until onion is translucent.
Add 200 g of sliced smoked sausage and cook until browned.
Stir in 300 g of rinsed lentils, 1 liter of chicken broth, and 5 g each of thyme and paprika. Simmer covered for 30 minutes or until lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper, serve with a dollop of sour cream.
description: Hearty and flavorful soup made with earthy lentils and rich smoked sausage, spiced with thyme and paprika.

name: Lemon Ginger Tea
author: System
method: Boil 1 liter of water in a kettle.
Add the juice of 2 lemons and 20 g of freshly grated ginger to a teapot.
Pour the boiling water over the lemon and ginger and let steep for 5 minutes.
Strain into cups and sweeten with honey to taste.
description: A soothing and refreshing tea made with fresh lemon and spicy ginger, perfect for cold days or to soothe a sore throat.

name: Lentil and Spinach Salad
author: System
method: Cook 200 g of green lentils in boiling water until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain and let cool.
In a large bowl, combine the lentils, 200 g of fresh spinach, 100 g of cherry tomatoes halved, and 50 g of crumbled feta cheese.
Whisk together 30 mL of olive oil, 15 mL of balsamic vinegar, 5 g of minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Serve chilled.
description: A nutritious and filling salad featuring earthy lentils, fresh spinach, sweet tomatoes, and tangy feta, dressed in a balsamic vinaigrette.

name: Lobster Risotto
author: System
method: In a saucepan, heat 30 mL of olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 finely chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
Add 300 g of Arborio rice and toast for 2 minutes. Pour in 100 mL of white wine and stir until absorbed.
Gradually add 1 liter of warm seafood stock, stirring constantly, until the rice is creamy and al dente.
Stir in 300 g of cooked chopped lobster meat and 30 g of butter. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve garnished with chopped parsley and lemon wedges.
description: Creamy risotto enriched with succulent lobster and a hint of white wine, making it a luxurious seafood dish.

name: Lime Marinated Grilled Steak
author: System
method: Marinate 4 beef steaks in a mixture of 30 mL of lime juice, 30 mL of soy sauce, 10 g of minced garlic, and 5 g of cumin for 3 hours in the refrigerator.
Grill the steaks over high heat to desired doneness, about 4 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Let the steaks rest for 5 minutes before slicing. Serve with grilled vegetables and extra lime wedges.
description: Juicy grilled steaks marinated in a zesty lime and soy sauce mixture with a touch of garlic and cumin.

name: Leek and Potato Gratin
author: System
method: Thinly slice 3 leeks and 3 potatoes. Sauté leeks in 30 mL of butter until soft.
Layer the potatoes and leeks in a greased baking dish, seasoning each layer with salt and pepper.
Pour 250 mL of cream over the top and sprinkle with 100 g of grated Gruyère cheese.
Bake at 190°C (375°F) for 45 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the top is golden and bubbly.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh thyme.
description: A comforting and creamy gratin featuring tender potatoes and sweet leeks, topped with melted Gruyère cheese.

name: Lemon Risotto with Asparagus
author: System
method: In a saucepan, heat 30 mL of olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 finely chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
Stir in 300 g of Arborio rice and toast for 2 minutes. Add the zest and juice of 1 lemon, then gradually add 1 liter of vegetable broth, stirring constantly until the rice is creamy and al dente.
Add 200 g of chopped asparagus in the last 5 minutes of cooking. Stir in 30 g of Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper.
Serve garnished with additional lemon zest and fresh parsley.
description: Creamy lemon-flavored risotto paired with crisp asparagus, perfect for a refreshing spring or summer meal.

name: Lime-Cilantro Chicken Skewers
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g of chicken breast cubes in a mixture of 30 mL lime juice, 30 mL olive oil, 15 g chopped cilantro, and 5 g chili powder for 2 hours.
Thread the chicken onto skewers and grill over medium heat until cooked through, about 10 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve with a yogurt dipping sauce and lime wedges.
description: Zesty and herby chicken skewers marinated in lime and cilantro, perfect for a summer barbecue or quick dinner.

name: Linguine with Garlic and Oil
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of linguine al dente. Drain, reserving some pasta water.
In a skillet, heat 30 mL of olive oil over medium heat. Add 6 cloves of minced garlic and sauté until golden.
Toss the pasta with the garlic oil, adding reserved pasta water as needed. Season with red pepper flakes and salt.
Serve garnished with chopped parsley.
description: A simple yet delicious Italian classic, linguine tossed with aromatic garlic-infused olive oil and a hint of spice.

name: Lobster Bisque
author: System
method: Boil 2 whole lobsters for 12 minutes, remove meat, and reserve shells. Chop meat and set aside.
Sauté lobster shells in 30 mL of olive oil with 1 chopped onion, 1 diced carrot, and 1 diced celery stalk until vegetables are soft.
Add 30 mL of brandy and flambé. Stir in 500 mL of fish stock and 250 mL of cream, simmer for 30 minutes.
Strain, add lobster meat back to the soup, and season with salt and white pepper. Heat through and serve.
description: A rich and elegant soup made from fresh lobster, cream, and a touch of brandy, perfect for special occasions.

name: Lamb Stew with Root Vegetables
author: System
method: Brown 1 kg of cubed lamb shoulder in 30 mL of olive oil in a large pot.
Add 2 chopped onions, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and sauté until onions are translucent.

Add 300 g of chopped carrots, 300 g of diced potatoes, 200 g of sliced parsnips, 1 liter of beef broth, and 10 g of rosemary. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1.5 hours or until the meat is tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with crusty bread.
description: Hearty lamb stew cooked slowly with carrots, potatoes, and parsnips, flavored with rosemary, perfect for a cold evening.

name: Lemon and Dill Salmon
author: System
method: Place 4 salmon fillets on a baking sheet.
Mix 30 mL of lemon juice, 30 mL of melted butter, 5 g of chopped dill, salt, and pepper, and brush over the salmon.
Bake at 200°C (392°F) for 12-15 minutes or until salmon is cooked through.
Garnish with lemon slices and serve with steamed asparagus.
description: Flaky salmon fillets baked with a light and tangy lemon-dill sauce, simple and perfect for a healthy dinner.

name: Linguine with Cherry Tomatoes and Olives
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of linguine al dente, drain.
In a skillet, heat 30 mL of olive oil, add 200 g of halved cherry tomatoes and 100 g of pitted Kalamata olives, sauté for 5 minutes.
Toss the linguine with the tomato mixture, add 15 g of chopped basil, and season with salt and pepper.
Serve with grated Parmesan cheese.
description: A vibrant and flavorful pasta dish featuring sweet cherry tomatoes, salty olives, and fresh basil.

name: Lime Chicken Tacos
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g of chicken breast strips in a mixture of 30 mL of lime juice, 5 g of chili powder, 5 g of cumin, and salt for 1 hour.
Grill the chicken over medium heat until cooked through, about 6-8 minutes per side.
Serve in corn tortillas with diced avocado, salsa, and sour cream.
description: Zesty and flavorful grilled chicken tacos with a fresh lime marinade, served with avocado and salsa.

name: Layered Mediterranean Dip
author: System
method: In a serving dish, spread 200 g of hummus as the first layer.
Top with 100 g of chopped cucumbers, 100 g of diced tomatoes, 50 g of sliced black olives, and 100 g of crumbled feta cheese.
Drizzle with 30 mL of olive oil and a sprinkle of 5 g of za'atar.
Chill for 1 hour before serving with pita chips.
description: A delightful and easy-to-make dip layered with hummus, fresh vegetables, olives, feta, and a touch of za'atar, perfect for any gathering.

name: Lemon Herb Roast Chicken
author: System
method: Rub a whole chicken with a mixture of 5 g salt, 5 g black pepper, the zest of 1 lemon, and 10 g chopped fresh herbs (rosemary, thyme, parsley).
Stuff the cavity with the zested lemon cut into quarters and a few sprigs of herbs.
Roast in a preheated oven at 190°C (375°F) for 1.5 hours, or until the juices run clear and the internal temperature reaches 74°C (165°F).
Let rest for 10 minutes before serving.
description: Juicy roast chicken seasoned with fresh lemon and a blend of herbs, perfect for a comforting family meal.

name: Lobster Risotto
author: System
method: Cook 300 g of lobster meat in boiling water, then chop into chunks. Set aside.
In a pot, sauté 1 finely chopped onion in 30 mL of olive oil until translucent. Add 300 g of Arborio rice and cook until the edges become slightly translucent.
Gradually add 1 liter of hot seafood broth, stirring continuously until the rice absorbs the liquid and becomes creamy.
Stir in the lobster meat, 30 g of butter, and 50 g of grated Parmesan cheese until combined and heated through.
Serve immediately, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.
description: Luxurious risotto with tender chunks of lobster, creamy and rich with the flavors of the sea, enhanced with Parmesan.

name: Lime Cilantro Grilled Corn
author: System
method: Peel back the husks of 4 ears of corn but do not remove. Remove the silks and brush the corn with 15 mL of melted butter.
Mix 5 g of salt, 5 g of chili powder, the zest and juice of 1 lime, and 10 g of chopped cilantro. Brush this mixture over the corn.
Pull the husks back over the corn and grill over medium heat for 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked.
Serve hot with additional lime wedges and cilantro.
description: Fresh corn grilled with a tangy lime cilantro butter, offering a delightful mix of flavors with a hint of spice.

name: Leek and Mushroom Quiche
author: System
method: Sauté 200 g of sliced leeks and 200 g of chopped mushrooms in 30 mL of olive oil until soft.
Whisk together 4 eggs, 200 mL of cream, salt, and pepper.
Spread the leek and mushroom mixture into a pre-baked pie crust, pour over the egg mixture.
Bake at 175°C (350°F) for 30 minutes or until set.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
description: A savory quiche filled with the gentle sweetness of leeks and earthiness of mushrooms, bound in a creamy egg custard.

name: Lavender Honey Glazed Duck
author: System
method: Score the skin of 2 duck breasts. Season with salt and pepper.
Pan-sear duck skin-side down over low heat to render the fat, about 15 minutes.
Flip and cook for another 10 minutes until medium rare. Remove and let rest.
Discard most of the fat, add 50 mL of honey and 5 g of dried lavender to the pan, and heat until syrupy.
Slice the duck and drizzle with the lavender honey glaze.
Serve with a side of roasted root vegetables.
description: Perfectly cooked duck breasts with crispy skin, enhanced with a sweet and aromatic lavender honey glaze.

name: Lemon Thyme Roasted Turkey
author: System
method: Rub a whole turkey with a mixture of 30 mL olive oil, the zest of 2 lemons, 10 g fresh thyme, salt, and pepper.
Stuff the cavity with lemon halves and additional thyme sprigs.
Roast in a preheated oven at 175°C (350°F) for 3 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 74°C (165°F).
Let rest for 20 minutes before carving. Serve with a side of roasted root vegetables.
description: A festive turkey roasted with a herbaceous lemon thyme rub, providing a juicy and aromatic centerpiece for any special occasion.

name: Lobster and Corn Chowder
author: System
method: Cook 2 whole lobsters, extract meat, chop, and set aside. Reserve shells.
Sauté shells in 30 mL butter with 1 chopped onion, 2 diced carrots, and 2 diced celery stalks. Add 500 mL fish stock and simmer for 30 minutes. Strain and reserve the broth.
In another pot, melt 30 g butter, add reserved broth, 200 g diced potatoes, and 300 g corn. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Add chopped lobster meat, 200 mL cream, and heat through. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped chives.
description: A rich and comforting chowder with succulent lobster and sweet corn, perfect for a luxurious winter meal.

name: Lime Marinated Flank Steak
author: System
method: Marinate 1 kg of flank steak in a mixture of 60 mL lime juice, 30 mL soy sauce, 10 g minced garlic, and 5 g ground cumin for 4 hours in the refrigerator.
Grill over high heat for 5 minutes on each side for medium-rare.
Let the steak rest for 10 minutes before slicing against the grain. Serve with grilled vegetables and fresh salsa.
description: Tender and flavorful flank steak marinated in a zesty lime and cumin mix, grilled to perfection.

name: Lavender Crème Brûlée
author: System
method: Heat 500 mL of heavy cream with 5 g of dried lavender until just boiling. Remove from heat and let steep for 15 minutes. Strain.
Whisk 6 egg yolks with 70 g of sugar. Gradually add the lavender-infused cream, stirring continuously.
Pour mixture into ramekins. Bake in a water bath at 150°C (300°F) for 40 minutes. Chill for at least 2 hours.
Sprinkle with sugar and torch until caramelized. Serve immediately.
description: A delicate and aromatic dessert, infusing traditional crème brûlée with the subtle flavor of lavender.

name: Lemon and Herb Baked Cod
author: System
method: Place 4 cod fillets in a baking dish.
Mix 30 mL of lemon juice, 15 mL of olive oil, 5 g of chopped parsley, 5 g of dill, and salt and pepper to taste.
Pour the mixture over the cod, then bake at 200°C (392°F) for 12-15 minutes until the fish is flaky.
Serve with steamed green beans and lemon slices.
description: Light and flaky cod fillets seasoned with fresh lemon juice and herbs, baked to perfection.

name: Lamb Kebabs with Mint Yogurt Sauce
author: System
method: Cube 500 g of lamb leg and marinate in a mixture of 30 mL olive oil, 10 g minced garlic, 5 g cumin, and salt and pepper for 2 hours.
Thread the lamb onto skewers and grill over medium heat for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally.
Mix 200 g of Greek yogurt with 15 g of chopped mint, 5 mL of lemon juice, and salt to taste for the sauce.
Serve the kebabs with the mint yogurt sauce and grilled vegetables.
description: Juicy grilled lamb kebabs marinated in a spiced oil, served with a refreshing mint yogurt sauce.

name: Linguine with Seafood Alfredo
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of linguine al dente; drain and set aside.
In a saucepan, melt 30 g of butter and sauté 200 g of mixed seafood (shrimp, scallops, squid) until just cooked.
Add 250 mL of heavy cream and 50 g of grated Parmesan cheese, stir until the sauce thickens.
Toss the linguine with the seafood Alfredo sauce, season with salt and pepper.
Serve garnished with chopped parsley and additional Parmesan.
description: Rich and creamy Alfredo sauce mixed with a medley of seafood, served over linguine for a luxurious dish.

name: Leek and Gruyère Tart
author: System
method: Sauté 200 g of sliced leeks in 15 mL of butter until soft, about 10 minutes.
Spread the leeks in a pre-baked tart shell, top with 100 g of shredded Gruyère cheese.
Whisk together 3 eggs, 200 mL of cream, salt, and pepper. Pour over the leeks.
Bake at 190°C (375°F) for 25-30 minutes until the filling is set and golden.
Serve warm, garnished with fresh thyme.
description: A savory tart filled with soft leeks and melted Gruyère cheese, encased in a flaky pastry crust.

name: Lemon Rosemary Grilled Squid
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g of squid, cleaned and cut into rings, in a mixture of 30 mL lemon juice, 15 mL olive oil, 10 g chopped rosemary, and 5 g minced garlic for 1 hour.
Grill the squid over high heat for 2-3 minutes per side, until charred and tender.
Serve immediately, garnished with additional lemon wedges and a sprinkle of fresh rosemary.
description: Quickly grilled squid marinated in a lemon and rosemary mix, offering a fresh, zesty flavor ideal for a light meal or appetizer.

name: Lamb Meatball Tagine
author: System
method: Mix 500 g ground lamb with 10 g minced garlic, 10 g cumin, 5 g paprika, salt, and pepper. Form into meatballs.
Brown meatballs in 30 mL olive oil in a tagine or heavy pot. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves, cook until soft. Stir in 400 g diced tomatoes and 5 g each of cinnamon and ginger.
Return meatballs to the pot, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in 30 g chopped cilantro before serving.
Serve with couscous.
description: Spiced lamb meatballs cooked in a savory tomato sauce with traditional Moroccan spices, served in a tagine.

name: Lemon Drizzle Cake
author: System
method: Cream 200 g of butter with 200 g of sugar until fluffy. Beat in 3 eggs one at a time, then stir in 200 g of flour and 5 g of baking powder.
Add zest of 2 lemons and mix well. Pour into a lined loaf tin.
Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 45 minutes. Mix juice of 2 lemons with 100 g of powdered sugar and pour over the hot cake.
Allow to cool in the tin before serving.
description: A moist and tangy lemon cake with a sweet and zesty lemon drizzle topping, perfect for afternoon tea.

name: Lobster Thermidor
author: System
method: Boil 2 whole lobsters for 10 minutes, remove meat and chop. Set aside. Clean and halve the shells.
Sauté 30 g minced shallots in 30 mL butter until translucent. Stir in 30 mL flour, cook for 1 minute.
Slowly add 250 mL milk and 125 mL white wine, stirring until thick. Mix in lobster meat, 5 g mustard, and 10 g chopped tarragon. Season with salt and pepper.
Fill lobster shells with the mixture, top with 50 g grated Gruyère cheese and grill until golden.
Serve immediately.
description: A luxurious French dish featuring succulent lobster in a creamy wine sauce, baked in its shell with Gruyère cheese.

name: Lime Coconut Rice
author: System
method: In a saucepan, combine 250 g of jasmine rice, 250 mL of coconut milk, 250 mL of water, and the zest of 1 lime.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 18 minutes.
Fluff with a fork, stir in juice of 1 lime and 10 g chopped cilantro. Season with salt.
Serve as a side to grilled meats or curries.
description: Fluffy jasmine rice cooked in coconut milk, infused with lime zest and juice, and finished with fresh cilantro.

name: Lobster Bisque with Saffron
author: System
method: Steam 2 lobsters, extract meat, and chop. Set aside shells.
Sauté lobster shells in 30 mL of olive oil with 1 chopped onion, 1 chopped carrot, and 1 chopped celery stalk until vegetables are soft.
Add 100 mL of brandy and flambé. Add 500 mL of fish stock, a pinch of saffron, and simmer for 30 minutes. Strain and reserve the broth.
In another pot, melt 30 g of butter, add 30 g of flour to make a roux, then gradually pour in reserved broth and 250 mL of cream. Simmer until thickened.
Add chopped lobster meat, season with salt and pepper, and heat through.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh chives.
description: A rich and creamy lobster bisque enhanced with the luxurious flavor of saffron, perfect for a special occasion.

name: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Pasta
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of spaghetti until al dente; drain, reserving some pasta water.
In a large skillet, heat 30 mL of olive oil, add 10 g minced garlic, and sauté until fragrant.
Add 500 g of shrimp and cook until pink. Deglaze the pan with 50 mL of white wine.
Add the zest and juice of 1 lemon, toss with pasta, adding reserved pasta water as needed.
Stir in 15 g of chopped parsley, season with salt and pepper, and serve topped with grated Parmesan.
description: Light and refreshing pasta dish featuring plump shrimp sautéed with garlic and lemon, tossed with spaghetti.

name: Lentil Salad with Roasted Veggies
author: System
method: Roast 200 g of chopped carrots, 200 g of diced sweet potatoes, and 200 g of red bell peppers in the oven at 200°C (392°F) with olive oil, salt, and pepper for 25 minutes.
Cook 300 g of green lentils in boiling water until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain.
In a large bowl, combine lentils with roasted vegetables, 15 mL of balsamic vinegar, and 30 mL of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve chilled or at room temperature, garnished with fresh parsley.
description: A hearty and healthy lentil salad mixed with a medley of roasted vegetables, dressed in a simple balsamic vinaigrette.

name: Lamb Gyros with Tzatziki Sauce
author: System
method: Slice 500 g of lamb shoulder thinly. Marinate in a mix of 30 mL olive oil, 10 g minced garlic, 5 g oregano, and juice of 1 lemon for 3 hours.
Cook lamb in a skillet over medium-high heat until browned.
Serve on pita bread with sliced tomatoes, onions, and homemade tzatziki made from 200 g Greek yogurt, 50 g grated cucumber, 5 mL lemon juice, and 5 g minced garlic.
Roll up the gyros and serve immediately.
description: Deliciously seasoned lamb slices wrapped in soft pita with fresh vegetables and creamy tzatziki sauce, a classic Greek street food.

name: Lemon Basil Scallop Pasta
author: System
method: Sear 400 g of scallops in 15 mL of olive oil for 2 minutes on each side until golden and set aside.
In the same pan, add 5 g of minced garlic and sauté until fragrant. Deglaze the pan with 50 mL of white wine.
Add the zest and juice of one lemon, 30 mL of chopped fresh basil, and 200 mL of cream. Simmer until slightly thickened.
Toss with 400 g of cooked linguine, add scallops back to the pan, and heat through. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve garnished with additional basil leaves.
description: Elegant pasta dish combining seared scallops with a creamy lemon basil sauce, perfect for a sophisticated dinner.

name: Lavender Infused Lemonade
author: System
method: In a saucepan, bring 500 mL of water to a boil with 100 g of sugar and 5 g of dried lavender. Remove from heat and let steep for 20 minutes.
Strain the lavender and stir in the juice of 3 lemons and 500 mL of cold water.
Chill in the refrigerator. Serve over ice and garnish with lemon slices and lavender sprigs.
description: Refreshing and aromatic lemonade infused with the subtle flavor of lavender, a perfect drink for relaxing on a warm day.

name: Lobster Rolls
author: System
method: Boil 4 lobsters, extract the meat and chop. Mix lobster meat with 30 mL of mayonnaise, 5 mL of lemon juice, and 5 g of chopped chives.
Butter and lightly toast 4 split-top hot dog buns.
Fill each bun with the lobster mixture. Serve immediately with a side of coleslaw.
description: Classic New England-style lobster rolls with a simple dressing served in buttery toasted buns, perfect for a summer meal.

name: Linguine with Clams and Chorizo
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of linguine al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a skillet, sauté 100 g of chopped chorizo until crisp. Remove chorizo and set aside.
In the same skillet, add 1 chopped garlic clove and 200 g of clams. Cover and cook until clams open, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the chorizo back to the skillet along with the linguine, toss with 30 mL of olive oil, and heat through.
Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with chopped parsley.
description: A vibrant pasta dish featuring linguine tossed with fresh clams and spicy chorizo, bursting with flavors.

name: Lime-Cilantro Rice
author: System
method: Cook 300 g of white rice according to package instructions. Fluff with a fork and set aside to cool slightly.
Mix in the zest and juice of 2 limes, 30 g of chopped cilantro, and season with salt.
Serve as a flavorful side dish to complement grilled meats or fish.
description: A fresh and zesty side dish, white rice enhanced with lime and cilantro, offering a tangy complement to any main course.

name: Lamb Tagine with Prunes
author: System
method: Brown 1 kg of lamb shoulder, cut into chunks, in 30 mL of olive oil. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves of minced garlic, cook until soft.
Return the lamb to the pot with 200 g of prunes, 500 mL of beef broth, 5 g of cinnamon, 5 g of ground ginger, and 5 g of saffron. Cover and simmer for 2 hours until the lamb is tender.
Serve with couscous and garnish with toasted almonds and fresh cilantro.
description: A traditional Moroccan dish featuring tender lamb slow-cooked with sweet prunes and aromatic spices, served with fluffy couscous.

name: Lemon Meringue Pie
author: System
method: Prepare a pastry crust in a 9-inch pie dish and bake until lightly golden.
Cook 250 mL of lemon juice, 200 g of sugar, 30 mL of cornstarch, and 250 mL of water in a saucepan until thickened. Stir in 30 g of butter and 3 beaten egg yolks. Pour into the baked pie shell.
Beat 3 egg whites with 100 g of sugar to make meringue. Spread over the lemon filling.
Bake at 175°C (350°F) for 10 minutes or until the meringue is golden.
Cool before serving.
description: Classic dessert featuring a crisp pastry shell filled with tangy lemon custard and topped with a fluffy meringue.

name: Loaded Baked Potato Skins
author: System
method: Halve 4 large baked potatoes and scoop out the flesh, leaving a thin layer of potato.
Brush both sides with 30 mL of melted butter and season with salt and pepper. Bake at 200°C (392°F) for 10 minutes on each side until crisp.
Fill with 100 g of cooked bacon bits, 100 g of sour cream, and 100 g of shredded cheddar cheese. Return to the oven just until cheese melts.
Garnish with 30 g of chopped chives and serve hot.
description: Crispy potato skins loaded with bacon, cheese, and sour cream, perfect for a hearty appetizer or snack.

name: Lime Sorbet
author: System
method: In a saucepan, dissolve 200 g of sugar in 500 mL of water over medium heat. Add the zest of 2 limes and simmer for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat, add 120 mL of lime juice, and chill the mixture in the refrigerator.
Once chilled, churn in an ice cream maker according to the manufacturer's instructions.
Freeze until firm, then serve.
description: Refreshing and tangy lime sorbet, a light and icy dessert perfect for cleansing the palate or enjoying on a hot day.

name: Lentil and Bacon Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, render 150 g of chopped bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside.
In the bacon fat, sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 diced carrots, and 2 diced celery stalks until soft.
Add 300 g of rinsed lentils, 1 liter of chicken broth, and bring to a boil. Simmer for 30 minutes or until lentils are tender.
Blend half the soup for a creamy texture, then reintroduce the bacon. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with a dollop of sour cream and extra chopped bacon.
description: Hearty soup made with earthy lentils and rich bacon, blended for creaminess and topped with crisp bacon bits.

name: Mango Chicken Curry
author: System
method: Heat 15 mL vegetable oil in a skillet. Brown 500 g diced chicken breast. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add 1 diced onion and 2 cloves minced garlic, cook until soft. Stir in 10 g curry powder and 5 g turmeric.
Add 300 g diced mango and 200 mL coconut milk. Return chicken to the skillet. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve with rice.
description: A sweet and savory curry that combines tender chicken and ripe mangoes in a creamy coconut sauce, infused with aromatic spices.

name: Mushroom Risotto
author: System
method: In a pot, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 300 g sliced mushrooms and sauté until browned. Set aside.
In the same pot, add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic, cook until translucent. Add 200 g arborio rice, stir to coat in oil.
Gradually add 1 L vegetable broth, stirring constantly, until the rice is creamy and al dente.
Stir in cooked mushrooms, 50 g grated Parmesan, and a knob of butter. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve garnished with parsley and more Parmesan.
description: A classic Italian dish with creamy arborio rice and earthy mushrooms, enriched with Parmesan cheese and a hint of butter.

name: Maple Glazed Salmon
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C. In a bowl, mix 30 mL maple syrup, 15 mL soy sauce, 5 mL garlic powder, and 5 mL ground ginger.
Place 4 salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with foil. Brush with maple mixture.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until salmon is opaque and flakes easily with a fork.
Serve with steamed vegetables and a wedge of lemon.
description: Tender salmon fillets with a sweet and savory glaze of maple syrup and soy sauce, baked to perfection.

name: Moroccan Vegetable Tagine
author: System
method: In a tagine or large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp coriander, and 1 tsp cinnamon. Cook until onion is soft.
Add 200 g chopped carrots, 200 g chopped zucchini, 200 g chopped bell peppers, and 400 g canned tomatoes. Stir well.
Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in 100 g raisins and simmer for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve with couscous and garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.
description: A flavorful and hearty stew with a medley of vegetables and Moroccan spices, slowly simmered to bring out rich flavors.

name: Mushroom Stroganoff
author: System
