method: In a large skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 500 g sliced mushrooms and sauté until browned.
Add 1 diced onion and 2 cloves minced garlic, cook until onion is translucent.
Stir in 15 mL Worcestershire sauce and 200 mL sour cream. Heat gently, do not boil.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve over cooked egg noodles or rice, garnished with chopped parsley.
description: A creamy and comforting vegetarian version of the classic stroganoff, featuring earthy mushrooms in a rich sour cream sauce.

name: Maple Pecan Pie
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C. In a bowl, mix 200 g chopped pecans, 100 mL maple syrup, 100 g brown sugar, 50 mL melted butter, 3 beaten eggs, and 5 mL vanilla extract.
Pour into a prepared pie crust. Bake for 40 minutes or until filling is set.
Cool before serving. Optionally, top with whipped cream.
description: A traditional dessert with a twist, featuring a sweet filling of maple syrup and pecans in a flaky pie crust.

name: Minted Lamb Chops
author: System
method: Marinate 8 lamb chops in a mixture of 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL lemon juice, 10 g chopped mint, 5 g crushed garlic, salt, and pepper for at least 2 hours.
Grill over medium heat for 3-4 minutes per side or to desired doneness.
Serve with a side of mint yogurt sauce and roasted vegetables.
description: Juicy lamb chops infused with fresh mint and garlic, grilled to perfection, and served with a cooling mint yogurt sauce.

name: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
author: System
method: Cook 200 g quinoa according to package instructions, let cool.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, 100 g diced cucumbers, 100 g cherry tomatoes halved, 50 g sliced black olives, and 50 g crumbled feta cheese.
For the dressing, whisk together 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL lemon juice, and 5 g dried oregano. Pour over the salad and toss to combine.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with fresh parsley.
description: A vibrant and healthy salad that brings together quinoa with fresh vegetables and feta cheese, dressed in a light Mediterranean-inspired dressing.

name: Mushroom and Spinach Lasagna
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C. In a skillet, sauté 300 g sliced mushrooms and 200 g spinach until the spinach wilts. Set aside.
In a saucepan, make a béchamel sauce by melting 30 g butter, stirring in 30 g flour, and gradually whisking in 500 mL milk. Cook until thickened. Season with salt and nutmeg.
Layer lasagna sheets, mushroom-spinach mixture, béchamel sauce, and 200 g shredded mozzarella in a baking dish. Repeat layers, finishing with cheese.
Bake for 40 minutes until bubbly and golden. Let sit for 10 minutes before serving.
description: A rich and comforting lasagna layered with earthy mushrooms, nutritious spinach, creamy béchamel sauce, and melted mozzarella.

name: Maple Roasted Carrot Soup
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C. Toss 500 g peeled and chopped carrots with 15 mL maple syrup and 15 mL olive oil. Roast for 30 minutes until tender.
In a pot, sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic in 15 mL olive oil until soft. Add roasted carrots and 750 mL vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer.
Puree the mixture until smooth. Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of cinnamon. Serve hot, garnished with a swirl of cream.
description: A velvety smooth soup made from carrots roasted with maple syrup, blended into a creamy consistency, perfect for a cozy meal.

name: Mango Chutney Chicken Skewers
author: System
method: Marinate 500 g cubed chicken breasts in 100 mL mango chutney, 30 mL lime juice, and 5 g grated ginger for 2 hours.
Thread chicken onto skewers and grill over medium heat until cooked through, about 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and additional mango chutney on the side.
description: Tender chicken skewers marinated in a sweet and tangy mango chutney, grilled to perfection, and perfect for a summer barbecue.

name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 400 g canned chickpeas (drained and rinsed), 100 g diced cucumbers, 100 g cherry tomatoes halved, 50 g sliced black olives, and 50 g crumbled feta cheese.
For the dressing, whisk together 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL lemon juice, and 5 g dried oregano. Pour over the salad and toss to combine.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with fresh parsley.
description: A vibrant and refreshing salad packed with chickpeas, fresh vegetables, and feta, dressed in a simple Mediterranean-inspired dressing.

name: Moroccan Spiced Meatballs
author: System
method: Combine 500 g ground beef with 10 g minced garlic, 10 g chopped parsley, 5 g cumin, 5 g paprika, and salt. Form into 20 meatballs.
Heat 15 mL olive oil in a skillet and brown the meatballs on all sides. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add 200 g diced tomatoes and 100 mL beef broth. Bring to a simmer, return meatballs to the skillet, and cook covered for 15 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with couscous.
description: Juicy beef meatballs infused with traditional Moroccan spices, simmered in a rich tomato sauce.

name: Mushroom Bolognese
author: System
method: In a food processor, pulse 500 g mushrooms until finely chopped. Sauté in a pan with 15 mL olive oil until browned.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, cook until soft. Stir in 100 mL red wine, reduce for 3 minutes.
Add 400 g canned crushed tomatoes, 5 g basil, 5 g oregano, and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve over cooked spaghetti and top with grated Parmesan.
description: A hearty and flavorful vegetarian twist on the classic Bolognese, featuring finely chopped mushrooms in a rich tomato sauce.

name: Mint Chocolate Chip Ice Cream
author: System
method: In a saucepan, heat 500 mL heavy cream with 100 g sugar until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat.
Stir in 5 mL peppermint extract and a few drops of green food coloring. Chill the mixture in the refrigerator.
Churn in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer's instructions. During the last 5 minutes, add 100 g chopped chocolate.
Freeze until firm. Serve garnished with mint leaves.
description: Creamy homemade ice cream with a refreshing mint flavor and rich chocolate chips, a delightful treat for any occasion.

name: Maple Bacon Breakfast Pie
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C. In a skillet, cook 200 g chopped bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels.
In a bowl, beat 6 eggs with 100 mL milk, salt, and pepper. Stir in the bacon and 100 g shredded cheddar cheese.
Pour into a prepared pie crust. Bake for 35 minutes or until the egg mixture is set.
Drizzle with 30 mL maple syrup before serving.
description: A savory breakfast pie with the sweet and salty combination of bacon and maple syrup, encased in a flaky crust.

name: Mango Salsa Chicken
author: System
method: Preheat grill to medium-high. Season 4 chicken breasts with salt and pepper. Grill until cooked through, about 6-7 minutes per side.
For the salsa, mix 200 g diced mango, 50 g diced red bell pepper, 30 g chopped red onion, 10 g chopped cilantro, juice of 1 lime, and salt to taste.
Serve the grilled chicken topped with mango salsa.
description: Juicy grilled chicken breasts topped with a fresh and vibrant mango salsa, perfect for a light and flavorful meal.

name: Miso Glazed Cod
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C. Mix 30 mL miso paste, 15 mL mirin, 15 mL soy sauce, and 10 g sugar to make a glaze.
Brush 4 cod fillets with the miso glaze. Marinate for 30 minutes.
Bake cod in the oven for 12-15 minutes or until flaky and glazed.
Serve with steamed rice and garnish with spring onions.
description: Tender cod fillets coated in a savory miso glaze, baked to perfection, offering a sweet and umami flavor.

name: Mushroom Florentine Pasta
author: System
method: Cook 400 g fettuccine according to package instructions. Drain.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil, sauté 300 g sliced mushrooms until browned. Add 200 g spinach and cook until wilted.
Stir in 200 mL cream and 50 g grated Parmesan. Add cooked pasta, toss to combine. Heat through.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve garnished with more Parmesan.
description: Creamy pasta tossed with sautéed mushrooms and spinach in a rich and creamy sauce, topped with Parmesan cheese.

name: Maple Glazed Ham
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 160°C. Score 1 kg ham and place in a roasting pan.
Mix 100 mL maple syrup, 50 mL Dijon mustard, and 30 g brown sugar to make a glaze.
Brush the ham with half of the glaze and bake for 1 hour. Baste with remaining glaze every 20 minutes.
Serve sliced with extra glaze on the side.
description: A festive and delicious ham glazed with a sweet and tangy maple and mustard sauce, perfect for special occasions.

name: Moroccan Lentil Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil. Sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 2 diced carrots until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add 200 g red lentils, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1 tsp ground coriander, and 1 liter vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 25 minutes.
Blend half the soup to thicken, then return to the pot. Stir in juice of 1 lemon and season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh cilantro and a dollop of yogurt.
description: A hearty and flavorful soup inspired by Moroccan cuisine, featuring spiced lentils and vegetables, brightened with fresh lemon.

name: Maple Mustard Pork Chops
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C. In a bowl, combine 30 mL maple syrup, 20 mL Dijon mustard, and 5 mL apple cider vinegar to make a glaze.
Season 4 pork chops with salt and pepper, brush with the glaze, and place in a baking dish.
Bake for 25 minutes or until the pork is thoroughly cooked. Baste with additional glaze halfway through cooking.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh thyme.
description: Tender pork chops glazed with a sweet and tangy maple mustard sauce, baked to perfection.

name: Mango Coconut Rice Pudding
author: System
method: In a pot, combine 200 g Arborio rice, 400 mL coconut milk, and 200 mL water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer.
Cook uncovered, stirring frequently, until rice is tender and mixture is creamy, about 20 minutes.
Stir in 50 g sugar and 100 g diced mango. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve warm or chilled, garnished with toasted coconut flakes and extra mango pieces.
description: A creamy and tropical rice pudding made with coconut milk and sweet mangoes, topped with toasted coconut.

name: Mushroom and Thyme Tart
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C. Roll out 300 g puff pastry and press into a tart pan. Prick the base with a fork.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil and sauté 300 g sliced mushrooms with 5 g fresh thyme until mushrooms are golden.
Spread mushrooms evenly over the pastry. Beat 3 eggs with 100 mL cream, pour over mushrooms. Top with 50 g grated Gruyère cheese.
Bake for 30 minutes until set and golden. Let cool slightly before serving.
description: A savory tart with a flaky pastry crust, filled with golden sautéed mushrooms and thyme, and a rich custard topping.

name: Minestrone Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 diced carrots, and 2 diced celery stalks. Cook until vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes.
Add 2 minced garlic cloves, 1 tsp dried oregano, and 1 tsp dried basil. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Pour in 1.5 liters of vegetable broth, add 400 g canned diced tomatoes and 200 g chopped green beans. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in 100 g pasta and 400 g canned kidney beans, cook until pasta is al dente. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with grated Parmesan and chopped parsley.
description: A hearty Italian soup packed with vegetables, beans, and pasta, simmered in a rich tomato broth, perfect for a comforting meal.

name: Mexican Beef Tacos
author: System
method: In a skillet, cook 500 g ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 chopped bell pepper. Cook until vegetables are soft.
Stir in 15 mL chili powder, 5 mL cumin, and 200 g canned crushed tomatoes. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve the beef mixture in warm tortillas with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese, and sour cream.
description: Traditional Mexican tacos filled with flavorful ground beef and vegetables, spiced with chili and cumin, and topped with fresh toppings.

name: Mango Banana Smoothie
author: System
method: In a blender, combine 1 peeled and sliced mango, 1 frozen banana, 200 mL yogurt, and 30 mL honey.
Blend until smooth. If the smoothie is too thick, add a little water or ice to achieve the desired consistency.
Serve immediately, garnished with a slice of mango or a few mint leaves.
description: A creamy and refreshing smoothie made with sweet mango and ripe banana, blended with yogurt and a touch of honey for a nutritious treat.

name: Mushroom Spinach Quiche
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C. Roll out 300 g pie dough and fit into a 9-inch pie pan. Prick the bottom with a fork.
In a skillet, sauté 200 g sliced mushrooms and 150 g spinach until the spinach is wilted. Spread evenly over the pie crust.
In a bowl, whisk together 3 eggs, 200 mL cream, salt, and pepper. Pour over the mushroom-spinach mixture.
Bake for 35-40 minutes until the filling is set and the top is golden. Let cool before serving.
description: A savory quiche with a flaky crust, filled with a delicious mixture of mushrooms and spinach, bound together with a creamy egg custard.

name: Mediterranean Chickpea Stew
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil. Sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 diced bell pepper until soft.
Add 1 tsp smoked paprika, 1 tsp cumin, and 400 g canned chickpeas (drained). Cook for 2 minutes.
Stir in 400 g diced tomatoes and 500 mL vegetable broth. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Add 100 g spinach and cook until wilted. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley and a squeeze of lemon.
description: A hearty and nutritious stew with chickpeas and vegetables, seasoned with Mediterranean spices and finished with fresh spinach.

name: Maple Roasted Brussels Sprouts
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C. Toss 500 g Brussels sprouts with 15 mL olive oil, 30 mL maple syrup, and salt to taste.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25 minutes, until caramelized and tender.
Sprinkle with 30 g chopped pecans and roast for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve warm, topped with a drizzle of balsamic glaze.
description: Crispy Brussels sprouts caramelized with maple syrup and enhanced with the crunch of pecans, finished with a balsamic glaze.

name: Mushroom Risotto Cakes
author: System
method: Prepare 400 g mushroom risotto according to recipe, cool in fridge until firm.
Form risotto into 8 cakes. Dip each cake into flour, then beaten egg, then breadcrumbs.
In a skillet, heat 30 mL olive oil and fry cakes until golden on each side, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Serve hot with a side of marinara sauce for dipping.
description: Crispy, golden risotto cakes made from flavorful mushroom risotto, perfect for a satisfying appetizer or main dish.

name: Mint Julep
author: System
method: In a pitcher, muddle 10 mint leaves with 10 mL sugar. Add 60 mL bourbon and stir.
Fill two glasses with crushed ice. Pour the bourbon mixture over the ice.
Garnish with a sprig of mint and serve immediately.
description: A refreshing classic cocktail featuring bourbon and mint, perfect for a hot day or a festive occasion.

name: Mango Avocado Salsa
author: System
method: In a bowl, combine 200 g diced mango, 200 g diced avocado, 50 g diced red onion, 10 g chopped cilantro, juice of 1 lime, and salt to taste.
Gently mix until well combined. Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving to let the flavors meld.
Serve as a topping for grilled chicken or fish, or enjoy with tortilla chips as an appetizer.
description: A vibrant and refreshing salsa made with sweet mangoes, creamy avocado, and a hint of citrus, perfect for summer gatherings.

name: Mozzarella Stuffed Meatballs
author: System
method: Mix 500 g ground beef with 50 g breadcrumbs, 1 beaten egg, 5 g minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Form into 12 balls.
Press a small cube of mozzarella into the center of each meatball, sealing the cheese inside.
Brown meatballs in a skillet with 15 mL olive oil, then add 400 g marinara sauce. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve hot with spaghetti or on a hoagie roll for a meatball sub.
description: Juicy meatballs filled with gooey mozzarella cheese, simmered in a rich tomato sauce, perfect for pasta night or as a hearty sandwich filling.

name: Mediterranean Stuffed Peppers
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C. Halve 4 bell peppers and remove seeds. Blanch in boiling water for 5 minutes, then drain.
In a skillet, cook 200 g ground turkey with 1 diced onion, 2 cloves minced garlic, until turkey is browned.
Stir in 100 g cooked quinoa, 50 g crumbled feta, 30 g chopped olives, 1 tsp dried oregano, and season with salt and pepper.
Stuff peppers with the turkey mixture, top with more feta. Bake for 20 minutes.
Serve with a drizzle of olive oil and fresh parsley.
description: Flavorful bell peppers stuffed with a savory mixture of ground turkey, quinoa, and Mediterranean flavors, topped with feta cheese.

name: Maple Cinnamon Apple Chips
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 110°C. Core and thinly slice 4 apples.
Arrange apple slices in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Mix 30 mL maple syrup with 5 g ground cinnamon, brush over apple slices.
Bake for 2-3 hours, flipping halfway through, until crisp.
Cool completely on a wire rack before serving.
description: Crispy homemade apple chips sweetened with maple syrup and spiced with cinnamon, a healthy and tasty snack.

name: Maple Glazed Chicken
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C. In a small bowl, mix 50 mL maple syrup, 15 mL Dijon mustard, and 5 mL apple cider vinegar to make a glaze.
Season 4 chicken breasts with salt and pepper, place in a baking dish, and brush with the maple glaze.
Bake for 25 minutes, basting occasionally with the glaze, until chicken is cooked through.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh thyme leaves.
description: Tender chicken breasts coated with a sweet and tangy maple syrup glaze, baked to perfection.

name: Mushroom and Garlic Bruschetta
author: System
method: In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 200 g sliced mushrooms and sauté until golden. Add 10 g minced garlic and cook for 1 more minute.
Season with salt and pepper. Spoon the mushroom mixture onto toasted slices of baguette.
Drizzle with a little more olive oil and sprinkle with chopped parsley before serving.
description: Crispy bruschetta topped with savory sautéed mushrooms and garlic, perfect for an appetizer or a light meal.

name: Moroccan Chicken Tagine
author: System
method: In a tagine or large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves, cook until soft.
Add 500 g chicken pieces, 1 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp cumin, and 1 tsp cinnamon. Brown the chicken.
Pour in 500 mL chicken broth and add 100 g dried apricots and 50 g sliced almonds. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with couscous.
description: A traditional Moroccan dish with chicken and aromatic spices, slow-cooked with apricots and almonds for a touch of sweetness.

name: Mexican Corn Salad
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 500 g cooked corn kernels, 1 diced red bell pepper, 50 g chopped red onion, and 50 g chopped cilantro.
Whisk together 15 mL lime juice, 30 mL mayonnaise, and 5 g chili powder. Pour over the corn mixture and toss to coat.
Chill for 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with crumbled cotija cheese.
description: A bright and zesty corn salad with a creamy lime dressing, perfect for picnics or as a side dish to grilled meats.

name: Mint and Pea Risotto
author: System
method: In a large saucepan, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 1 finely chopped onion and cook until translucent.
Stir in 200 g Arborio rice, cook for 1 minute. Gradually add 1 L vegetable broth, stirring frequently, until the rice is creamy and al dente, about 18 minutes.
Add 150 g fresh peas and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in 30 g chopped fresh mint, 50 g grated Parmesan, salt, and pepper.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra Parmesan and mint leaves.
description: A fresh and light risotto enriched with vibrant peas and refreshing mint, perfect for a spring meal.

name: Mango Pulled Pork
author: System
method: In a slow cooker, combine 1 kg pork shoulder with 200 mL mango juice, 50 mL apple cider vinegar, and 30 g brown sugar. Cook on low for 8 hours until tender.
Shred the pork with two forks, then stir back into the cooking liquid. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve on buns with mango slices and a dollop of coleslaw.
description: Tender pork shoulder slow-cooked in a sweet and tangy mango sauce, shredded and served in a sandwich with fresh mango and crisp coleslaw.

name: Miso Soup with Tofu
author: System
method: In a pot, bring 1 L water to a simmer. Dissolve 30 g miso paste in a little hot water, then add to the pot.
Add 200 g cubed silken tofu and 10 g chopped scallions. Simmer gently for 5 minutes, being careful not to boil.
Serve hot, garnished with nori strips and extra scallions.
description: A traditional Japanese soup with a savory miso base, soft tofu, and scallions, perfect for a light meal or starter.

name: Mushroom and Asparagus Frittata
author: System
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C. In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil. Sauté 200 g sliced mushrooms and 100 g chopped asparagus until tender.
In a bowl, whisk together 6 eggs, 30 mL milk, salt, and pepper. Pour over the vegetables in the skillet.
Cook on the stove top over medium heat until the edges begin to set, about 5 minutes. Transfer skillet to oven.
Bake for 10 minutes or until frittata is set. Serve warm, garnished with grated Parmesan.
description: A wholesome egg frittata packed with earthy mushrooms and fresh asparagus, baked to perfection.

name: Mango Curry Chicken
author: System
method: In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 500 g diced chicken breast and brown all sides.
Add 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves minced garlic, cook until translucent.
Stir in 200 mL coconut milk, 100 mL mango puree, 1 tsp curry powder, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve over steamed rice, garnished with fresh cilantro.
description: A sweet and spicy chicken curry made with mango puree and coconut milk, offering a perfect balance of flavors.

name: Maple Pecan Baked Oatmeal
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C. In a bowl, mix 200 g rolled oats, 50 g chopped pecans, 1 tsp cinnamon, and 1 tsp baking powder.
In another bowl, whisk together 2 beaten eggs, 200 mL milk, 50 mL maple syrup, and 30 mL melted butter.
Combine wet and dry ingredients. Pour into a greased baking dish.
Bake for 25 minutes until set and golden. Serve warm with additional maple syrup.
description: A warm, comforting baked oatmeal dish enhanced with the flavors of maple syrup and pecans, perfect for a hearty breakfast.

name: Mediterranean Baked Cod
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C. Place 4 cod fillets in a baking dish.
Top each fillet with a slice of lemon, a sprinkle of dried oregano, and a drizzle of olive oil.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until cod is flaky and cooked through.
Serve with a side of sautéed spinach and garlic.
description: Light and flaky cod fillets seasoned with Mediterranean flavors, baked with lemon and oregano for a simple yet delicious meal.

name: Mango Lassi
author: System
method: In a blender, combine 200 g ripe mango, 200 mL plain yogurt, 50 mL milk, and 10 g sugar.
Blend until smooth. Add ice cubes and blend again.
Serve chilled, garnished with a sprinkle of ground cardamom.
description: A refreshing and creamy traditional Indian drink made with ripe mangoes and yogurt, sweetened lightly and served cold.

name: Mushroom and Barley Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 200 g sliced mushrooms, 1 chopped onion, and 2 minced garlic cloves. Cook until the mushrooms are golden.
Add 100 g pearl barley, 1.5 liters vegetable broth, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the barley is tender, about 30 minutes.
Stir in 100 g chopped kale and cook for another 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
description: A hearty and comforting soup featuring earthy mushrooms and chewy barley, enriched with kale for added nutrients.

name: Mint Chocolate Mousse
author: System
method: Melt 150 g dark chocolate in a double boiler, then cool slightly. Stir in 5 mL peppermint extract.
Whip 200 mL heavy cream to soft peaks. Fold half into the chocolate mixture until smooth, then fold in the remaining cream.
Divide into serving dishes and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Serve garnished with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.
description: A decadent and airy chocolate mousse flavored with a hint of mint, perfect for a luxurious dessert.

name: Maple Caramel Popcorn
author: System
method: Pop 100 g popcorn kernels and place in a large bowl.
In a saucepan, combine 100 mL maple syrup, 50 g butter, and 50 g brown sugar. Bring to a boil and cook without stirring for 5 minutes.
Pour the hot maple caramel over the popcorn and stir quickly to coat evenly.
Spread on a baking sheet to cool. Break into pieces before serving.
description: Crunchy popcorn coated in a sweet maple caramel, perfect for snacking or sharing during a movie night.

name: Mushroom Alfredo Pasta
author: System
method: Cook 400 g fettuccine according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a skillet, melt 30 g butter and sauté 300 g sliced mushrooms until browned. Add 2 minced garlic cloves and cook for 1 minute.
Add 200 mL heavy cream and 100 g grated Parmesan cheese. Stir until the sauce thickens.
Toss the pasta in the sauce, season with salt and pepper, and heat through.
Serve garnished with parsley and additional Parmesan.
description: A creamy and comforting pasta dish featuring fettuccine tossed with a rich mushroom Alfredo sauce, perfect for a satisfying meal.

name: Mexican Shrimp Ceviche
author: System
method: Mix 500 g cooked, peeled shrimp with 100 g diced tomatoes, 50 g diced cucumber, 50 g diced red onion, and 1 minced jalapeño.
Add juice of 2 limes, 10 mL olive oil, and a handful of chopped cilantro. Season with salt and pepper.
Chill for at least 1 hour before serving to allow flavors to meld. Serve with crispy tortilla chips.
description: A refreshing and zesty ceviche with tender shrimp and a mix of fresh vegetables, marinated in lime juice, perfect for a light appetizer.

name: Maple Roasted Sweet Potatoes
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C. Cube 600 g sweet potatoes and toss with 30 mL maple syrup, 15 mL olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 30 minutes, stirring halfway through, until tender and caramelized.
Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh thyme before serving.
description: Sweet potatoes roasted to perfection with a touch of maple syrup, creating a sweet and savory side dish.

name: Mushroom Stuffed Bell Peppers
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C. Halve 4 bell peppers and remove seeds. Parboil for 5 minutes, then drain.
In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil and sauté 200 g chopped mushrooms, 1 diced onion, and 2 minced garlic cloves until tender.
Mix mushroom mixture with 100 g cooked quinoa, 50 g crumbled feta, salt, and pepper. Stuff into bell peppers.
Bake for 20 minutes. Serve hot, topped with chopped parsley.
description: Bell peppers stuffed with a savory filling of mushrooms, quinoa, and feta, baked until perfectly tender.

name: Minty Pea Soup
author: System
method: In a pot, heat 15 mL butter. Add 1 chopped onion and cook until soft. Add 500 g frozen peas and cover with 1 liter of vegetable broth.
Simmer for 10 minutes. Add a handful of fresh mint leaves and blend the soup until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot, garnished with a swirl of cream and more mint leaves.
description: A vibrant and refreshing soup of sweet peas and fresh mint, blended into a smooth and creamy consistency.

name: Mango Chicken Salad
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 300 g cooked, shredded chicken breast, 200 g diced mango, 100 g chopped celery, and 50 g sliced almonds.
In a separate bowl, whisk together 30 mL mayonnaise, 15 mL honey, and juice of one lime.
Pour dressing over chicken mixture and toss to coat evenly. Chill for 30 minutes before serving.
Serve on a bed of lettuce or with whole-grain bread.
description: A refreshing and light salad with tender chicken, sweet mango, and crunchy almonds, dressed in a sweet and tangy sauce.

name: Minted Lamb Burgers
author: System
method: In a bowl, mix 500 g ground lamb with 30 g finely chopped fresh mint, 10 g minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Form the mixture into 4 patties and grill over medium heat until cooked to desired doneness, about 5 minutes per side.
Serve on toasted buns with yogurt sauce and sliced cucumber.
description: Juicy lamb burgers infused with fresh mint and garlic, grilled to perfection and served with a cool yogurt sauce.

name: Mushroom Leek Quiche
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C. Roll out 300 g pie dough and fit into a 9-inch quiche dish. Prick the base with a fork.
Sauté 200 g sliced mushrooms and 100 g chopped leeks in 15 mL butter until tender.
Whisk together 4 eggs, 200 mL cream, salt, and pepper. Stir in the cooked vegetables.
Pour the egg mixture into the pie crust. Bake for 35 minutes until set and golden.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
description: A savory quiche with a flaky crust, filled with a delicious mixture of mushrooms and leeks, and a creamy egg custard.

name: Maple Dijon Roasted Carrots
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C. Toss 500 g peeled and trimmed carrots with 15 mL olive oil, 30 mL maple syrup, and 15 mL Dijon mustard.
Spread carrots in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast for 30 minutes, turning once, until caramelized and tender.
Serve sprinkled with chopped parsley.
description: Sweet and tangy roasted carrots glazed with a maple Dijon dressing, a perfect side dish for any meal.

name: Maple Walnut Scones
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C. In a large bowl, combine 250 g all-purpose flour, 50 g sugar, 1 tsp baking powder, and a pinch of salt.
Cut in 75 g cold butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in 75 g chopped walnuts.
Mix 100 mL heavy cream and 30 mL maple syrup, then fold into the dry ingredients until just combined.
Turn out onto a floured surface, form into a circle, and cut into 6 wedges. Place on a baking sheet and brush with extra cream.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until golden brown. Drizzle with additional maple syrup before serving.
description: Flaky and buttery scones enriched with maple syrup and crunchy walnuts, perfect for a breakfast treat or afternoon tea.

name: Moroccan Spiced Veggie Burgers
author: System
method: In a food processor, combine 400 g canned chickpeas (drained), 100 g grated carrot, 50 g breadcrumbs, 1 minced garlic clove, 1 tsp cumin, and 1 tsp coriander.
Pulse until well combined but still slightly chunky. Form into 4 patties.
Heat 15 mL olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook patties for 4-5 minutes on each side until golden and firm.
Serve on whole-wheat buns with lettuce, tomato, and a yogurt-tahini sauce.
description: Flavor-packed veggie burgers with a Moroccan twist, featuring chickpeas and aromatic spices, served with a creamy tahini sauce.

name: Mango Chia Pudding
author: System
method: In a bowl, mix 400 mL coconut milk with 50 g chia seeds and 30 mL honey. Stir well.
Refrigerate overnight or at least 6 hours until the chia seeds have absorbed the liquid and the pudding has thickened.
Blend 200 g ripe mango into a puree and layer with the chia pudding in serving glasses.
Serve chilled, garnished with additional mango cubes and mint leaves.
description: A tropical and healthy dessert or breakfast option, featuring layers of creamy chia pudding and fresh mango puree.

name: Mexican Style Cornbread
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C. In a bowl, mix 150 g cornmeal, 100 g all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking powder, and 1 tsp salt.
Add 1 beaten egg, 100 mL milk, and 50 mL vegetable oil. Stir in 100 g grated cheddar cheese and 50 g chopped jalapeños.
Pour batter into a greased baking pan and bake for 20-25 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.
Serve warm, sliced, with a dollop of sour cream.
description: A savory and spicy cornbread infused with jalapeños and cheddar cheese, perfect as a side dish or a hearty snack.

name: Miso Eggplant Stir-Fry
author: System
method: In a skillet, heat 15 mL sesame oil over medium heat. Add 500 g diced eggplant and sauté until browned and soft.
Mix 30 mL miso paste, 15 mL soy sauce, 15 mL honey, and 5 mL rice vinegar in a small bowl. Pour over the eggplant and stir to coat.
Add 100 g sliced red bell peppers and 50 g snap peas, cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds and sliced green onions.
description: A flavorful and easy stir-fry featuring tender eggplant and crisp vegetables, all coated in a savory miso sauce.

name: Maple Glazed Pork Chops
author: System
method: Season 4 pork chops with salt and pepper. In a skillet, heat 15 mL olive oil over medium heat and sear the pork chops until golden, about 4 minutes per side.
Mix 50 mL maple syrup, 15 mL apple cider vinegar, and 5 mL Dijon mustard. Brush this mixture over the pork chops during the last minute of cooking.
Serve the pork chops with the pan sauce drizzled over the top and a side of roasted vegetables.
description: Juicy pork chops with a sweet and tangy maple glaze, perfectly seared to lock in the flavors.

name: Mushroom Risotto with Truffle Oil
author: System
method: In a large pot, sauté 300 g sliced mushrooms in 15 mL olive oil until browned. Remove mushrooms and set aside.
Add another 15 mL olive oil to the pot, cook 1 chopped onion until translucent. Add 200 g Arborio rice, stir for 1 minute.
Gradually add 1 L warm chicken broth, stirring continuously, until the rice is creamy and al dente.
Stir in the cooked mushrooms, 50 g grated Parmesan, and a drizzle of truffle oil. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with additional Parmesan and a few drops of truffle oil.
description: A luxurious risotto enriched with earthy mushrooms and elevated with a hint of truffle oil, creating a rich and decadent dish.

name: Mint and Cucumber Gazpacho
author: System
method: In a blender, combine 500 g chopped cucumber, 250 g Greek yogurt, 30 mL olive oil, juice of 1 lemon, and 10 g fresh mint leaves.
Blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
Serve cold, garnished with additional mint leaves and diced cucumber.
description: A refreshing and light gazpacho with a blend of cucumber, mint, and tangy yogurt, perfect for hot weather.

name: Maple Bacon Breakfast Wraps
author: System
method: Cook 200 g bacon until crispy. Set aside on paper towels to drain.
Scramble 6 eggs in the bacon fat, seasoning with salt and pepper.
Lay out 4 large tortillas, spread each with 15 mL maple syrup, then top with scrambled eggs, bacon, and 50 g shredded cheddar cheese.
Roll up tightly, then toast in a dry skillet until golden on both sides.
Serve warm, sliced in half.
description: Savory breakfast wraps filled with crispy bacon, fluffy scrambled eggs, and melted cheese, with a touch of maple syrup for sweetness.

name: Mango Black Bean Salad
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 400 g rinsed and drained black beans, 200 g diced mango, 100 g diced red bell pepper, and 50 g chopped red onion.
Whisk together 30 mL olive oil, juice of 1 lime, 5 g cumin, and salt and pepper to taste. Pour over salad and toss to combine.
Chill for at least 1 hour before serving, garnished with fresh cilantro.
description: A vibrant and refreshing salad featuring the sweetness of mango and the heartiness of black beans, dressed in a lime-cumin vinaigrette.

name: Moroccan Spiced Cauliflower Soup
author: System
method: Roast 500 g chopped cauliflower at 200°C for 20 minutes with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
In a pot, sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves in 15 mL olive oil until soft. Add 1 tsp each of cumin, coriander, and smoked paprika.
Add roasted cauliflower, 750 mL vegetable broth, and bring to a simmer for 15 minutes. Blend until smooth.
Serve hot, topped with a dollop of yogurt and chopped coriander.
description: A creamy soup with the rich flavors of Moroccan spices and tender roasted cauliflower, topped with yogurt for added richness.

name: Mushroom Spinach Stuffed Chicken
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C. Butterfly 4 chicken breasts and flatten with a meat mallet.
Sauté 200 g chopped mushrooms and 150 g spinach until the spinach is wilted. Season with garlic, salt, and pepper.
Divide the mushroom mixture among chicken breasts, roll up and secure with toothpicks.
Bake for 25 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through. Serve sliced with a drizzle of balsamic glaze.
description: Juicy chicken breasts stuffed with a flavorful mixture of mushrooms and spinach, baked to perfection and enhanced with a balsamic glaze.

name: Mango Coconut Curry
author: System
method: In a large skillet, heat 15 mL coconut oil over medium heat. Add 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves, sauté until translucent.
Stir in 1 tbsp curry powder, 1 tsp turmeric, and 500 g cubed chicken breast. Cook until chicken is evenly browned.
Pour in 400 mL coconut milk and 200 mL chicken broth, bring to a simmer. Add 200 g diced mango and simmer for 20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve over steamed rice, garnished with fresh cilantro.
description: A rich and creamy curry that blends sweet mango and coconut with savory spices, served over rice for a fulfilling meal.

name: Mediterranean Fish Stew
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 15 mL olive oil. Add 1 chopped fennel bulb, 1 chopped onion, and 3 cloves minced garlic. Cook until soft.
Stir in 400 g diced tomatoes, 500 mL fish stock, and a pinch of saffron. Bring to a simmer.
Add 500 g mixed fish fillets, cut into chunks, and simmer gently for 10 minutes.
Season with salt, pepper, and a splash of white wine. Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.
description: A hearty stew featuring a variety of fish and aromatic vegetables, infused with Mediterranean flavors, perfect for a cold evening.

name: Maple Nut Granola
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 150°C. In a large bowl, mix 300 g rolled oats, 100 g chopped almonds, 50 g pumpkin seeds, and 50 g sunflower seeds.
In a small saucepan, warm 50 mL maple syrup, 30 mL vegetable oil, and 1 tsp vanilla extract. Pour over the oat mixture and stir to coat.
Spread on a baking sheet and bake for 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes, until golden and crispy.
Let cool completely and store in an airtight container. Serve with yogurt or milk.
description: Homemade granola with a sweet maple flavor and a crunchy mix of nuts and seeds, ideal for a nutritious breakfast or snack.

name: Mini Mushroom Pies
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C. Roll out 400 g puff pastry and cut into 12 circles. Press into a muffin tin.
Sauté 300 g chopped mushrooms and 1 diced onion in 15 mL butter until all the moisture evaporates.
Spoon mushroom mixture into pastry cases. Top each with a small slice of brie.
Bake for 20 minutes until the pastry is golden. Serve warm.
description: Delightful mini pies filled with a savory mushroom mixture, topped with creamy brie, perfect for appetizers or parties.

name: Molasses Spice Cookies
author: System
method: In a bowl, cream together 100 g butter and 150 g brown sugar until fluffy. Beat in 1 egg and 50 mL molasses.
In another bowl, whisk together 250 g flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp ground ginger, 1 tsp cinnamon, and 1/2 tsp cloves.
Gradually mix dry ingredients into the wet. Chill dough for 1 hour.
Roll dough into balls, coat in granulated sugar, and place on baking sheets. Bake at 180°C for 10 minutes.
Let cool on a wire rack before serving.
description: Soft and chewy cookies flavored with molasses and a blend of spices, rolled in sugar for a slight crunch.

name: Nutmeg Spiced Carrot Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 cloves of minced garlic in 30 mL of olive oil until translucent.
Add 500 g of chopped carrots and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in 1 liter of vegetable broth and add 5 g of ground nutmeg. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 25 minutes until carrots are soft.
Puree the soup in a blender until smooth. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, garnished with a dollop of sour cream and chopped parsley.
description: A creamy, soothing carrot soup subtly flavored with nutmeg, perfect for a comforting meal.

name: Nori Wrapped Salmon
author: System
method: Season 4 salmon fillets with salt and pepper.
Wrap each fillet with a sheet of nori seaweed.
Steam the wrapped fillets for 10 minutes or until salmon is cooked through.
Serve with a side of steamed rice and soy sauce for dipping.
description: Delicate salmon fillets encased in crispy nori, offering a unique twist with a hint of the ocean.

name: Nectarine Basil Salad
author: System
method: Slice 4 ripe nectarines and combine in a bowl with 200 g of mixed salad greens.
Add 50 g of sliced red onions and 50 g of crumbled goat cheese.
Whisk together 30 mL of balsamic vinegar, 30 mL of olive oil, 5 g of chopped basil, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
Toss the salad with the dressing just before serving.
description: A fresh and fruity salad with juicy nectarines, sharp red onion, and creamy goat cheese, dressed with a basil-infused balsamic vinaigrette.

name: New England Clam Chowder
author: System
method: In a pot, render 100 g of chopped bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside.
Add 1 diced onion and 2 diced celery stalks to the bacon fat, cook until soft.
Stir in 30 g of flour, then gradually add 500 mL of clam juice and 500 mL of milk, stirring constantly until thickened.
Add 200 g of chopped clams and 300 g of diced potatoes, simmer for 20 minutes until potatoes are tender.
Mix in bacon, season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with oyster crackers.
description: A hearty and creamy clam chowder with bacon, a staple of New England cuisine, served with oyster crackers for added crunch.

name: Nasi Goreng
author: System
method: In a wok, heat 30 mL of vegetable oil. Add 2 beaten eggs and scramble until just set. Remove and set aside.
Add another 15 mL of oil to the wok. Sauté 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 200 g of chopped chicken until the chicken is browned.
Add 400 g of cooked and chilled rice, 50 mL of kecap manis, 5 mL of soy sauce, and scrambled eggs. Stir-fry until well mixed and heated through.
Serve topped with sliced cucumber, tomato wedges, and a fried egg on each serving.
description: Indonesian fried rice, known as Nasi Goreng, mixed with pieces of chicken and flavored with sweet soy sauce, garnished with fresh cucumber and tomato.

name: Nutty Nectarine Crisp
author: System
method: Slice 4 nectarines and place in a baking dish.
In a bowl, mix 100 g of rolled oats, 50 g of flour, 50 g of brown sugar, 50 g of chopped nuts, and 50 g of melted butter until crumbly.
Sprinkle the oat mixture over the nectarines.
Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 30 minutes or until the topping is golden and the fruit is bubbly.
Serve warm, optionally with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
description: A delightful dessert of sliced nectarines under a crunchy oat and nut topping, perfect with a scoop of ice cream.

name: Nori Seaweed Salad
author: System
method: Soak 20 g of dried nori seaweed in water for 10 minutes, then drain and chop.
Mix nori with 100 g of sliced cucumbers, 50 g of shredded carrots, and 30 g of sliced radishes.
Whisk together 30 mL of soy sauce, 15 mL of sesame oil, 15 mL of rice vinegar, and 5 g of sugar for the dressing.
Toss the salad with the dressing and chill for 20 minutes before serving.
Garnish with sesame seeds.
description: A crisp and refreshing salad featuring nori seaweed with fresh vegetables, dressed in a tangy Asian-inspired sauce.

name: Navy Bean and Ham Soup
author: System
method: Soak 500 g of navy beans overnight, then drain.
In a large pot, cook 200 g of diced ham, 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 2 diced carrots in 30 mL of olive oil until onion is translucent.
Add soaked beans, 1.5 liters of chicken broth, and 5 g of thyme. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 1 hour or until beans are tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.
description: A hearty and comforting soup made with navy beans and ham, simmered in a flavorful broth with fresh vegetables and herbs.

name: Nutmeg Pumpkin Pie
author: System
method: Mix 500 g of pumpkin puree with 3 beaten eggs, 200 g of sugar, 250 mL of evaporated milk, 5 g of ground nutmeg, and 5 g of cinnamon.
Pour into a prepared pie crust and bake at 175°C (350°F) for 45 minutes or until set.
Cool completely on a wire rack. Serve with whipped cream.
description: Classic pumpkin pie spiced with nutmeg and cinnamon, a staple of holiday tables and cozy gatherings.

name: Nicoise Salad
author: System
method: Boil 200 g of baby potatoes until tender, then slice. Cook 150 g of green beans in boiling water for 4 minutes, then cool in ice water.
Arrange a bed of mixed greens on a platter. Top with the potatoes, green beans, 4 hard-boiled eggs quartered, 200 g of tuna flakes, and 100 g of halved cherry tomatoes.
Scatter over 50 g of pitted black olives and anchovies to taste.
Whisk together 30 mL of olive oil, 15 mL of red wine vinegar, 5 g of Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper for the dressing.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad before serving.
description: A traditional French salad with a mix of leafy greens, potatoes, green beans, tuna, eggs, and a tangy vinaigrette.

name: Nectarine and Prosciutto Pizza
author: System
method: Roll out 500 g of pizza dough and place on a baking sheet. Preheat oven to 220°C (428°F).
Spread 100 g of ricotta cheese over the dough as the base layer.
Top with 150 g of sliced nectarines, 100 g of torn prosciutto, and 50 g of arugula.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until the crust is golden and crisp.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze before serving.
description: A savory and sweet pizza combining the flavors of fresh nectarines, salty prosciutto, and peppery arugula, finished with a balsamic glaze.

name: New Potato and Chive Salad
author: System
method: Boil 500 g of new potatoes until tender, then cool and slice.
Mix potatoes with 30 g of chopped chives, 50 g of sour cream, 30 mL of mayonnaise, salt, and pepper.
Chill for at least 1 hour before serving to allow flavors to meld.
Garnish with additional chives before serving.
description: Creamy potato salad enhanced with fresh chives, perfect as a side dish for picnics or barbecues.

name: Nut-Crusted Halibut
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 200°C (392°F).
In a bowl, mix 100 g of finely chopped mixed nuts with 50 g of breadcrumbs and 5 g of dried parsley.
Season 4 halibut fillets with salt and pepper, brush with 30 mL of melted butter, and press the nut mixture onto the top of each fillet.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the fish flakes easily with a fork and the crust is golden.
Serve with lemon wedges and steamed asparagus.
description: Elegant halibut fillets coated with a crunchy nut crust, baked to perfection for a delightful texture contrast.

name: Nashville Hot Chicken
author: System
method: Marinate 4 chicken breasts in a mixture of 240 mL buttermilk, 10 g paprika, and 5 g garlic powder for 4 hours in the fridge.
Mix 200 g flour, 5 g cayenne pepper, and salt for the breading. Dredge marinated chicken in the flour mixture.
Deep fry the chicken at 175°C (350°F) for 7-8 minutes until golden and cooked through.
Brush with a spicy mixture of melted butter, 10 g cayenne pepper, 5 g brown sugar, and 15 mL hot sauce.
Serve with white bread slices and pickles.
description: Spicy and flavorful fried chicken coated with a fiery cayenne-infused glaze, a popular Southern specialty.

name: Nori Wrapped Tuna Steaks
author: System
method: Season 4 tuna steaks with salt and pepper. Wrap each steak with a sheet of nori seaweed.
Sear the wrapped steaks in 30 mL of sesame oil over high heat for 2 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Slice and serve with a dipping sauce made from 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL mirin, and 5 mL wasabi paste.
description: Succulent tuna steaks wrapped in nori, seared to perfection, and served with a flavorful dipping sauce.

name: New Orleans Gumbo
author: System
method: Make a roux by cooking 50 g flour and 50 g butter in a pot until browned, about 4 minutes.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 chopped celery stalks, and 1 green bell pepper, cook until soft.
Stir in 500 g sliced andouille sausage, 200 g okra, and 1 L chicken broth. Simmer for 45 minutes.
Add 200 g peeled shrimp, cook until shrimp are pink, about 5 minutes.
Season with 5 g cajun seasoning, salt, and pepper. Serve with rice.
description: A hearty and spicy stew with andouille sausage and shrimp, thickened with a dark roux and okra, embodying the essence of Cajun cuisine.

name: Nutella Cheesecake
author: System
method: Mix 200 g crushed graham crackers with 50 g melted butter for the crust. Press into the bottom of a springform pan.
Blend 500 g cream cheese, 200 g Nutella, 100 g sugar, and 3 eggs until smooth.
Pour the filling over the crust and bake at 160°C (320°F) for 50 minutes.
Cool in the pan, then chill for at least 4 hours before serving. Garnish with whipped cream and hazelnuts.
description: Rich and creamy cheesecake infused with the hazelnut and chocolate flavors of Nutella, topped with whipped cream and hazelnuts.

name: Nacho Cheese Dip
author: System
method: In a saucepan, melt 30 g of butter over medium heat. Stir in 30 g of flour and cook for 1 minute.
Gradually add 500 mL of milk, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens.
Remove from heat and mix in 200 g of grated cheddar cheese until smooth. Stir in 30 mL of chopped jalapeños and 5 g of paprika.
Serve warm with tortilla chips.
description: A creamy and spicy nacho cheese dip, perfect for parties or as a comforting snack.

name: Nori Maki Sushi
author: System
method: Prepare 400 g of sushi rice according to package instructions and season with 30 mL of rice vinegar.
Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo mat, spread rice evenly, leaving a 1 cm border.
Place 50 g of sliced cucumber, 50 g of sliced avocado, and 100 g of crab meat along the center.
Roll tightly using the bamboo mat. Slice into 6 pieces and serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.
description: Traditional Japanese sushi rolls filled with cucumber, avocado, and crab meat, wrapped in nori.

name: New York Strip Steak
author: System
method: Season 4 New York strip steaks with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Heat a skillet over high heat, add 15 mL of olive oil, and sear the steaks for 4 minutes on each side for medium-rare.
Let rest for 5 minutes before serving with a side of garlic mashed potatoes and steamed broccoli.
description: Juicy New York strip steaks, perfectly seared to a medium-rare finish, served with classic sides.

name: No-Bake Nutella Cheesecake
author: System
method: Combine 200 g crushed graham crackers with 50 g melted butter. Press into the bottom of a springform pan and chill.
Mix 500 g cream cheese, 300 g Nutella, and 100 g powdered sugar until smooth. Fold in 200 mL whipped cream.
Spread the filling over the crust and refrigerate for 6 hours or overnight.
Top with chopped hazelnuts and a drizzle of chocolate sauce before serving.
description: A decadent no-bake cheesecake with a creamy Nutella filling and a crunchy graham cracker crust, topped with hazelnuts.

name: Nectarine Upside-Down Cake
author: System
method: Arrange sliced nectarines in a buttered and sugared 23 cm (9 inch) cake pan.
Prepare the cake batter by creaming together 100 g sugar and 100 g butter, then beating in 2 eggs one at a time. Fold in 200 g flour and 5 g baking powder.
Pour the batter over the nectarines and bake at 180°C (356°F) for 35 minutes.
Let cool for 10 minutes, then invert onto a plate. Serve warm or at room temperature.
description: A beautiful and moist upside-down cake with caramelized nectarines on top, perfect as a summertime dessert.

name: Norwegian Salmon with Dill Sauce
author: System
method: Season 4 salmon fillets with salt and pepper. Grill over medium heat until cooked through, about 4 minutes per side.
For the sauce, simmer 200 mL of cream and 5 g of fresh dill until thickened, then season with salt and lemon juice to taste.
Serve the salmon with the dill sauce, accompanied by steamed asparagus and boiled new potatoes.
description: Grilled salmon fillets served with a creamy dill sauce, a classic Norwegian dish accompanied by fresh vegetables.

name: Nasi Lemak
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of rice with 400 mL of coconut milk, 400 mL of water, and a pandan leaf tied into a knot.
Serve the rice with fried anchovies, sliced cucumber, roasted peanuts, hard-boiled eggs, and spicy sambal on the side.
Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
description: A traditional Malaysian dish featuring fragrant coconut milk rice accompanied by a variety of savory condiments.

name: New Mexico Green Chile Stew
author: System
method: Brown 500 g of cubed pork shoulder in a pot with 30 mL of vegetable oil.
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 minced garlic cloves, and cook until the onion is translucent.
Stir in 300 g of chopped roasted green chiles, 500 g of diced potatoes, 1 liter of chicken broth, and simmer for 1 hour or until pork is tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve with warm tortillas.
description: A hearty and spicy stew made with tender pork, potatoes, and roasted New Mexico green chiles, served with tortillas for a comforting meal.

name: New York-Style Bagel with Lox
author: System
method: Toast 4 New York-style bagels until golden and crispy.
Spread each bagel half with 30 g of cream cheese.
Top with 50 g of thinly sliced smoked salmon, a few capers, and thinly sliced red onion.
Garnish with a sprinkle of fresh dill and serve immediately.
description: Classic New York-style bagels topped with creamy cream cheese, smoked salmon, capers, and onions, garnished with dill.

name: Nutty Banana Bread
author: System
method: Mash 3 ripe bananas in a large bowl. Add 100 g melted butter, 200 g sugar, 1 beaten egg, and 5 mL vanilla extract, mixing well.
Combine 250 g flour, 5 g baking soda, and a pinch of salt in another bowl.
Fold the dry ingredients into the banana mixture until just blended. Stir in 100 g of chopped walnuts.
Pour into a greased loaf pan and bake at 175°C (350°F) for 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
description: Moist and flavorful banana bread enriched with crunchy walnuts, perfect for breakfast or as a sweet snack.

name: Nigerian Jollof Rice
author: System
method: In a large pot, heat 30 mL of vegetable oil. Add 1 finely chopped onion, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and fry until translucent.
Stir in 400 g of tomato puree and cook for 10 minutes. Add 1 teaspoon of thyme, 1 teaspoon of curry powder, and 1 Scotch bonnet pepper, finely chopped.
Add 500 g of washed and drained long-grain rice, 750 mL of chicken broth, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 30 minutes or until the rice is tender.
Stir in 100 g of frozen peas and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve with fried plantains and grilled chicken.
description: A vibrant and spicy West African dish featuring rice cooked in a flavorful tomato sauce with spices, served with sides of plantains and chicken.

name: Noodles with Peanut Sauce
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of noodles according to package instructions, drain, and set aside.
For the sauce, blend 100 g of peanut butter, 30 mL of soy sauce, 15 mL of honey, 15 mL of sesame oil, and 30 mL of water until smooth.
Toss the noodles with the peanut sauce, 50 g of sliced scallions, and 50 g of chopped cilantro.
Serve garnished with crushed peanuts and a lime wedge for squeezing.
description: A quick and easy dish of noodles coated in a creamy, savory peanut sauce, garnished with fresh herbs and nuts.

name: Norwegian Cod with Herb Crust
author: System
method: Preheat the oven to 200°C (392°F).
Mix 100 g breadcrumbs, 30 g chopped parsley, 5 g chopped dill, and zest of 1 lemon. Stir in 30 mL melted butter to moisten the mixture.
Season 4 cod fillets with salt and pepper. Place on a baking sheet and press the breadcrumb mixture onto the top of each fillet.
Bake for 12-15 minutes until the crust is golden and the fish is cooked through.
Serve with lemon wedges and steamed green beans.
description: Tender cod fillets topped with a crispy herb and lemon breadcrumb crust, baked to perfection.

name: Nashville Hot Cauliflower
author: System
method: Cut 1 head of cauliflower into florets. Dip each floret into a batter made from 100 g flour, 5 g paprika, salt, and 150 mL water.
Fry the florets in 500 mL vegetable oil until golden and crispy.
Brush with a spicy mixture of 15 mL hot sauce, 10 g cayenne pepper, 5 mL brown sugar, and 30 mL melted butter.
Serve hot with slices of white bread and pickles.
description: A vegetarian take on the classic Nashville hot chicken, featuring spicy and crispy battered cauliflower florets.

name: Neapolitan Ice Cream Cake
author: System
method: Line a springform pan with plastic wrap. Soften 500 mL each of vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry ice cream.
Layer the vanilla ice cream at the bottom, freeze for 30 minutes. Add the chocolate layer, freeze for another 30 minutes. Top with the strawberry layer and freeze overnight.
Unmold and remove the plastic wrap. Top with whipped cream and chocolate shavings before serving.
description: A delightful ice cream cake with layers of vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry ice cream, topped with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.

name: Niçoise Tuna Pasta Salad
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of pasta according to package instructions, drain and cool.
Mix the pasta with 200 g of canned tuna, 100 g of halved cherry tomatoes, 150 g of cooked green beans, 50 g of black olives, and 30 g of capers.
For the dressing, whisk together 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL lemon juice, 5 g Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper.
Toss the salad with the dressing and chill for 1 hour before serving. Garnish with chopped parsley.
description: A refreshing and hearty pasta salad featuring classic Niçoise ingredients with a zesty lemon and olive oil dressing.

name: Nori Tempura
author: System
method: Prepare a tempura batter by mixing 100 g of flour, 5 g of baking powder, a pinch of salt, and 150 mL of ice-cold water.
Cut 4 sheets of nori into quarters. Heat 500 mL of vegetable oil in a deep fryer to 180°C (356°F).
Dip nori pieces into the batter, then fry for 2-3 minutes until crispy.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with a dipping sauce made from soy sauce and wasabi.
description: Crispy nori seaweed pieces coated in a light tempura batter, deep-fried to golden perfection and served with a spicy dipping sauce.

name: Napa Cabbage Stir-Fry
author: System
method: Heat 15 mL of sesame oil in a large wok. Add 1 chopped garlic clove and 5 g of grated ginger, stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add 500 g of chopped Napa cabbage and 100 g of sliced carrots. Stir-fry for 5 minutes until vegetables are tender but still crisp.
Stir in 30 mL of soy sauce and 5 mL of rice vinegar. Cook for an additional minute.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve immediately.
description: A quick and easy stir-fry featuring Napa cabbage and carrots, seasoned with garlic, ginger, and soy sauce for a flavorful side dish.

name: Nut and Berry Breakfast Parfait
author: System
method: In glasses, layer 200 g of Greek yogurt, 50 g of mixed nuts, and 100 g of mixed berries.
Repeat the layers until the glasses are filled.
Top with a drizzle of honey and a sprinkle of granola for added crunch.
Serve immediately or chill until ready to serve.
description: A healthy and delicious breakfast option featuring layers of creamy Greek yogurt, crunchy nuts, fresh berries, and granola.

name: Nigerian Pepper Soup
author: System
method: In a large pot, combine 1 kg of cubed beef with 1 liter of water, 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves of minced garlic, and 10 g of pepper soup spice.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour until the meat is tender.
Add 200 g of diced potatoes and cook for another 20 minutes until the potatoes are tender.
Season with salt and serve hot, garnished with chopped cilantro.
description: A spicy and hearty soup from Nigeria featuring tender beef and potatoes, flavored with traditional pepper soup spices.

name: Nutmeg Spiced Sweet Potato Fries
author: System
method: Preheat the oven to 220°C (428°F).
Cut 500 g of sweet potatoes into fries. Toss with 15 mL of olive oil, 5 g of nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes, turning halfway through, until crispy and golden.
Serve hot with a side of garlic aioli.
description: Crispy sweet potato fries seasoned with a hint of nutmeg, perfect for a savory snack or side dish.

name: Nectarine and Prosciutto Bruschetta
author: System
method: Toast 8 slices of ciabatta bread.
Spread each slice with a thin layer of ricotta cheese.
Top with slices of ripe nectarine and thin slices of prosciutto.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and sprinkle with chopped basil before serving.
description: A delightful combination of sweet nectarines and savory prosciutto on crispy toasted ciabatta, enhanced with balsamic glaze.

name: New England Seafood Chowder
author: System
method: In a large pot, cook 200 g chopped bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside, leaving fat in the pot.
Add 1 chopped onion and 2 diced celery stalks to the pot, cook until soft.
Stir in 30 g of flour to create a roux, then slowly add 1 liter of fish stock and 500 mL of cream, stirring constantly.
Add 200 g of diced potatoes, 200 g of chopped clams, and 200 g of corn kernels. Simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in 200 g of cooked shrimp, season with salt and pepper. Heat through.
Serve the chowder garnished with the crispy bacon and chopped chives.
description: A rich and hearty chowder packed with clams, shrimp, and vegetables, topped with crispy bacon.

name: Noodle Salad with Ginger Sesame Dressing
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of soba noodles according to package instructions, then rinse under cold water and drain.
In a large bowl, combine noodles with 100 g of sliced red bell pepper, 100 g of shredded carrots, and 50 g of sliced green onions.
For the dressing, whisk together 30 mL of soy sauce, 15 mL of sesame oil, 15 mL of rice vinegar, 10 g of grated ginger, and 5 g of minced garlic.
Toss the noodles and vegetables with the dressing. Chill for 30 minutes before serving.
Garnish with toasted sesame seeds and fresh cilantro.
description: A refreshing noodle salad with crisp vegetables and a bold ginger sesame dressing, perfect for a light meal or side dish.

name: Nectarine Tart with Almond Frangipane
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C (356°F).
Roll out 1 pre-made pie crust and press into a tart pan. Blind bake for 10 minutes.
Mix 100 g ground almonds, 100 g sugar, 100 g softened butter, and 1 egg to make frangipane. Spread into the tart shell.
Top with slices from 4 nectarines arranged in a spiral.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden and set. Cool before serving with a dusting of powdered sugar.
description: A delicious tart featuring sweet nectarines and a rich almond frangipane in a flaky pastry crust.

name: Nasi Kuning
author: System
method: Wash 500 g of rice and cook with 400 mL of coconut milk, 400 mL of water, 1 lemongrass stalk, and 2 kaffir lime leaves.
Add 1 teaspoon of turmeric and a pinch of salt before cooking.
Once cooked, remove the lemongrass and lime leaves, and serve with fried shallots, sliced cucumber, and hard-boiled eggs.
description: Aromatic Indonesian yellow rice cooked with coconut milk and turmeric, garnished with fresh condiments.

name: Noodle Bowl with Spicy Peanut Sauce
author: System
method: Cook 400 g of rice noodles as per package instructions, drain and set aside.
For the sauce, blend 100 g peanut butter, 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL honey, 15 mL lime juice, and 10 g chili flakes.
Toss noodles with the spicy peanut sauce, 100 g shredded carrots, and 100 g sliced bell peppers.
Top with crushed peanuts and fresh cilantro before serving.
description: A vibrant and spicy noodle bowl with a creamy peanut sauce, colorful vegetables, and a crunchy peanut topping.

name: Norwegian Lefse
author: System
method: Combine 500 g mashed potatoes, 200 g flour, 5 g salt, and 50 mL melted butter to form a dough.
Roll out dough thinly, cook on a hot griddle for 2-3 minutes per side until lightly browned.
Serve with butter and sugar, or use as a wrap for savory fillings.
description: Traditional Norwegian flatbreads made from potatoes, rolled very thin and cooked on a griddle, versatile and delicious with both sweet and savory toppings.

name: New Orleans Beignets
author: System
method: Mix 500 g of flour, 50 g sugar, 5 g salt, 7 g yeast in a large bowl. Add 250 mL warm water and 50 mL melted butter, mix to form a dough. Let rise for 2 hours.
Roll out dough to 1/4 inch thickness, cut into 2-inch squares.
Fry squares in 500 mL vegetable oil at 180°C (356°F) until puffed and golden. Drain on paper towels.
Dust with powdered sugar and serve warm.
description: Classic New Orleans beignets, deep-fried until puffy and dusted with a generous amount of powdered sugar.

name: Niçoise Omelette
author: System
method: Whisk 8 eggs with salt and pepper. Stir in 100 g chopped olives, 100 g diced tomatoes, and 50 g sliced green beans.
Pour egg mixture into a heated non-stick skillet with 15 mL olive oil. Cook over medium heat until eggs are set but slightly runny on top.
Fold the omelette in half and slide onto a plate. Serve hot with crusty bread.
description: A hearty omelette filled with the flavors of a traditional Niçoise salad, including olives, tomatoes, and green beans.

name: Napa Cabbage Kimchi
author: System
method: Slice 1 kg of Napa cabbage into chunks. Salt heavily and let sit for 2 hours to draw out moisture. Rinse and drain.
Make a paste of 30 g grated ginger, 40 g minced garlic, 50 mL fish sauce, 15 mL soy sauce, and 100 g gochugaru (Korean chili powder).
Mix cabbage with the paste, add 100 g sliced radishes and 50 g sliced scallions.
Pack into a jar, pressing down to submerge in brine. Seal and let ferment at room temperature for 2 days, then refrigerate.
Serve chilled as a side dish or with rice.
description: Traditional Korean kimchi made with Napa cabbage, spiced up with chili, garlic, and ginger for a potent and tangy side dish.

name: No-Cook Avocado Gazpacho
author: System
method: In a blender, combine 2 peeled and pitted avocados, 1 chopped cucumber, 2 peeled and seeded tomatoes, 1 deseeded and chopped green bell pepper, 1 chopped onion, 2 cloves of garlic, 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL red wine vinegar, salt, and pepper.
Blend until smooth. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
Serve cold, garnished with diced cucumber, a drizzle of olive oil, and cracked black pepper.
description: A refreshing and creamy avocado gazpacho, perfect for hot summer days, with a rich blend of vegetables and a tangy vinegar kick.

name: Nectarine Cobbler
author: System
method: Preheat the oven to 190°C (375°F).
Slice 6 nectarines and mix with 100 g sugar and 5 mL lemon juice. Pour into a baking dish.
For the topping, combine 150 g flour, 100 g sugar, 5 g baking powder, and a pinch of salt. Cut in 75 g butter until crumbly. Stir in 125 mL milk to form a dough.
Drop spoonfuls of dough over the nectarine mixture. Bake for 35 minutes until the topping is golden.
Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.
description: A sweet and juicy nectarine cobbler, topped with a golden, biscuit-like crust, perfect for a summer dessert.

name: No-Bake Chocolate Nut Bars
author: System
method: Line an 8-inch square pan with parchment paper.
Melt 200 g dark chocolate with 150 g peanut butter in a saucepan over low heat, stirring until smooth.
Remove from heat and stir in 100 g chopped nuts and 50 g rolled oats.
Pour the mixture into the prepared pan, smooth the top, and refrigerate until set, about 2 hours.
Cut into bars and serve.
description: Decadent no-bake bars combining dark chocolate and peanut butter with nuts and oats, a quick and easy treat.

name: Nigerian Fried Rice
author: System
method: In a large skillet, heat 30 mL vegetable oil. Fry 200 g chopped mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, sweet corn) for 5 minutes.
Add 500 g cooked rice, 100 g cooked shrimp, and 50 g diced ham. Fry, stirring frequently, for another 5 minutes.
Stir in 15 mL soy sauce and 5 g curry powder. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with sliced green onions.
description: A flavorful Nigerian-inspired fried rice with vegetables, shrimp, and ham, seasoned with soy sauce and curry powder.

name: Nutella Stuffed Pancakes
author: System
method: Prepare pancake batter using 200 g flour, 300 mL milk, 1 egg, and a pinch of salt.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour 75 mL of batter for each pancake.
Drop 15 g of Nutella into the center of each pancake, then cover with a little more batter.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook the other side until golden.
Serve warm with powdered sugar and extra Nutella.
description: Delightful fluffy pancakes with a warm Nutella center, dusted with powdered sugar for a decadent breakfast or dessert.

name: Nutmeg Mashed Sweet Potatoes
author: System
method: Boil 1 kg of peeled and cubed sweet potatoes until tender, about 20 minutes.
Drain and return to pot. Add 50 g butter, 50 mL heavy cream, 5 g salt, and 5 g grated nutmeg. Mash until smooth.
Adjust seasoning and serve hot, garnished with a sprinkle of cinnamon.
description: Creamy mashed sweet potatoes enhanced with a hint of nutmeg and cinnamon, a comforting side dish perfect for any meal.

name: Nectarine Spinach Salad
author: System
method: In a large bowl, combine 150 g fresh spinach, 2 sliced nectarines, 50 g crumbled feta cheese, and 50 g toasted almonds.
For the dressing, whisk together 30 mL olive oil, 15 mL balsamic vinegar, 5 mL honey, salt, and pepper.
Toss the salad with the dressing just before serving.
description: A fresh and vibrant salad featuring juicy nectarines, crisp spinach, feta cheese, and crunchy almonds with a sweet balsamic dressing.

name: No-Churn Vanilla Ice Cream
author: System
method: Whip 500 mL heavy cream until stiff peaks form.
Fold in 1 can (397 g) of sweetened condensed milk and 5 mL vanilla extract.
Pour into a loaf pan and freeze for at least 6 hours or until firm.
Serve scooped into bowls or cones.
description: Easy, creamy homemade vanilla ice cream that doesn't require an ice cream maker, perfect for a sweet treat anytime.

name: Nashville Hot Tofu
author: System
method: Slice 400 g of firm tofu into 1/2-inch thick slabs. Press between paper towels to remove excess moisture.
Dredge tofu in a mixture of 100 g flour, 5 g paprika, salt, and pepper.
Fry in 250 mL vegetable oil until crispy. Drain on paper towels.
Brush with a hot sauce mixture made from 30 mL hot sauce, 10 g cayenne pepper, 30 mL vegetable oil, and 5 mL maple syrup.
Serve with pickles and white bread.
description: Crispy fried tofu slabs coated with a spicy, slightly sweet Nashville-style hot sauce, served in the traditional style with bread and pickles.

name: Nori and Sesame Seed Crackers
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C (356°F).
Mix 200 g of whole wheat flour, 50 g of sesame seeds, 5 g of salt, and 5 g of crushed nori sheets in a bowl.
Add 50 mL of water and 30 mL of sesame oil to form a dough. Roll out thinly and cut into squares.
Bake on a lined baking sheet for 15-20 minutes until crisp and golden.
Cool on a wire rack and serve.
description: Crispy homemade crackers infused with the umami flavor of nori and the nuttiness of sesame seeds, perfect for snacking.

name: New York Cheesecake
author: System
method: Mix 200 g of crushed graham crackers with 50 g melted butter. Press into the bottom of a springform pan.
Beat 800 g of cream cheese with 200 g sugar, 10 mL vanilla extract, and 4 eggs until smooth.
Pour filling over the crust and bake at 160°C (320°F) for 1 hour. Turn off the oven and let cool inside for another hour.
Chill overnight. Serve with fresh strawberries and whipped cream.
description: A rich and creamy classic New York cheesecake with a graham cracker crust, served with fresh strawberries and whipped cream.

name: Nutmeg Roasted Chicken
author: System
method: Rub a whole chicken with a mixture of 30 mL olive oil, 5 g salt, 5 g black pepper, and 5 g grated nutmeg.
Stuff the cavity with lemon quarters and a few sprigs of thyme.
Roast in a preheated oven at 190°C (374°F) for 1.5 hours or until juices run clear.
Let rest before carving. Serve with roasted vegetables.
description: Succulent whole chicken seasoned with nutmeg and roasted to perfection, accompanied by aromatic herbs and roasted veggies.

name: No-Knead Olive Bread
author: System
method: Combine 400 g of bread flour, 300 mL of water, 5 g of yeast, and 10 g of salt in a bowl. Stir in 100 g of pitted and chopped olives.
Cover the bowl with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place for 18 hours.
Shape into a loaf without kneading, then let rise for another 2 hours.
Bake in a preheated oven at 230°C (446°F) for 35 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack before slicing.
description: Easy no-knead bread studded with flavorful olives, featuring a crispy crust and a chewy interior.

name: Nectarine Galette
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 190°C (375°F).
Roll out a single pie crust into a rough circle on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Toss 500 g of sliced nectarines with 50 g of sugar and 10 g of flour. Arrange the nectarine slices in the center of the crust, leaving a 5 cm (2 inch) border.
Fold the edges over the fruit, pleating as necessary. Brush the crust with beaten egg and sprinkle with coarse sugar.
Bake for 35-40 minutes until the crust is golden and the fruit is bubbly. Cool slightly before serving with a dollop of whipped cream.
description: A rustic and charming galette filled with fresh nectarines, perfect for a simple yet elegant dessert.

name: Nori Salmon Poke Bowl
author: System
method: Cook 300 g of sushi rice according to package instructions, then cool to room temperature.
Mix 400 g of cubed salmon with 30 mL soy sauce, 15 mL sesame oil, and 5 g of finely chopped nori.
Assemble the bowls by dividing the rice among 4 bowls, top with seasoned salmon, 100 g of sliced cucumber, 100 g of shredded carrots, and 50 g of diced avocado.
Garnish with sesame seeds and a drizzle of spicy mayo.
description: A delectable poke bowl featuring sushi rice, fresh salmon seasoned with nori, and a variety of fresh vegetables, topped with sesame seeds and spicy mayo.

name: New Zealand Lamb Chops
author: System
method: Rub 8 lamb chops with a mixture of 5 g rosemary, 5 g thyme, salt, and pepper.
Grill over medium heat for 4-5 minutes on each side or until desired doneness.
Rest for 5 minutes before serving with mint jelly and roasted potatoes.
description: Juicy grilled lamb chops seasoned with fresh herbs, perfect for a hearty dinner, accompanied by mint jelly and roasted potatoes.

name: No-Sugar Granola Bars
author: System
method: Preheat oven to 180°C (356°F).
Mix 300 g of oats, 100 g of chopped almonds, 50 g of sunflower seeds, and 100 g of chopped dried fruit.
Warm 150 mL of honey and 50 mL of peanut butter in a saucepan until smooth. Pour over the dry ingredients and mix well.
Press mixture into a lined 20x20 cm (8x8 inch) baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes.
Cool completely before cutting into bars.
description: Healthy homemade granola bars with no added sugar, packed with oats, nuts, seeds, and dried fruit, bound with natural honey and peanut butter.

name: Nutmeg French Toast
author: System
method: Whisk together 4 eggs, 200 mL milk, 10 g sugar, 5 g ground nutmeg, and a pinch of salt.
Dip 8 slices of thick white bread into the egg mixture, ensuring both sides are coated.
Cook on a heated non-stick skillet with a little butter over medium heat until golden brown, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Serve hot with maple syrup and fresh berries.
description: Classic French toast enhanced with the warm flavor of nutmeg, served with sweet maple syrup and fresh berries.

name: Nashville Hot Brussel Sprouts
author: System
method: Halve 500 g of Brussel sprouts and toss with 15 mL olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Roast in a preheated oven at 200°C (392°F) for 20 minutes until crispy.
Mix 30 mL hot sauce, 5 g cayenne pepper, 5 mL honey, and 5 mL apple cider vinegar.
Toss the roasted sprouts in the sauce and serve immediately.
description: Spicy and tangy Nashville-style hot Brussel sprouts, a delicious twist on a classic side dish.

name: New England Lobster Rolls
author: System
method: Boil 4 lobsters, extract the meat and chop coarsely.
Mix lobster meat with 30 mL mayonnaise, 5 mL lemon juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Butter and lightly toast 4 hot dog buns.
Fill each bun with the lobster mixture. Garnish with a sprinkle of chives and serve immediately.
description: A quintessential summer sandwich featuring sweet, succulent lobster meat lightly dressed in mayonnaise and served in a toasted bun.

name: No-bake Nutty Protein Bars
author: System
method: Mix 200 g rolled oats, 100 g chopped nuts, 50 g chia seeds, and 100 g dried fruit in a bowl.
Warm 150 mL peanut butter and 100 mL honey in a saucepan until combined. Pour over the oat mixture and stir until evenly coated.
Press the mixture firmly into a lined 20x20 cm (8x8 inch) baking dish. Chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
Cut into bars and serve or store in an airtight container.
description: Healthy and easy-to-make no-bake protein bars packed with oats, nuts, and seeds, perfect for a quick snack or post-workout boost.

name: Noodle Soup with Shiitake Mushrooms
author: System
method: In a large pot, sauté 1 chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves in 15 mL of sesame oil until translucent.
Add 200 g of sliced shiitake mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in 1.5 liters of vegetable broth, add 200 g of noodles, and bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes or until noodles are tender.
Stir in 50 mL of soy sauce and 5 g of freshly grated ginger. Serve hot, garnished with chopped green onions and a sprinkle of sesame seeds.
description: A soothing noodle soup with earthy shiitake mushrooms, enriched with the flavors of garlic, ginger, and soy sauce.

name: No-Bake Lime Cheesecake
author: System
method: Combine 200 g crushed digestive biscuits with 50 g melted butter. Press into the bottom of a springform pan and chill.
Whisk together 300 g cream cheese, 100 mL condensed milk, juice and zest of 2 limes until smooth.
Pour over the biscuit base and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or until set.
Garnish with lime slices before serving.
description: A refreshing and creamy no-bake cheesecake with the zesty flavor of lime, set atop a buttery biscuit base.

name: Nutmeg and Clove Spiced Coffee
